showerReviews.reviewText: The gym equipment here is very complete. There are also gym equipment for people with disabilities. There are also equipment for wheelchair users. The gym is very accessible for wheelchair maneuvers, all floors are flat. Inside the gym there are staff who will help if you have difficulty using the equipment. Oh yes, there are special lockers for disabled/wheelchair users. There is a free tap water refill in the gym. The gym is clean although sometimes there are a few equipment that smell of sweat and I think that's normal. I highly recommend this gym for wheelchair users. There are special prices for disabled.

The pool is frequently too busy to swim without feeling harassed, the services such as the dryer for your swim costume hasn‚Äôt worked in over 6 months, now half the changing area is out of action and an increasing number of private swimming lessons make it impossible to find a reasonable time for a swim. Classes are okay but the (female) changing rooms are horrific. Broken benches that have had hazard signs on them for weeks with no sign of when they‚Äôre gonna be fixed. No machine to dry your swimsuit anymore, not a single hook by the shower to hang your towel, the shower water is weak (nowhere near strong enough to actually wash any soap off) quite cold and you can‚Äôt adjust the temperature and on top of all that they charge you to use their lockers.

Considering people pay a significant amount of money to use this gym I‚Äôm shocked. The gym overall has such a polished and brand new feel and yet I cannot believe how poorly designed it is.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Really lovely place to swim in the heart of London's West End. Apart from Sydney & Budapest I cannot think of any other major city that offers such easy to access i.e. no membership required and centrally located pool in such a good and clean condition. Friendly staff. On my swim people were swimming at an appropriate pace for the lane speed. Being your own padlock, towel and shower gel.
It is becoming expensive though, seems a bit unjust that those who work and make an economic contribution pay twice as much as the unemployed and non working. For a tourist who loves to swim worth coming in for a few laps.
showerReviews.author: R Smith

showerReviews.reviewText:
Such a shame, this is my local leisure centre, it provides good facilities for gym, swimming, etc.

However, as of recently they have banned folding bikes from being brought into the leisure centre to be locked up behind the gates. This is my method of transport to get to the centre, and given ever rising bike theft in London, and no real guarentees about the safety on outdoor racks for expensive bikes I'll have to be cancelling my membership.

I've been told that this "comes from the top", where clearly the single centre manager had a knee-jerk reaction to some bad actors leaving bikes in the wrong place.
showerReviews.author: Giles Winchester

showerReviews.reviewText:
OK value swimming pool near the City. ¬£7.30 for a 50 minute session (July 2025).
Pool is 30m long, which is novel. Outside lane is slightly narrow. Pace signs are in place, which were more or less respected when I was there. Water temperature pleasant, not too warm for a decent workout. Some pull buoys and kick boards are available to use. Pool is very shallow indeed at the shallow end.
Changing rooms are not particularly clean, but functional. ¬£1 coin needed for the lockers (returned when you leave).
Beware, if you're booking a 06.30 swim, the building doesn't actually open its doors until 06.30 so you will pay unnecessarily for time you lose while you're queueing and getting changed. it probably explains why there were plenty of slots free when I booked; I suspect people book the 06.40 but just go in early.
Finally, you have to use the "Better" app to book in advance, which is not convenient if you're not a UK resident because you have to fill in your address details and it doesn't accept non - UK format postcodes.
showerReviews.author: Gavin Hodgson

showerReviews.reviewText: On a good day, this is an excellent spa, however recently many of the facilities haven‚Äôt been working including the steam room, the plunge pool and all the cold water showers. The lack of cold water seems a particular shame as most people look for the hot-cold sauna experience. After three visits as described above, I sent an email. Disappointingly the spa declined responsibility instead opting for the line that everything was working (even though the desk staff had confirmed the problems). It seems a real shame those in charge don‚Äôt hold themselves to a higher standard of customer service. This would be a 5 star experience if they put in some ground level attention.
showerReviews.author: Florence Redstart

locations.title: Glass Mill Leisure Centre
locations.address: ÓÉà41 Loampit Vale, London SE13 7FT, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
(Originally posted on 2019 but don‚Äôt keep the old account)

I joined Glass Mill leisure centre in mid-November 2018 as a monthly subscribed member.

Everything seemed to be nice and smooth at first but there have been numerous events that have made me change my mind about the worthiness of staying in the centre.

My main complaint lies within the fitness / gym / instructors / team since this has been my preferred activity on my time here. At least the one I have put more hours into.

- Despite the staff members have confirmed that cancelled classes are notified beforehand, there is a complete absolute absence of any kind of notifications when a class is in fact cancelled (no e-mail, no phone calls, no app notifications. Nothing). Classes are cancelled with no previous notice wasting my commuting time and money for nothing.

- Classes that apparently are inexistent or with no instructors planned for that day remain visible and available for booking via mobile application and online so reception keeps booking them. This is a fact that members of the team are aware of. Nobody cares or do nothing about it after several wakeup calls. They keep passing on the subject to other people but nothing happens.

- When classes are apparently going to happen (nobody in reception says there is a cancellation and get the class ticket), MOST of the times (every single time in the last month and a half) fitness instructors are either missing, starting late and/or making up excuses for this vanishing. This has been told to superior members available at the time verbal complaint were held. Even so, big lack of seriousness and more excuses from them too. ‚ÄúWe are waiting for a new instructor that is going to start this week‚Äù. Several weeks have gone by and the situation remains the same. The solution is easy: no staff available, no classes have to be scheduled.

- Reception staff are normally exceeded by multiple tasks to do at once hence the customer service is far from appropriate. Also pointing out that there are some particular cases where no kindness to the client is shown at all.

- Also, the state of the facilities is disgusting 7 of 10 times I go there. Everything is dirty, urine smell in the common areas, showers, pool area. That is the main reason I only went to the swimming pool twice.

I ended up giving my notice to end my membership and my wife's via the online form but so you know and if you want to do the same, if you do it after the first of the month you will be charged one extra month by contract.

Disgusting experience overall.
showerReviews.author: Melin Drosa

showerReviews.reviewText:
(Originally posted on 2019 but don‚Äôt keep the old account)

I joined Glass Mill leisure centre in mid-November 2018 as a monthly subscribed member.

Everything seemed to be nice and smooth at first but there have been numerous events that have made me change my mind about the worthiness of staying in the centre.

My main complaint lies within the fitness / gym / instructors / team since this has been my preferred activity on my time here. At least the one I have put more hours into.

- Despite the staff members have confirmed that cancelled classes are notified beforehand, there is a complete absolute absence of any kind of notifications when a class is in fact cancelled (no e-mail, no phone calls, no app notifications. Nothing). Classes are cancelled with no previous notice wasting my commuting time and money for nothing.

- Classes that apparently are inexistent or with no instructors planned for that day remain visible and available for booking via mobile application and online so reception keeps booking them. This is a fact that members of the team are aware of. Nobody cares or do nothing about it after several wakeup calls. They keep passing on the subject to other people but nothing happens.

- When classes are apparently going to happen (nobody in reception says there is a cancellation and get the class ticket), MOST of the times (every single time in the last month and a half) fitness instructors are either missing, starting late and/or making up excuses for this vanishing. This has been told to superior members available at the time verbal complaint were held. Even so, big lack of seriousness and more excuses from them too. ‚ÄúWe are waiting for a new instructor that is going to start this week‚Äù. Several weeks have gone by and the situation remains the same. The solution is easy: no staff available, no classes have to be scheduled.

- Reception staff are normally exceeded by multiple tasks to do at once hence the customer service is far from appropriate. Also pointing out that there are some particular cases where no kindness to the client is shown at all.

- Also, the state of the facilities is disgusting 7 of 10 times I go there. Everything is dirty, urine smell in the common areas, showers, pool area. That is the main reason I only went to the swimming pool twice.

I ended up giving my notice to end my membership and my wife's via the online form but so you know and if you want to do the same, if you do it after the first of the month you will be charged one extra month by contract.

Disgusting experience overall.
showerReviews.author: Melin Drosa

showerReviews.reviewText:
Being to this leisure centre twice for some swimming competitions, organisation was good and the atmosphere was great too.
Because the galas were during the weekend and needed to stay all day we parked on the Elmira street free of charge.
The place got a coffee shop, near is a parc if you want some fresh air because inside is getting very warm with so many people in the building.
Toilets (near the viewing area) not very well prepared for an event like this üòä, toilet paper missing and two of them out of order.
Overall we had a nice time here.
showerReviews.author: Eleena PK

showerReviews.reviewText:
I really wanted to enjoy it here and was even considering getting membership to make this my permanent gym. However, my experience and the cleanliness was not up to par.

We came in to do gym and swimming today (Sunday) as a day pass and was greeted kindly by the gentleman at reception. My partner used the toilet but there was unfortunately no toilet paper. We went out to grab a swimming costume and returned about 20 minutes later. When we came back, there was no one at reception and we waited for over 5 minutes for someone to return. We explained that we had just bought a day pass, and the lady said ‚Äòokay, I trust you‚Äô and let us both through.

We started at the gym which had some faulty equipment. Both the hip abduction and the seated leg press were not working and could not be adjusted. However, apart from this, it seemed clean and the atmosphere was calm and enjoyable.

Myself and my partner then went downstairs to swim. The changing rooms were dirty. There were flies, and used, bloody plasters, tissue on the floor. Despite this we swam for well over an hour and had a good time.

Here‚Äôs the bad bit. We left the pool at around 4 o‚Äôclock and cooled off in the sauna for about 45 minutes. We went to have another shower and was then told that we only have 5 more minutes until the place closes. This was strange to me as online it said 6pm. My partner had my bags and our towels so I asked a member of staff if I could go into the group changing rooms with him and he was extremely confrontational and said ‚Äòwhat‚Äôs wrong with the male and female ones?‚Äô. I then explained that I need to use his towel and he said that we could change in the sauna. I asked if someone would tell people not to come in and he said no.

We changed in the sauna anyway since it seemed easier. There was a faint, strange smell a bit like urine. We changed and kept an eye on the doors as each other was changing. He thought he dropped his airbud in between the wooden bench in the sauna, and as he looked with his phone flash light, he could see MAGGOTS all over the floor. Hundreds of them. We were both mortified and he was nearly sick.

So, the staff at the pool were quite rude and the cleanliness of the sauna was below hellish. It is insane how it‚Äôs still open. I told a member of staff but was not offered a refund or anything despite me saying how traumatic the sight was. AVOID AT ALL COSTS!!!!!
showerReviews.author: Morgan Owen

showerReviews.reviewText:
I can‚Äôt find 0 stars to select.
When there is problem the never fix something in time but take always months or years like for the shower in the changing room, the refill water at the sauna, the system close for weeks and now the cold water for more than 1 week, but no one give a refund for all these damage, customer need to pay everything is full.
This is not how the world works Better. The brand name is still so wrong for the kind of bad service and customer service you provide every day.

The people at the reception are always nice but the problem is always on the top management. No attention for the good service to provide to us. Just waiting weeks, months or years to fix problem.

I can tell it after 11 years I pay a monthly membership. But what I‚Äôm assisting in the last months it is a lot.
I suggest to fix the bug problem soon because maybe if a day you will close the door is not because was an accident but because the service and customer service you provide per years.

I hope this public complain can stimulate your management to start to change something but for my experience never will change because the history talk more and give proof of example in what I said.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Was signed up to a Swimbies swimming class with my toddler on Thursday afternoons with swimming teacher Mark.

Mark went on holiday and told the class that he would be back in 3 weeks and cover would be organised.

5 weeks later, and confused parents and upset toddlers still turning up at the poolside with no cover organised, and at times not even a lifeguard available.
No-one at Better could help or provide any answers, and now, what was a popular lesson seems to have been erased from their timetable.

Massively disappointing.
showerReviews.author: Nathan Cooper

locations.address: ÓÉàPitfield St, London N1 5FT, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
A place where you can spend a great time with your young ones. This facility offers a lot of activities for both adult and children which includes swimming training or just a quick dip into the pool with your babies.

The pool is also accessible for individuals with special educational needs which is really amazing.  The huge slide inside is also worth to try. Just do not forget to bring a coin to access the lockers; you can get your coin back before you leave.

Baggy park, vending machine and cafe are also available inside. You might not be able to bring phones or camera to take photo inside.

showerReviews.reviewText:
I came here with my daughter for the Aqua play. We haven't been before, but I was impressed by the extensive facilities available at the centre and would come back to try more.

There were ample changing rooms, including family sized cubicles. Lockers near the entrance to the pool. No outdoor shoes allowed in the changing area so keep that in mind!

My daughter absolutely loved the splash pad. She said it was the best day of her life! There was a good of variety of things to play with. The sessions get booked up really fast so I was expecting it to be heaving, but I felt that the maximum people allowed was fine.

The staff at the splash pad were really on top of things. They kept the number of people at a manageable level so it was not overcrowded, checked in on children that appeared to be unaccompanied, and stopped a couple of people that were filming on their phones (which I was thankful for). Overall an enjoyable experience - a great way to beat the heat and tire out an energetic 4 yr old!
showerReviews.author: ciara s

showerReviews.reviewText:
As a professional coach and lifelong athlete who has spent years training and teaching in different gyms, I truly value environments that reflect discipline, safety, and cleanliness.
I‚Äôve been training in this gym since its early days, but unfortunately, the level of maintenance and hygiene has not improved over time.

My original, detailed review ‚Äî which included photos and videos to support my observations ‚Äî could not be published by Google, as it didn‚Äôt meet their posting policy.
I even tried submitting it several times through my personal email, but it was automatically rejected due to the attached visual content.
So this is the shortened and policy-friendly version of my genuine feedback.

From a coach‚Äôs perspective, it‚Äôs clear that the gym needs more consistent care in cleaning, equipment servicing, and general upkeep.
Some machines have been out of service for extended periods, affecting both training quality and member safety.

A truly professional gym should maintain a clean, safe, and motivating environment for both athletes and trainers.
I sincerely hope management takes this feedback seriously and makes meaningful improvements to bring the gym back to a standard worthy of its members.
showerReviews.author: Elyas Coach

I think this gym has great potential, but it really needs more attention to cleanliness and maintenance.
There are usually a few machines that stay out of service for weeks, and the broken lockers and toilet flushes only add to the problem.
All of this gives members the impression that regular cleaning and proper maintenance are not being done as they should be.

The gym floor on the second level is very dirty and clearly hasn‚Äôt been cleaned, and the same applies to other floors as well.
If the gym focused more on keeping the space clean, repairing equipment on time, and maintaining higher standards, it would make a noticeable difference in members‚Äô overall experience.
Members truly deserve a clean, safe, and better-managed environment to train in.

We started off in the fantastic soft play area, which was perfect for children of all ages. After that, we cooled off in the swimming pool‚Äîthere were plenty of lifeguards on duty, which made us feel really safe, and the pool floaties added an extra bit of fun to the session.

To top it all off, we ended the day at the brand-new bowling alley, which truly felt like a VIP experience thanks to the impressive setup. The kids had an amazing time and already can‚Äôt wait to come back. Neither can we!

showerReviews.reviewText: Great experience at the family leisure overall. I went to take my son swimming however the pool was closed for children at 13.30 on Monday 8th May which was the bank holiday . I asked about the new family leisure area and was told to walk downstairs to the low level. I was not able to book this online so asked the assistant at the desk. I was informed that we'd need to wait 20 minutes for the next session. I did not mind waiting so paid ¬£6 for me and my son. During the wait, there was an area selling crisps, drinks and snacks, unfortunately no one was at the till point. Staffing was short by the look of all areas from entrance to exit. The family leisure area was amazing, the slides and climbing areas were brilliant. The website and schedule needs adjusting to avoid confused customers.

showerReviews.reviewText:
I've been using this swimming pool for a bit longer than a year and something has dramatically changed at the end of the last summer. It used to be pretty decent, clean and warm public pool. Perfect for people who come to relax and stretch out, but decent enough for those who are more energetic swimmers. Only 3 shower cubicles and lack of lockers were always the issue.
Unfortunately, it has changed for the worse. It's constantly cold, sometimes very cold and really unclean, from top to bottom. Reception is not as welcoming as they used to be.
On a positive note, lifeguards are still lovely. They are topping up for a star.
showerReviews.author: Suzana Radulovics

showerReviews.reviewText:
Decent gym, but always packed! The equipment and facilities are okay but limited‚Äîonly two showers and two toilets in the gym section, and they‚Äôre almost always in use. The stretching areas are too small, so you‚Äôll often need to grab a mat and find space elsewhere. Not much freestyle equipment either, which can be frustrating if that‚Äôs your focus.

One big downside is the lack of proper pull-up bars or sturdy grip bars for exercises like dead hangs or pull-ups. If you rely on those for your training, you might struggle to find a good setup and it's always busy!

That said, the staff are really friendly, which definitely helps! It‚Äôs the only real option in the area, so it‚Äôs convenient. You‚Äôll need to subscribe via Better‚Äôs website, get a barcode, and scan it to enter. If you don‚Äôt mind the crowds and limited space, it does the job!
showerReviews.author: John Adib

showerReviews.reviewText:
Update number 6,005: If you only want to use a gym, and have no use for a pool and badminton courts, leave the Castle Centre (nice as it currently is) NOW, and move to the Gym Group gym down the road. It‚Äôs an even better gym at a much lower price. The castle centre now wants ¬£44 per month for a place with a long track record of being crap. Sure, it‚Äôs nice now, but it‚Äôs impossible to have any confidence it‚Äôll remain that way. The gym group gym is ¬£20 per month presently and has been as low as ¬£15.

The issue with the Castle Centre gym is it's run by the council, so it's entirely focussed on people who don't pay to get in ‚Äì the kind of people who break equipment ‚Äì and sees anyone who does pay to get in as a sucker. They spent a month doing it up and didn't refund that month's membership fee, because that is how council people think. 'Hey just use the pool instead' (no thanks)  'or use our gym in Peckham' (definitely no thanks; it's like a prison gym.)

Now they‚Äôve socked up their pricing by 20%, starting from April. Yes, that‚Äôs right: twenty per cent.

Anyway, for legacy reasons, here's the last update to my review of this place:

To my utter amazement, the gym here ‚Äì previously a total dump ‚Äì has been fully renovated and given all-new equipment to replace the malfunctioning, rusty crap they had before. I have to admit I‚Äôm seriously impressed.

Let‚Äôs hope they can maintain it, and discourage the more moronic part of their clientele from misusing equipment in insane ways, which must have contributed to the dire state of the old equipment.

Please note, the lockers now require a padlock ‚Äì the ones that used the old-style pound coins (not the current pound coin; that would be way too simple) have been replaced.
showerReviews.author: Duncan B

showerReviews.reviewText:
Quite simply the worst run swimming pool I have ever used. Repeatedly cancelling morning sessions. Repeatedly promising refunds that never arrive. Then deleting morning sessions altogether.

Switched to evening sessions to find them, without warning, cordoning off 5 metres for an unannounced session (it‚Äôs only a 20m pool to start with!)

It‚Äôs a beautiful historic pool being run very very badly. Oh yeah, and their HQ doesn‚Äôt respond to complaints.

I am sad to say I‚Äôm defecting to the nearby Ironmonger Public Baths.
showerReviews.author: Byron Taylor

showerReviews.reviewText:
Been taking my two kids here for swimming lessons for over 5 months now, weekly lessons, twice a month you‚Äôre guaranteed their lessons will get cancelled on the day- no prior notice, just under an hour before they‚Äôre due to begin in most cases.
The swimming lessons aren‚Äôt managed very well at all! None of the children in that class have moved up a stage, no updates from swimming instructors on when either, when lessons got cancelled they used to issue refunds without any issues until Rhonda started managing and it all fell apart. Weeks and weeks go by without any refunds, no reply to emails, no reply to phone calls, given the runaround by staff who all have a different spin on things when you finally get through! If you go in there‚Äôs apparently no managers available, does this Rhonda even exist?! We get told she‚Äôs the only one that can issue refunds yet she never seems to be in, never replies to emails calls etc‚Ä¶ Absolute shambles. Completely mismanaged. Other parents whose children attend swim lessons seem to be having the exact same issues too, and the funny thing is, they admit to other people having the same problems yet do absolutely nothing to solve them! 3 weeks and counting and still getting absolutely nowhere. Any other business triggers refunds automatically without people having to nag them to death! Cancel your memberships and move elsewhere like i‚Äôve done, save yourselves the hassle of dealing with non existent managers, and swim lessons that don‚Äôt seem to advance. Contact your bank for assistance they were great in dealing with them directly.
showerReviews.author: Helen S

showerReviews.reviewText: Joined last month and have been really impressed so far. Great price for the area for membership and the options available are great. Mainly use the swimming pool, which is always well set out with lanes. The gym is small, but there are an adequate amount of machines available and is not too busy when I have visited. Staff are friendly and the free towels for members are an added bonus!

showerReviews.reviewText:
First time attending this leisure centre and I really wish I could go back in time and book somewhere else. I booked for a family swim but unfortunately my partner wasn't able to come into the pool as there's literally nowhere to park! The place is in such a horrible location and you wouldn't even find it unless you ask people walking by. It is in the middle of an estate with loads of flats around it. There's steps to get down to it which is not ideal when you have a pram.
We were late due to not being able to find it so instead of having 50 minutes in the pool we had about 20 minutes which made my kids really upset. For the actual leisure centre itself, upon arrival, we were told by the receptionist that the lights in the female changing room wasn't working so we walked into darkness and I am talking serious darkness. No light what's so ever. I have never seen darkness like that before. Imagine changing yourself, and 3 small children in complete darkness! not the one! they didn't even try to come up with a solution or even offer some money back for the inconvenience which I think is so wrong. It was just another thing on the list to ruin the experience. The actual pool itself was semi warm and the changing room which is the only positive I can say. It's fair to say that we won't be going back again as we didn't enjoy our family day and was such a waste of time and money. (Oh and also I had to pay for my 6 month old and 2 year old and 6 month old nephew. I'm not sure why they wasn't free like everywhere else. Online says juniors and doesn't give you the option to add in infants like everywhere else. It should come up as 'discount 5'. I had to call up first and the receptionist wasn't even sure himself and then just said maybe it's because of the area and they don't get anybody under junior year and the babies and 2 year old are classed as juniors. lol)
showerReviews.author: Chels Aamie

showerReviews.reviewText: The sooner someone efficient takes over this gym, the better. The raw material isn't too bad - the swimming pool, and weights room are okay if basic. But the whole place is demoralised and depressing. Staff are mixed - some good, some bad - but seem untrained. On the day of writing, for example, two staff let me through for a swim and I changed, only to find that the pool was closed. I was the only punter. On another occasion I was summarily given a charge on the website which meant that I couldn't book through the website for ages. Not that that would have made that much difference as the website is like a relic from the early days of the internet. No wonder Fusion is failing. Given its location it could be an ace boutique gym. PLEASE - someone rescue the Golden Lane gym and bring it back to full potential.
showerReviews.author: Oliver Bennett

showerReviews.reviewText:
It‚Äôs beautiful old building. At the top a gym with friendly staff and a massive swimming pool.
Underground  is a nice spa as well to run independently, clean and with multiple options of steams and temperature as well a small pool of cold and hot water showers. Definitely give a chance of spend a couple of ours for yourself or perhaps a gift for a friend.

I went for a hand and foot massage, that was nice (¬£40). The good about it was a lovely head and neck massage, good product and a hot paraffin that help a little with the joint pain.

Perhaps 25 minutes is not enough time as when you start been relax the time is over and they unpolitely turn the light on suddenly to hurry you up and give you just a few minutes to dress as the technician still hurrying you as she is waiting for you in the corridor while your dress.  I found it an unpleasant ending as no others customer were there waiting.  ‚ò∫Ô∏è

I went for a hand and foot massage, that was nice (¬£40). The good about it was a lovely head and neck massage, good product and a hot paraffin that help a little with the joint pain.

Perhaps 25 minutes is not enough time as when you start been relax the time is over and they unpolitely turn the light on suddenly to hurry you up and give you just a few minutes to dress as the technician still hurrying you as she is waiting for you in the corridor while your dress.  I found it an unpleasant ending as no others customer were there waiting.  ‚ò∫Ô∏è

showerReviews.reviewText:
Tuesday 17th May, this is the sixth alternative BETTER swimming pool I visited during the closure of the London Aquatic Centre(for 2016 European Aquatics Championship). Non-functioning showers in the male changing/unisex changing area is a HUGE turn off.

The staff were friendly and the pool is really clean and well managed. The pool is 30(perhaps 33?) metres in length, with the shallow end at 1 metre and deep end at 4 metre. It's not very busy which is really good for someone who enjoys a proper swim without interruption.

However, the management really ought to take steps fixing the showers. None of them were functioning and other fellow swimmers told me that it happens rather frequently there. It's a real shame, as the pool is great to swim in. I ended up just drying myself up after having no luck rinsing myself.
showerReviews.author: David Hung

showerReviews.reviewText: We really miss this pool it‚Äôs great. Seriously needs to reopen soon what are members paying for? The other local pools are not a great alternative at the moment- Mile End is small and overcrowded. York Hall is out of use for several months due to structural work. London fields lido still has only outdoor changing-  no indoor changing or hairdryers so not suitable before work or for those who need a hairdryer and even if you can manage without that it‚Äôs difficult to book a slot peak time.. London aquatics centre has cleared the bulk of the daytime schedule in the 50m competition pool to run aqua splash and is now not open till late at weekends as it was pre-pandemic. Appreciate times are difficult but the community needs this place sorely and it should be a priority to get this place up and running again.

showerReviews.reviewText: I only use the swimming pool and it's a great 33m indoor pool, 1m on one side, 1.8m in the middle and 3.8m on the other side. Morning hours are not too busy and the lanes are well organised for slow, medium and fast swimmers. The female changing room is very sad though: cold, dirty, the showers are leaking, the 2 hairdryers are broken. It's a pity because it would be a nice pool but with this poor changing room it's not a great experience.

showerReviews.author: Andi Szilagyi

showerReviews.reviewText:
I am a regular swimmer (4-5 times a week) at the St Georges for over 15 years now as it is the most convenient one for me in the area as I work nearby. Unfortunately, there is no improvements, if not getting worse!

Starting from the entrance gate, despite recently installed card-operated entry system, members still have to present their members' cards at the reception to gain entry, what's the point? At peak hours (5-6pm), this often leads to a very long queue just to get into the pool as there is always only one staff member working at the reception. This is due to non-members enquiry or paying at the reception, significantly delaying members from gaining entry to the pool.

The men's changing room is simply disgusting and filthy to say the least! Floors are dirty often seen with a puddle of stagnant/filthy water in one of the (middle) changing rooms. Ceilings are falling apart. The toilet is simply foul and the shower room floor infested with tiny little worms oozing out from gaps between floor tiles!! Despite having 6 shower points in the shower room, only two works properly. Due to the poor positioning of the shower points, whereby 4 of them are too close together, this means that at any one time, only 4 people can comfortably shower at the same time, two showers are made redundant as the space available is simply too tight without having to touch each other whilst showering! The smell of urine stench from the men's changing room drains into the main swimming pool area for all swimmers to enjoy and breath in whilst swimming! Simply nauseating!

The swimming guards are friendly but rarely regulates the swim speed in the 3 dedicated lane swimming, allowing slow swimmers to obstruct fast swimmers in a the fast lane. This can be dangerous especially when the pool is crowded. What's the point of putting up speed-specific lanes when slow swimmer can swim in fast lane?
showerReviews.author: Teck Teh

showerReviews.reviewText:
Title: Great Facilities but Poor Responsiveness to Customer Feedback

I‚Äôve been using this gym for a while now and overall the facilities are good. However, there‚Äôs one ongoing issue that really needs attention. I‚Äôve repeatedly asked the staff to install a digital clock in the swimming, sauna, and steam room area something that should be standard for safety, time-tracking, and basic convenience.

Despite mentioning it multiple times over a long period, nothing has been done and there‚Äôs been no follow-up or communication. It feels like customer feedback isn‚Äôt being listened to, which is disappointing for a gym at this price point.

A simple digital clock would make a big difference for members, and it‚Äôs frustrating that such a small request has been ignored for so long. I hope management actually takes this seriously and starts responding to member suggestions instead of overlooking them.

showerReviews.reviewText:
The gym has recently been fitted with new equipment, which is great and makes workouts much more enjoyable. The yoga and spinning classes are also really good, with friendly and competent instructors who make the sessions fun and engaging.
However, the experience in the female changing room has been consistently disappointing. The cleaning staff are often rude, hold loud conversations on speakerphone and eat strong-smelling food in the changing area. On two occasions when I needed help (once when towels were missing and another when my locker wouldn‚Äôt open), I was met with hostility and told to ‚Äúgo talk to the manager‚Äù both times while I was soaking wet and had to walk to upstairs to do so.
It‚Äôs especially upsetting because I‚Äôve gone out of my way to help others by calling staff when they were locked out of their lockers, even though I‚Äôm just a member. Fortunately, the reception staff are always kind and professional, but the attitude and behaviour of the cleaning staff really undermine what could otherwise be a great gym experience.
showerReviews.author: Marz Po

showerReviews.reviewText:
Nuffield Health Covent Garden is a first class gym

Although the City branch is slightly posher and definitely bigger, there is nothing outside once you leave.

With the Covent Garden branch you are in the middle of everything which London has to offer.

I have been with the Covent Garden branch for ten years and Mhairi and the other members of staff are always very helpful and welcoming.

This aspect makes a world of difference.

Compared to the place which I used to use before, the changing rooms and the gym facilities and pool are spotlessly clean.

The gym also provides free towels which saves having to bring one from home.

I would recommend Nuffield Health Covent Garden for anyone who lives or works in this area.

The only slight drawback is sometimes the dryer machine does pack up BUT usually, this is fixed fairly promptly.
showerReviews.author: Ian Dearlove

The staff are very friendly, but the gym itself is a complete calamity. Considering its location, it really should be much better. Unfortunately, it doesn‚Äôt seem to matter how many times you complain or leave a bad review ‚Äî they simply ignore it. Which is quite sad. Not everyone values excellence in the little things anymore, such as cleanliness, organisation, and general well-being. Truly sad.

locations.title: Fitness First The Strand
locations.address: ÓÉà6 Bedford St, London WC2E 9HD, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: I was on holiday staying at the Resident across the street so this gym was very convenient. A super nice woman named June was working the front desk and she was very helpful getting me checked in. The gym was clean and the locker room was very nice and clean as well. I bought a day pass as I was traveling the next day. The cost was shocking! ¬£25 for a single day pass! I pay this much at home for a month! I bit the bullet and paid it as I was commited due the the proximity of my hotel and lack of time to look for another gym. The gym was well furnished (machines, free weights, mats, etc) and the equipment was newer and in good shape. I worked out for 70 minutes and although it was a busy time (6:00pm), I was able to mostly get the equipment i needed when I wanted it. Plenty of benches and free weights available but machines quite busy. In addition to the cost, I wasn't pleased with the volume of the music. I could clearing hear the music from the ceiling mounted speakers the whole time even though I had earbuds in and my volume turned up high. Overall not a great experience.
showerReviews.author: David Coppa

locations.address: ÓÉà15 Great Marlborough St, London W1F 7HR, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: This has been my home club since 2010. It‚Äôs always been a really comfortable place to come to work out. Some reviews and comments reference the club being small but as a centrally located gym I would argue that to be misleading. Yes it is small compared to the non-city centre warehouse style gyms but this is zone 1 in London and it definitely stands in line with most other local gyms. It has a great size gym floor stocked with continually renewed machines, a sprung floor studio plus spin studio. The changing rooms have newly installed saunas (yes they are small but they are proportionate) which is great after a session. The current management team are genuinely awesome. Irma is beautiful soul who always greets me with a wide smile pure warmth‚Ä¶I literally have no complaints.
showerReviews.author: K Mac

showerReviews.reviewText:
Regrettably, after two years as a Fitness First member, I decided to cancel my membership today. It wasn‚Äôt the frequent locker break ins or thefts in the changing rooms that pushed me to this point. Unfortunately, it was the lack of basic gym etiquette from PT staff and management. Long term paying members are being moved out of spaces and off equipment with little notice to make room for classes.
Every gym I‚Äôve ever trained in operates on a first come, first served basis for open areas, assisted machines and free weights but that was not respected today. I was removed from the gym floor to accommodate a class, and had this taken place in a studio, it would have been understandable. However, it didn‚Äôt, and this treatment is unacceptable. Sadly, based on this experience, I cannot recommend this gym to others.
showerReviews.author: Maxim Rome

showerReviews.reviewText:
Dear Fitness First Oxford Circus Management,

I am writing on behalf of many long standing female members who regularly use the Oxford Circus branch. We feel it is important to raise serious concerns regarding the ongoing lack of hygiene and respect from certain individuals within the female changing room, sauna, and shower walkway facilities.

Over the past several months, the situation has deteriorated to a point where many of us are now considering cancelling our memberships, despite being loyal members for years, some for over two decades.

It has become increasingly common to witness individuals using the sauna and steam room for activities that are entirely inappropriate and unhygienic. These include:

Scrubbing and exfoliating with body scrubs, which results in dead skin cells and debris being spread throughout the saunas and shower walkway.

Clipping fingernails and toenails within the sauna and shower areas.

Most shockingly, brushing teeth in the sauna, which leads to saliva and foam being splattered around, creating an extremely unhygienic and unpleasant environment.

This kind of behaviour is completely unacceptable in a professional fitness club environment and is highly disrespectful to other members.

We kindly urge the management to take immediate action to address this issue. Specifically, we request:

Clear and prominently displayed signage in and around the changing rooms, sauna explicitly stating that scrubbing, exfoliating, nail clipping, and tooth brushing are strictly prohibited.

Regular staff monitoring of these areas to ensure compliance and to maintain appropriate hygiene standards.

Without decisive action, many of us feel we will have no choice but to terminate our memberships. It would be deeply disappointing to have to leave after so many years, but the current state of affairs is unacceptable and poses genuine hygiene concerns.

We sincerely hope you take this matter seriously and implement these changes.
showerReviews.author: LunaVerde92

locations.title: Fitness First Marylebone
locations.address: ÓÉàCavendish Mews N, Hallam St, London W1W 6LA, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Gym Equipment Quality

The gym equipment at Fitness First Marylebone is outstanding‚Äîwhat I assume true premium German quality. Every machine and free weight feels solid, smooth, and engineered for performance.
The range of equipment allows you to really specialise and target muscle groups, whether you‚Äôre working on strength, hypertrophy, or rehabilitation.
Machines are well-maintained and ergonomically designed for both beginners and advanced athletes. The place isn‚Äôt too busy also so you can definitely get a good workout in on a weekend!

Cold Plunge
The cold plunge facility is a fantastic addition. Perfect for post-workout recovery, it‚Äôs clean, well-regulated, and always at the right temperature.
The area around the cold plunge is tidy and inviting, making recovery sessions genuinely enjoyable.

Sauna & Cleanliness
Sauna sessions feel relaxing and restorative, but there is one notable issue: water pooling on the sauna floor can make it slightly uncomfortable at times.
Aside from this, the overall cleanliness of the gym is top-notch.

Overall Experience
If it wasn‚Äôt for the water pooling in the sauna, this gym would be a flawless 10/10.
Supportive staff, premium equipment, recovery facilities, clean changing rooms‚Äîthis location is a standout for anyone serious about training in London Marylebone.
showerReviews.author: David Innes

showerReviews.reviewText: Highlighting the reception desk staff today. I haven't been swimming for several months. Despite this, as I fumbled with my app, the receptionist offered "I will buzz you through Rose". Such a small interaction, yet such an amazing piece of customer service. I am lucky that on a daily basis, I am warmly welcomed by my family at home. I am also a therapist. For some of my most isolated clients, those little day to day interactions can be literally life saving. As well as thanking the receptionist for their care, I hope Better management sees this review too. At time when so much is being automated to save on costs (understandable), I hope Better recognises how much value that one staff member, is adding to the community of Lido users (and therefore to Better as an organisation).
showerReviews.author: Rose C Jiggens

The summer water temperature is a refreshing 17¬∞C, perfect both for well-being and exercise. The pool has long opening hours and, is large enough to enjoy a peaceful swim, especially during the morning sessions. Easy to access via public transport and, with a good caf√©. Changing facilities are basic, but there are warm showers and clean lavatories. Overall: Highly recommend!

showerReviews.reviewText: This place is really amazing. As you now need tickets to enter it is never too busy even on days it sells out. Plenty of places to lay down (even though it is on concrete) and some lane swimming always open. It's well run and queues move quickly.  No doors on changing rooms and it's a bit grubby inside but I'm sure thats down to the age. Also sauna not available

I do think it‚Äôs rather expensive for the facilities that they provide - the changing rooms were pretty grim and lacked doors which made me question where the extensive amount of money went - otherwise a great experience ‚ú®

Very long (90feet/60m) unheated swimming pool.
Amazing for lane swimming üèä
Changing rooms, showers, and toilets are ok.
The lockers for season ticket holders haven't worked at all for us this year and when you ask the staff about it they reply "It's not working".
Most of the staff is nice.

Gets very crowded on hot days and some sessions require booking during the summer months. üåû
FYI the Lido gets cleared of people and shut at the end of every swimming session before they let the next batch in.

locations.title: Tooting Bec Lido
locations.address: ÓÉàTooting Bec Rd, London SW16 1RU, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Fantastic outdoor lido ‚Äî we‚Äôve visited several times and always enjoy it. It‚Äôs best to book in advance, as when it‚Äôs fully booked you‚Äôll need to queue outside. Bags are checked for glass, alcohol, and similar items before you‚Äôre given a wristband.

There‚Äôs no seating directly around the pool, which isn‚Äôt an issue if you bring a large towel or something to sit on. Benches are available near the small caf√© at one end. On hot days, the caf√© can get extremely busy with long queues, and there may also be queues for the toilets. The toilets are a little run down, and the shower facilities are in a shared space.

I also want to mention that the lockers are somewhat unreliable. They‚Äôre small, require your own padlock, and while they‚Äôve worked for me in the past, today I found I could pull mine open without much effort even with the padlock secured. They‚Äôre showing their age and could do with upgrading.

That said, it‚Äôs still a wonderful lido ‚Äî so much so that we‚Äôre happy to travel 1.5 hours across London just to get there!
showerReviews.author: Kelly

Wonderful outdoor lido set in the greenery of Tooting Common.
The changing rooms are nice and there is good space to sit and enjoy as well as the enormous unheated lido.
The staff are really friendly and pleasant.

There is a cafe onsite, however it is not cheap- would recommend bringing your own snacks as it can quickly add up for a group of people.

showerReviews.reviewText:
I visited Tooting Lido on a sunny day, and it was understandably very busy. The pool is large and has a big capacity, so it never felt too crowded. There was, however, a lack of seating and shaded areas, making it quite difficult to get out of the sun.

There was a cafe on-site that sold drinks, food, and ice creams. It was very popular, but they seemed to handle the crowds well.

My only comment would be that the changing facilities and toilets could do with an upgrade, as they weren't particularly pleasant or comfortable.
showerReviews.author: Joel Pagett

locations.title: Serpentine Lido
locations.address: ÓÉàHyde Park, London W2 2UH, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: Swimming is strictly limited to card-carrying club members nowadays.  Once upon a time it was possible to swim as a member's guest.  This is no longer possible.  The waiting list for membership is long.  Please don't attempt to swim unless you are a member with your membership card in hand.  As per our statute with the Royal Parks administration members not bearing their cards and all non-members will not be admitted by the wardens.  Races take place generally on Saturday morning at 7:30am (championship) or 8:00am (regular races).
showerReviews.author: Dan Fortmann

Lockers require ¬£1 coin, but will return afterwards. Dry floor. No or little smell. Showering is a bit weak. Staff is nice and helpful.

showerReviews.reviewText:
This gym and it‚Äôs staff I‚Äôve met have come across as ignorant.
They need training on how to treat people that don‚Äôt look ‚Äúdisabled‚Äù.
I don‚Äôt think they realise that you don‚Äôt have to be in a wheelchair to be less or differently abled. The Disabled woman‚Äôs changing room away from the pool but  near the gym has broken shower heads and broken pipe for water so it doesn‚Äôt come out properly unless you hold it in a certain way and has done for weeks and hasn‚Äôt been replaced.
No body seems to do quality or risk assessment checks in disabled areas.
Terrible also in the shower they should have a longer press time for the hot water for disabled users as it literally disables us from washing without assistance therefore making us feel more less abled.
This gym isn‚Äôt disabled friendly even though it states as so as being ‚Äúlevel access‚Äù. It‚Äôs not you have to use a chair lift which is a big song a dance to use and draws way too much prying eyes. You have to go up and down stairs in a stand chair lift which draws a lot of attention from others attendants. Terrible. The people working in this gym including management and better regional managers need training on how to communicate and treat those that are disabled regardless of how one ‚Äúlooks‚Äù to you. I cannot emphasise enough how frustrating it is to use their facilities when I need to. They need to have someone with a lived disabled experience give them pointers as they clearly don‚Äôt get it.
showerReviews.author: S G

locations.title: Brockwell Lido
locations.address: ÓÉàDulwich Rd, London SE24 0PA, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: Great lido especially on a warm day, however the disabled toilet lock is broken and overall run down. I feel there should be individual showers, not keen on the open ones. It feels expensive for a swim session especially when the facilities could be better, overall needs more improvement.
showerReviews.author: Lucy Brook

showerReviews.reviewText: Great lido especially on a warm day, however the disabled toilet lock is broken and overall run down. I feel there should be individual showers, not keen on the open ones. It feels expensive for a swim session especially when the facilities could be better, overall needs more improvement.
showerReviews.author: Lucy Brook

showerReviews.reviewText:
I have been a member since 2021. I love the community and it‚Äôs the only nearby leisure centre to me, but since joining the situation at the lido has gone from bad to worse.

Fusion (lido service provider) are taking advantage of the community, running our local lido into the ground.

The centre is dirty, smells of sewage, and there are flies all over the spa area. it is completely unhygienic & unsafe.

In female locker rooms, only about half the lockers actually work. It is similar for the Men's.

gym equipment is in dire straits, with people queuing to use the stair master and treadmills, as about 80% of gym equipment doesn't work.

the spa is one of the dirtiest areas, and the steam room has only been operational about 50% of the time since 2021. the hydrotherapy pool has not been operational since 2022, and remains unclean/with dirty water lingering at the bottom (see photos taken June 25th).

the pool reportedly has a leak, and is often very dirty.

the situation at the lido is getting out of hand. it is a profitable centre but it is being run to the ground, at the detriment of our community and members.

The staff are all amazing and hold the whole place together. It  makes me sad that they have to work under pitiful conditions that could be avoided if the centre was run for the community, not profit.
showerReviews.author: Hana Conevska

showerReviews.author: Max Swanson

showerReviews.reviewText: Brockwell lido is so good. The pool is fresh and nice, sometimes the ducks come swimming. The gym is ok, however a lot of the equipment is broken so that‚Äôs why it gets 3 stars.

showerReviews.reviewText: Lovely local lido that needs some investment in the facilities. Be warned the outdoor pool is not heated. The new sauna pods are a good addition. Changing rooms could be cleaned and wiped down more frequently. Pound coin need for lockers outside. Cafe onsite. Can buy tickets on the Fusion app in advance ¬£8 for a 50min swim session.
showerReviews.author: K L

showerReviews.reviewText: Lovely local lido that needs some investment in the facilities. Be warned the outdoor pool is not heated. The new sauna pods are a good addition. Changing rooms could be cleaned and wiped down more frequently. Pound coin need for lockers outside. Cafe onsite. Can buy tickets on the Fusion app in advance ¬£8 for a 50min swim session.
showerReviews.author: K L

showerReviews.reviewText:
Before I go into this review I want to note the staff working here & the community of swimmers I spend time with are one of the key reasons I return, along with it being a 50m outdoor unheated pool which is great for cold water swimming.

Unfortunately the local council have contracted Fusion to operate the pool and facilities and they are doing an atrocious job simply milking this asset! Whilst making significant profits from the pool, they fail to maintain the facilities to an adequate standard & should have their contract revoked;

1) The bathrooms & change-rooms are dirty. The floors are filthy. Are they ever cleaned?

2) The steam room is out of operation for the 3rd time in 2 years

3) Too many machines in the gym are out of order or in disrepair.

4) The signs read ‚Äútemporarily out of service‚Äù and ‚Äúnew facilities coming‚Äù but they never come. It‚Äôs just lip service.

5) Many lockers in the change room simply don‚Äôt work, it‚Äôs a lottery.

6) Toilets are a mission to flush, so many don‚Äôt bother trying.

7) Its modern day UK and the water in the bathrooms says ‚Äúnot drinkable‚Äù!

With a different operator in place this pool could actually live up to its timeout rating as #1.
showerReviews.author: Hamish Petrie

showerReviews.reviewText: Beautiful any day, but especially in the summer sun! The lido itself is well maintained and beautiful, as is the sunbathing area. I would give the lido 5* except the women's changing room (poolside one) is always out of order these days, and now the showers in the gym changing room (which we are having to use instead) are 60% out of order so you have to queue while 4 of the 6 stand empty.
showerReviews.author: Louise Farley

showerReviews.reviewText: Beautiful any day, but especially in the summer sun! The lido itself is well maintained and beautiful, as is the sunbathing area. showerReviews.reviewText:
Poorly run gym and spa!

The equipment is old, dirty and often unsafe. Machines broken for months and empty promises being made to paying members.
The spa area is becoming a health hazard - broken sauna benches getting haphazardly fixed, flies buzzing around, dirty and knackered loungers, smell of drainage and it's just not getting cleaned enough. Absolutely filthy around the broken jacuzzi, broken soap dispensers in dirty shower cubicles.

It could be such a lovely place to exercise and relax but, unfortunately, members across the board are getting increasingly frustrated for not being heard /taken seriously.
The lido is a money making machine and the money isn't being invested back into the facilities.
showerReviews.author: Sophia Preidel

showerReviews.reviewText: Worst centre I've ever been. The swimming pool is always very dirty and often *it smells*. The male changing rooms are quite run-down and the toilets... better avoid them. The gym always has some machines that are out of order and they stay like that for *months*. It's a real shame as the location would be perfect for me, but after a year trying to give it always one more chance to surprise me, I'm giving up.

showerReviews.reviewText:
The toilets are filthy, urine splatter everywhere. The hand dryers have layers upon layers of dust on the top. Doors and door handles are smeared with dirty handprints. In every corner, dust is thick and old.
The showers are horrible, they are designed for adults but that means the children that take classes cannot use them without adult help, but adults cannot help children without getting soaked. Not enough showers packed tight in a small, unpleasant cubicle.
If i could have given 0 stars,  i surely would have.

showerReviews.reviewText: Located underneath train tracks, I thought this would be a problem with noise and vibration. But training with head phones in your ears, you can‚Äôt hear any trains going over. The gym is an absolute beaut‚Ä¶ very well build, very good use of space and very good selection of equipment. The exposed brickwork makes it feel like you walked into a fancy estate agent! Very clean everywhere with plenty cleaning stations. Changing rooms are very spacious too and got large mirrors everywhere to see your gains! I loved every bit of the gym, and also raring there as it was quiet when I went.

locations.title: Little Venice Sports Centre
locations.address: ÓÉà10 Crompton St, London W2 1ND, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
The equipment are new and modern however can not be utilised fully due to lacking basic attachment. A hook took about 4-5 weeks to replace whilst one of the two triceps ropes is missing for 8 weeks. There‚Äôs only a single balance ball left in the stretching zone for about 6-8 weeks. The management is dysfunctional and lousy, whenever an equipment is out of service, there is a sign saying an engineer is called ‚Äútoday‚Äù with no date, as they‚Äôre the only clever bunch in the town! The staff usually hide in the back room behind or the Fitness Assessment Room on the gym floor. The most disappointing part yet is the lack of cleaning. I‚Äôm terrified to say that the gym floor and changing rooms are in a disgusting condition. The same used cotton piece with a blood stain is next to flies machine for 2 weeks! Leftovers of a bunch of grapes remained on the benches in the male changing room for 2 consecutive days and today (27 Dec) I‚Äôve seen that under the very same bench. The paper towel dispensers are often empty. The toilets are not brilliant either, albeit there‚Äôs been a slight improvement since my initial feedback upon which the gym manager responded and promised to give me a call in May. I‚Äôm yet to receive that call, which I‚Äôm not really precious about. However, the toilets and changing rooms definitely have a ventilation and air conditioning problem. All in all, it is cheap and you feel it all the time! (Most photos taken on different dates.
Update (Oct‚Äô19): Nothing except the cleaning seems to have improved. More dumbbells have gone missing shown in the new photo. The PT guy screams, shouts, sings with such a loud voice; management is non-existent. Such a shame for the great investment in these facilities.
showerReviews.author: Korhan Tunca

showerReviews.reviewText:
Most inconsistent gym I‚Äôve ever been to. MOST of the staff are great and helpful.

As well as unclean changing rooms and toilets (consistently), tonight they decided that customers don‚Äôt need lights when trying to use the lockers to get their stuff and to get changed. So, we had to use the flashlight on our phones to see what we were doing. This was no doubt to try and get us out quickly despite the sports centre still being open for another 10 mins but it‚Äôs just dangerous and unnecessary.

This gym is cheap and you‚Äôre constantly reminded of that but it doesn‚Äôt have to be that way.

If there were ANY other options closer to me, I‚Äôd be going there. Hopefully a puregym or something else opens up under one of the new blocks being built in the area.

I‚Äôll keep adding photos of what other things the staff decide to surprise us members with as there‚Äôs almost always something!
showerReviews.author: G

locations.address: ÓÉàChelsea Manor St, London SW3 5PL, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: Very well maintained pool with a period charm about it. I like the frieze at the deep-end depicting a few swimmers and a Victorian couple surveying the view.  The insistence on showering before swimming is very welcome as not all 'Better' pools are so good on this. Minor quibbles amount to personal preference : the pool is a tiny bit too warm and i much prefer open plan showers to the cubicle type though might not be practical given the mixed changing rooms. Would definitely come back if i'm in the area.
showerReviews.author: Morgan Hayes

locations.title: Lido
locations.address: ÓÉà41 Gerrard St, London W1D 5QF, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Review: A Timeless Gem in Chinatown ‚Äì Lido Never Disappoints

Rating: ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

I‚Äôve just returned from a New Year‚Äôs Eve dinner at Lido in London‚Äôs Chinatown, and I am still buzzing from the experience. Heading a party of five on such a busy night can sometimes be a gamble, but Lido delivered an absolute masterclass in Cantonese cuisine.

A Trip Down Memory Lane
Lido holds a special place in my heart; it‚Äôs the oldest Chinese restaurant in London, established in 1969. I first visited back in the 1980s during my student days, and stepping back inside felt like a warm homecoming. While many places in the area have changed hands or lost their soul, Lido has maintained that authentic, vibrant atmosphere that makes Chinatown so iconic.

The Food: Fresh, Generous, and Perfect

This was, without exaggeration, the best Chinese food I‚Äôve had in a very long time. Every dish arrived piping hot and cooked to perfection. Despite being New Year's Eve, the quality didn't falter for a second.

What we ordered:
* Starters: A selection of Dim Sum and Chicken & Sweet Corn + Hot & Sour Soups‚Äîthe dumplings were delicate and the soups were deeply flavourful and warming on a freezing day.

* Mains:
* Beef in Black Bean Sauce: The beef was incredibly tender.
* Sweet & Sour Chicken: Perfectly balanced, not overly syrupy.
* Crispy Beef in Chilli Sauce: Exactly the right amount of "crunch" and heat.
* Fried Crispy Noodles with Vegetables: Fresh, vibrant greens and great texture.
* Egg Fried Rice: Fluffy and seasoned just right.

The portions were impressively large, ensuring everyone in our party left completely satisfied and we even had a bit left over which we took home.

We washed it all down with couple of pots of hot and tasty Jasmine Tea.

Service & Value:
The service was impeccable. Even with the holiday rush, the staff were attentive, professional, and kept the evening flowing smoothly.

For a landmark restaurant of this caliber, the bill was reasonably priced, especially considering the central London location and the high quality of the ingredients.

Final Verdict
If you want a taste of "Old Chinatown" that has only gotten better with age, Lido is the place. Whether you‚Äôre a returning regular from the 80s or a first-timer, you‚Äôre in for a treat.
showerReviews.author: Farhad Nikkhah

locations.address: ÓÉàgreat north leisure park, High Rd, London N12 0GL, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: Finchley Lido Leisure Centre is an excellent place for fitness, relaxation, and family fun. The facilities are always clean and well looked after, and the staff are friendly, helpful, and professional. The swimming pool is spacious, with warm water and plenty of lanes, making it great for both casual swimmers and regular training. The gym offers a wide range of modern equipment, and the atmosphere is welcoming for all fitness levels. I also love the family-friendly areas, which make it easy to enjoy a day out with children. Overall, a fantastic centre that offers great value and a consistently positive experience.
showerReviews.author: Pinky007

showerReviews.reviewText: Brilliant central London gym with a huge range of great activities and studio classes, well-equipped gym floor with all the latest kit, nice cafe/hangout areas, a big swimming pool. Staff are friendly and helpful and despite being absolutely massive, the club has a nice community feel. Management are very efficient: changing rooms are very clean with good hot showers, Parlux hairdryers and hair straighteners (there is a small rental charge for towels) and anything that breaks around the club is quickly repaired. If you're not a position to join, you can buy day passes on the payasugym app. Highly recommended.
showerReviews.author: Emily Gray

showerReviews.reviewText:
Good sized gym with several levels, although some equipment is old and doesn‚Äôt function as should.

The locker rooms (I can only speak for the men‚Äôs) are pretty bad - some lockers take your money and you don‚Äôt get them back, showers dirty, soap not restocked, etc.

Cafe - it‚Äôs good for a quiet place to chill however the food and drink is expensive. ¬£3 for a coffee and 50p for anything other than dairy milk (usually just Aldi oat or soya milk). Why am I being penalised for having an allergy!!! Please stop this outdated policy!

Overall the gym is friendly enough (I‚Äôve met one or two aggressive/cocky people since I joined 5 months ago) and most equipment is decent condition. Membership is at a competitive price for central London (although still pricey by most standards).
The changing rooms should be cleaned better and the lockers should be fixed.

locations.title: King's Sport & Wellness - Strand Gym
locations.address: ÓÉàLower Ground, Aldwych, London WC2B 6AN, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
I had really high expectations, as this gym is highly rated at the time of attendance (4.4), and I had bought a gym pass for the day online which seemed to be incredible value for ¬£8.
The gym was oversubscribed at lunch time which is pretty normal in central London gyms.
I was told that I could use the gym lockers "on the gym floor" and buzzed in, I was asked questions about my student ID even though I had bought an external user pass.
I wasn't directed to the lockers however they were easy to find on my own as the gym is not large at all.
I wasted 5 minutes opening each locker with no lock, only to find someone else's belongings inside.
I had no choice but to carry my small back pack onto the gym floor so I could finish my workout in my lunch hour, as the changing rooms are not easily accessible unless you have a permanent pass and I had belongings I didn't want to leave unattended and unlocked.
There are 6 squat racks, but no dedicated bench equipment, so you will have to find a spare bench to move in place (or remove it) and set up as required. There is minimal space between the racks which makes it awkward to load and unload the weights from the bar.
They have 3 unisex self contained toilet, and one disabled toilet. The one I used had no paper towels, I had to dry my hands on my shorts.
The crowd is logically young as it primarily caters to KCL students and staff, one member, visibly unwell, spent their entire session projectile coughing into the small poorly ventilated space. Another, interrupted my bench press to ask me if I knew how to squat.
I was then interrupted by someone else and asked to remove my bag from the gym floor, when I stated there were no lockers they offered to take my bag. However, I had to decline as there is no way to identify the gym staff and it wasn't the same person who I talked to initially, and felt quite uncomfortable that someone wanted to take my belongings. I finished that set and left.

Not a great experience unfortunately. Unless budget is your only concern I would avoid.
showerReviews.author: Francisco Aldao

locations.title: Fitness First Baker St
locations.address: ÓÉà55 Baker St, London W1U 8EW, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
My experience with this company has been disappointing from day one. I was overcharged at the start of my membership, the Baker Street gym often had no hot water, and when I raised this, a staff member told me it was ‚Äúnot their fault‚Äù because management had emailed members. Towels regularly had an unpleasant smell.

The issues became worse when I tried to cancel. From 27 October onward, I emailed several times requesting cancellation, yet my messages were ignored. When they eventually replied, the responsibility was shifted back onto me ‚Äî first claiming I had emailed the ‚Äúgeneric‚Äù address, then explaining that Chelsi could not respond because she was off. No one acknowledged the clear communication failures on their side.

I also reported that my app did not show the cancellation option. They were aware of this problem but did nothing to resolve it, leaving me unable to cancel through the required process. Despite that, I was still charged for an additional month, even though my login was inactive.

A simple cancellation request turned into 6 weeks of unanswered emails, conflicting explanations and misplaced blame. The lack of accountability and consistency, combined with earlier service issues, shows very poor customer care.I can‚Äôt say all Fitness First gyms are the same, but I would certainly avoid the Baker Street location at all costs.
showerReviews.author: Vaida Btk

showerReviews.reviewText:
A small gym that's good for cardio, but extremely limited for weights and resistance machines. I guess the price is based on the location more than the facilities, but still it feels a bit too high given the lack of equipment.

Also the showers have a lot steps, some of which are hard to see (I have a couple of bruises now, thanks). When I finally got to one, passed the several out of order ones, the water was icy. There was a temperature control but the hot water pressure was so low as to practically not run at all.

Overall I'd only recommend it if you're already a PureGym member somewhere else and are using this one occasionally. I wouldn't take out membership just for this.

A small gym that's good for cardio, but extremely limited for weights and resistance machines. I guess the price is based on the location more than the facilities, but still it feels a bit too high given the lack of equipment.

Also the showers have a lot steps, some of which are hard to see (I have a couple of bruises now, thanks). When I finally got to one, passed the several out of order ones, the water was icy. There was a temperature control but the hot water pressure was so low as to practically not run at all.

Overall I'd only recommend it if you're already a PureGym member somewhere else and are using this one occasionally. I wouldn't take out membership just for this.
showerReviews.author: Terry Dukes-Derwent

showerReviews.reviewText:
I've been a member of this gym since July 2020, and sadly the quality of these facilities degraded over time: machines are being continuously replaced with worse analogs (e.g. last year a smith machine was replaced with another one with a shorter range of movement, made in 2013 with visible rust, see the photo), water in male shower rooms is getting colder and colder (sometimes showers can be shut down for a week), there's no mobile reception at the gym, and the local wifi barely works. Going to this gym at 6-7pm on Mon-Wed is impossible because the amount of equipment is insufficient for all members at this time.
I flagged my concerns at the end of 2023 when I received a feedback form from PureGym, and to my surprise the response was basically discarding all of my points and claiming that everything functions properly.
To sum up, I don't anticipate any positive changes coming to this gym, so I've switched to another [non-PureGym] gym in the area, where for the same price I can enjoy 24x7 opening time, sauna, brand new equipment, great wifi connectivity and get motivated by professional athletes working out next to me.

Bye Pure Gymü•≤ Maybe one day you'll change for the better.
showerReviews.author: Ivan Protsyuk

showerReviews.reviewText: I was a member of Soho Gym before it was bought by Pure Gym and I was apprehensive regarding the take-over. I was pleased to see that several of the Soho Gym staff have been retained as they were one of the reasons I joined originally. I was also pleased that they kept the majority of equipment/weights so there is still a good selection (I go off-peak so never any issues with it being too busy - in fact at some times it can be rather lonely). I was disappointed that the toilets and showers have not been updated but hope they will be considering this in future. I also miss the sauna but I understand the economics of getting rid of it. In summary, this is a great gym, at a very competitive price, with a good selection of equipment that is deserted if you are able to go off-peak.
showerReviews.author: Chaz Kinnear

showerReviews.reviewText: I've attended this gym for years. All staff are excellent especially Amin and Fabreese. The gym is cleaned to a good standard. All staff are friendly and approachable. The reason for the 4 star is because of the constant blocked drains in shower room. I previously would shower in the gym after workouts now I avoid the showers. The water does not go down and other shower cubials are flooded with your dirty water when showering. To be fair this has been an ongoing problem for years which seems to have got worst. The upstairs part of the gym has a greenhouse effect because of the slanted glass window. Right now in the summer on hot days, upstairs is like a sauna it's unbearable. The heat also generates to downstairs. The AC half the time doesn't even feel like it's on. At times it's like working out in the Sahara Desert. I think these issues need to be looked at, as it is a lovely gym.
showerReviews.author: Anna T

showerReviews.reviewText:
Poor use of the space - the gym is going for fashion over function by having nice signs and lighting but it really needs more kit. There‚Äôs a lot of space in this gym which is nice, but it really could do with more kit - there‚Äôs room for at least 4 more benches and 3 or 4 more cable towers, the 3 there are simply not enough and are falling apart. Really needs some upgrade to the cable attachments too, PureGym does way better in that department - get some EZ bar attachments and lat attachments without the terrible rubber grip. The gym is reasonably clean (a few patches of water about‚Ä¶not sure why) but signs, especially the big G sign, are covered in dust. Lockers need benches by them in the corridor.

This is a shame, clearly a new gym for the area and the kit that is there is decent but it really needs and could definitely fit more kit. I understand you don‚Äôt want to overfill a gym but it‚Äôs far from that. There‚Äôs potential but I wouldn‚Äôt recommend this gym right now.
