showerReviews.reviewText:
Update to my last update: this gym now all works pretty smoothly. I think people have realised when peak times were and adjusted accordingly. So while there may still be queues at 6-8pm on a Monday (I stopped going at that particular day and time after taking the photo below), it‚Äôs generally just acceptably busy.

From looking at the stats, I‚Äôd suggest this is still the busiest central-ish London gym operated by this brand but it‚Äôs also large and well managed, with a clientele who are serious about fitness but not dicks about it. It‚Äôs not an intimidating place.

The weights areas has been rearranged a few times and now has about as safe, logical and efficient a layout as the available space will allow.

There are more than enough cardio machines.

I still think they‚Äôve gone too big on the functional fitness/box fit/floor exercise area. As a result, when there‚Äôs not a hyrox class on, it looks pretty empty. You‚Äôve got about one third of the gym  housing 6-10 people doing stuff like standing on one leg or pushing a box or hitting a punchbag. And another area of roughly the same size has WAY more people jammed in to use free weights, racks and resistance machines. But clearly that‚Äôs not going to change so I‚Äôll just have to suck it up.

Compared to most gyms I‚Äôve been to, equipment is in a good condition, well maintained, and repairs are prompt when things break down. Although since it‚Äôs only been open 6 months, that is what you‚Äôd hope/expect.

Group activities are very popular and seem well run. I haven‚Äôt actually joined any of them so can‚Äôt really comment beyond that. Staff are friendly and helpful enough, no complaints there. My previous gym was the Castle Centre, where the staff largely acted like they hated you.

The Gym Group‚Äôs ‚Äòhigh security‚Äô door entry system is like something from a 70s sci-fi horror movie ‚Äì or, more specifically, the video for the Buggles‚Äô hit ‚ÄòVideo Killed the Radio Star‚Äô. You get shut in a sinister glass tube, to prevent double shuffling, only being allowed out after what can feel like an uncomfortably long time. But to be honest, I got used to it and I expect you will too.

Entry is via a QR code, or you can manually enter a 9-digit PIN instead. I suspect the latter is adding to the numbers using the gym, thanks to the miracle of PIN sharing. Call it a hunch.

At super-busy times, queues can result because neither entry method is what you‚Äôd call instantaneous, you have to do it to get out as well as to get in, and there are only two doors. Ideally, they need a third door.

Maybe it‚Äôs just me though ‚Äì I HATE queuing, whereas I know that for most British people, it‚Äôs basically the nation‚Äôs favourite pastime. ü§∑üèº‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è

The changing rooms are pretty tiny but I don‚Äôt think this will be a problem as most of the clientele will be hyper local and will change/shower at home. There are some complaints about theft in other reviews but I‚Äôve seen no evidence of that. In fact, what I find mind-blowing is that most people here seem more than happy to leave their stuff in lockers they don‚Äôt even bother to padlock. So presumably it‚Äôs not a crime hotspot by any means.

Anyway, some minor nitpicking aside, this is a really excellent gym, especially if you‚Äôre able to go before 5 or after 8, or on evenings other than Monday to Wednesday. It‚Äôs both the best gym in the immediate area and also the cheapest, which is a hard combination to argue with. It‚Äôs also way nicer than the other Gym Group gym down Walworth Road.
showerReviews.author: Duncan B

showerReviews.reviewText:
I joined the gym after a quick look around - new equipment, a good selection of weights, large area for functional activities/stretching so it seemed like a no brainer.

Unfortunately there are some drawbacks which made me switch gyms after less than two weeks.
1. There are no wipes/disinfectant. Given the high volume of people some of the machines are left covered in sweat which is gross. Additionally,  my hands felt very grimy after using some equipment so a mid routine hand wash is usually needed. I've had to bring my own wipes to combat this.
2. The number of people training in this gym is ridiculous. There needs to be some cap on memberships. I had over an hour wait time for the smith machine which left me incredibly frustrated and not able to finish my workout. People are continuously asking others how many sets they have left or to work in. I have no problem with this usually, but it happens so frequently that you constantly have to plan ahead to figure out how you can even get your workout done. To add to that, when people work in, there's no way to clean the equipment. Things feel very close quarters when everybody is standing around the same piece of equipment for ages. This also means some exercises are more difficult to get done, like when you need to use both sides of the cables.
3. After setting up a direct debit I was locked out of the gym. There is no reception to sort this out. I didn't know what had happened and spent over 30 minutes ringing the bell at the front to just get in to talk to a member of staff. While the member of staff was lovely and allowed me to workout they couldn't help with my issue. This was Friday evening and I had to ring the company to sort it out. I couldn't then get into the gym until the Tuesday as it was a bank holiday and there was no other way around this. The worker on the phone did fix the issue very quickly, but after paying the first month and joining fee only three days before, to get locked out because I had to choose a different card to pay the following month's membership seemed extreme and badly run. As a result, I missed a whole bank holiday weekend. I was unwilling to go to the gym to sort it out with staff due to the long wait to get in Friday night. I understand the business model of not having a reception but it can cause more issues than it's worth.
4. The equipment while new, is not great. There is only one cable machine row which also has a lat pull down attached which I never even got to try since there was always somebody on it. The other lat pull downs are cheaply designed. You cannot get full range of motion as there is a stopper on the cable so when you pull it down towards you, at the moment you're about to get maximum benefit, the bar cannot be lowered anymore. Some machines have an extra small incremental weight you can slide on, but the bar is warped on some meaning there is no option to remove this, making it difficult to choose a suitable weight and having to find workarounds.
5. There is no atmosphere in the gym. Big groups of people stand around talking, the changing rooms are uninviting (I don't think I've seen anybody use the showers), the in and out door system where you have to stand in a tube is ridiculous and results in queues of people trying to get out. It makes me feel like I'm a tiny bug trapped in a test tube. Weights are left on machines, people have poor gym etiquette, overcrowded, machines are dirty and people are always hawk eye waiting for machines to come free or standing over you waiting for your to finish your sets.

Changes:
1. There NEEDS to be wipes/disinfectant, machines with sweat marks are not acceptable.
2. They need at least one (ideally two) more cable machines. Need another smith machine and change some of the lat pull downs.
3. Limit the number of people who can join in a month.
4. Need a member of staff monitoring the floor and cleaning machines.

If you casually go to the gym and have a very flexible workout regime then this gym is good value. If you want to train seriously  or work a 9-5 I'd go elsewhere.
showerReviews.author: Margaret

showerReviews.reviewText:
One star. I hate this place. Worst gym in London.

Hygiene
The smell hits your nose at the entrance. Urine spreads through the whole building. Toilets leak often, so the stench moves from the changing rooms to the gym floor. Floors stay filthy. Toilet paper covers the ground. Sinks look stained. Showers smell like smoke because people light up weed in there all the time. Sweat covers benches, bars and handles. No one wipes anything. No working soap half the time.

Safety
Lockers offer zero protection. Thieves ripped out almost every locker door months ago. The frames still sit open. Anyone can walk in and grab your stuff. Walls in the changing room stay punched in, broken, smashed. Ceiling leaks drop from above, and staff say the water comes from the toilets upstairs. I refuse to train under that.

Equipment
Benches feel slippery because of old sweat. Machines feel loose. Out of order signs pop up all week. Kit stays broken for long periods. Half the gym looks neglected.

Overall
I leave this place in a bad mood every time. My sessions feel ruined by the smell, the mess, the leaks, the dirt and the sense of zero safety. I tell people to avoid this branch. This gym needs a full overhaul, not small fixes.
showerReviews.author: Petr Bakatin

showerReviews.reviewText:
One star. I hate this place. Worst gym in London.

Hygiene
The smell hits your nose at the entrance. Urine spreads through the whole building. Toilets leak often, so the stench moves from the changing rooms to the gym floor. Floors stay filthy. Toilet paper covers the ground. Sinks look stained. Showers smell like smoke because people light up weed in there all the time. Sweat covers benches, bars and handles. No one wipes anything. No working soap half the time.

Safety
Lockers offer zero protection. Thieves ripped out almost every locker door months ago. The frames still sit open. Anyone can walk in and grab your stuff. Walls in the changing room stay punched in, broken, smashed. Ceiling leaks drop from above, and staff say the water comes from the toilets upstairs. I refuse to train under that.

Equipment
Benches feel slippery because of old sweat. Machines feel loose. Out of order signs pop up all week. Kit stays broken for long periods. Half the gym looks neglected.

Overall
I leave this place in a bad mood every time. My sessions feel ruined by the smell, the mess, the leaks, the dirt and the sense of zero safety. I tell people to avoid this branch. This gym needs a full overhaul, not small fixes.
showerReviews.author: Petr Bakatin

showerReviews.reviewText:
I HAVE NEVER SEEN A GYM AS DIRTY AND NEGLECTED AS THIS ONE.
For the price you charge, the very least you could do is clean the bathroom floors at least once a day.
There have been dried blood drops and rubbish all around in the men‚Äôs locker room for over a month, it‚Äôs impossible to use the showers because of the stench of rot and urine that fills the place‚Äîand let‚Äôs not even talk about the toilets‚Ä¶
In the fitness area everything is a complete disaster as well: there is absolutely no order for the dumbbells or weights, everything is scattered everywhere and I waste more time trying to find something than actually training.
No one uses a towel, so the benches and machines are all dirty and covered in sweat; the treadmills and other cardio machines have clearly never been cleaned, you can literally see dried sweat marks all over them.
And you can‚Äôt say that the places are been cleaned daily because I‚Äôve seen the same trash for more than a week in the same places.
I‚Äôve tried three times to buy a sports drink before training, but it seems like nobody ever refills the vending machines.
I‚Äôm attaching photos of everything, and I really hope things improve because this is honestly a scam.
showerReviews.author: Lucero Anzorena

locations.title: The Gym Group London Monument
locations.address: ÓÉà10 Lower Thames St, London EC3R 6EN, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
This gym has gone downnnnnnnhill. I hate coming here. We pay for a 24 hour gym because we want the flexibility to visit the gym at any time. The changing rooms are always locked when I get there around 1am for cleaning. Once the cleaners clean the changing rooms, they should be opened back, not us waiting for the whole gym to be clean.  One time, my clothes were locked inside, and the female cleaner refused to unlock the changing rooms until she was done. You expect us to women to share one disabled toilet with the men and every person who uses the gym at night. I had to change in that toilet one time right after someone had defecated. All because the toilets remain locked. Sort that out. It makes no sense.

The boxing bag has been removed. The led strip lights in the bike room don‚Äôt come on anymore.

My membership price isn‚Äôt worth the facilities. The tap in the ladies toilet has been green and faulty for over 2 years now. I renewed my membership and it was still the same.  We are paying for full use of the facilities.

There‚Äôs no support or customer service at night. It‚Äôs just a waste of money. I leave this gym feeling irritated every time. I had to stop paying my membership. I wouldn‚Äôt recommend this gym at all.
showerReviews.author: Kav

showerReviews.reviewText:
This Vauxhall branch is London's most inclusive social experiment: penthouse owners and social housing residents, all equally sweaty and united in their quest for gains.
The machines are plentiful, the staff are friendly (they actually greet you!), and the efficiency is superb.

However, the community spirit is intense: I once had to decline a spontaneous shower invitation from a fellow member. Come for the gear and the genuine human connection, but maybe bring your own soap. Highly recommended.
showerReviews.author: Niall von Howard

locations.title: The Gym Group London Stepney Green
locations.address: ÓÉàWickham House, 69-89 Mile End Rd, Bethnal Green, London E1 4TT, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
The Gym Group in Stepney Green has become my go-to workout spot, and not just because it‚Äôs only a short walk from the station. It‚Äôs open 24/7, which means I can fit in a session whether I‚Äôm up early or working late. The space is bright, clean, and well laid out, with plenty of cardio machines, free weights, and resistance equipment. Even at peak times, I rarely have to wait long for the kit I want.

What I really appreciate is how beginner-friendly it feels. There‚Äôs no intimidating ‚Äúgym bro‚Äù atmosphere here‚Äîpeople tend to be focused on their own workouts, and the staff are friendly and approachable. I‚Äôve had quick, helpful chats about how to adjust machines or improve my form, which made me feel more confident using the equipment.

The changing rooms and showers are kept in good condition, and the lockers are big enough for a backpack. It‚Äôs also great value for money, with flexible no-contract memberships. My only small gripe is that the free weight area can get a bit crowded in the evenings, but that‚Äôs to be expected in London.

Overall, Stepney Green‚Äôs Gym Group delivers exactly what I need: affordable, accessible fitness in a welcoming space.
showerReviews.author: Indra Wibawa

showerReviews.reviewText:
Positives: nice, big, spacious gym. Super friendly staff members always willing to help and overall a lovely vibe.
Negative: it‚Äôs neglected. I‚Äôve been a member since 2020 and I don‚Äôt think one cardio machine has been replaced. Worn out, dated treadmills, rowers that look like they‚Äôre from 2005, a skii machine that‚Äôs always broken, none of the spin bikes are adequate. It‚Äôs a shame because it‚Äôs such a well used gym and things are hammered. They recently closed for a refresh and I was excited to see what had been changed - unfortunately the old and broken machines, the lockers that you can‚Äôt even close all remain, but they painted a wall and installed a new light!
It‚Äôs a shame that the Gym Group has allowed this gym to become so run down as it is a really gem in East London.
showerReviews.author: A M

showerReviews.reviewText:
First of all, the photos and videos associated with this google page are mostly not even this location. Pathetic.

Been a member here for a while, have been to other gym group locations in London and around England, and generally the best word I can use to describe this location is detestable.

No cleaning spray available, but they will say guests are supposed to bring their own towels. No new equipment since I joined 4 years ago, yet they had the money to purchase a massive(ly useless) weight rack which further makes the space feel over crowded. Staff and management have the audacity to ‚Äútake suggestions‚Äù for what kind of equipment they should buy, then immediately fall back on the excuse that corporate won‚Äôt allow it.

Members are a bunch of children and animals, no one breaks down their equipment after use, dumbbells are never where they should be on the racks, and the staff don‚Äôt/wont/cant enforce the rules of the gym.

You have a higher chance of catching a disease in this gym than you do making use of an outdoor gym in the area. And they don‚Äôt care.
showerReviews.author: Kevin Cooper

locations.title: The Gym Group London Walworth Road
locations.address: ÓÉà332-334 Walworth Rd, London SE17 2NA, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Skip leg day here if you can - It feels like they're driving this gym into the ground so people go the the new E&C branch.

Half the cardio machines are in need of repair, they haven't been replaced or upgraded in close to a decade (I've been a member of this gym since 2017).

If you use the ellipticals, you're playing an increasingly difficult game of find the one machine with a battery - so it doesn't short out the second you pause to take a sip of water.

The rowing machines have the same issue, since there are only three of them (other gyms in this chain tend to have significantly more).

If a machine is completely out of action - you're typically looking at weeks for them to get it sorted.

And I've long given up on using the lockers there. They feel as flimsy as leaving your bike on the street outside and hoping for the best.

When this gym opened, it took advantage of the natural night to create a brilliant atmosphere. Time and neglect have turned it into the kind of grotty place that makes you question your subscription.

Still, reluctantly, using this gym as it's convenient location wise.
showerReviews.author: Amir Amirsolimani

showerReviews.reviewText:
This review is from a person who hate going to the gym, who just find useless and see no point in going to the gym and wonder why and how others go the gym finally admitting how fun it is going to the gym and glad that I have choose The gym.

I booked my first PT session with JD at the Gym Walworth road. I was impressed by his knowledge, approachable attitude and always welcoming nature.

The daily gym exercises which are so easy to book on the app are one of the greatest motivation for me to get fit and to get to know the trainers.

The gym always comes up with great reduction/joining offers, their gym membership is affordable, their app is so easy to use and the best thing is they have no contract. You can take breaks anytime you like.

I have found all the trainers at the gym have different qualities. They all focus on different parts so you have a lot of variety to choose. Although all trainers are best but I found JD and Nelson the best with their welcoming and approachable nature.

Always try to book JD's body conditioning exercise earlier as it always fully booked.
And never skip Leo's HIT exercises who always comes with great varieties of exercises to lose weight.

And this gym can't be the best with out the cheerful people coming in the gym. I have made great work out friends here and always look forward to have a great workout session. Everyone is so helpful and keep look out for others.

This gym deserve 5 star but unfortunately the female bathroom and change room has let me down. I have found the toilets always dirty, broken and wet floor. The entire changing room stinks as soon you would enter which am sure management would look into.

I have called various time to manage my membership over the phone and always spoke with friendly and helpful team.  It would be really helpful if the gym also let us book by selecting a date to start so this would give us more freedom.

Gym lockers should be allowed to use overnight as we bring gym accessories which sometimes hard to take it back as they are heavy. I understand people would be storing everything which they are still doing it despite not being allowed.

Overall, if the cleanliness improved along with few things as stated above,  this gym is a great place to work out.
showerReviews.author: Aras Sara

Bringing a towel isn‚Äôt enough. We need some sanitiser spray or wipes. Have you touched a barbell after a sweaty person has used it?

showerReviews.reviewText:
The gym is fine for what you pay and the hours it serves 247 especially in comparison to other local gyms. It does what it says on the tin and what you pay for. Good variety of machines free weights cables and plenty of squat racks. Missing machines they don‚Äôt have include assisted pull up/dips, laying leg curl, core machines. Also additional attachments for cable machines would be useful like a v bar.
When machines are broken they are fixed in a good amount of time.
Functional area for sled push included with variety of kettlebell.
Good array of cardio machines and a woman‚Äôs only section. Woman‚Äôs only section has all the old equipment and DB up to 10kg.
Member etiquette could be improved no one deracks and staff don‚Äôt bother cleaning up so you find equipment everywhere in random places can be really frustrating. Lots of young members with their tripods you often trip over their camera sticks.
Gym doesn‚Äôt provide any hygiene stations to wipe down or clean equipment.
Membership includes 2 hr free parking in the chimes takes about. 10 m to walk there and walk back. Come before 8am and you can park on the high street or outside.
Staff could definitely work harder in cleaning up, you often see the cleaning paper on the wall signed off with all the hours ticked off up to 10am slot when it‚Äôs only 7am.
Male bald head worker comes across quite creepy approaching all females and making unneeded comments.
247 toilet has been out of order this week which has been FOUL how can you expect anyone let alone a female no toilet space to urinate during a workout !
Toilets super foul see photo and this is ladies toilets? Other image shown staff lying about their checks and the times their signing off interesting DB signing off at 8:05 when it isn‚Äôt even 7am yet ?
Also some members have mad BO.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Absolutely loved this gym, but after being a member for over two years there are a few things over the last year that definitely need improving. The air conditioning is not great. The gym gets extremely hot in the summer which isn't ideal at all. Broken equipment sometimes takes a long time to fix. There have been issues with soap and toilet paper running out in the changing rooms.  There are no cleaning stations on the gym floor so if equipment is left covered in sweat there is no way to clean it off. Not many rubbish bins around so people leave  rubbish on the treadmills rather than find a bin. The cleaner can be cleaning around you on the gym floor, but usually just hoovering (sometimes between your legs when you're mid set which is a bit odd!) Lots of weights not put away and can be left all over the place. Looking a bit tired in places and some equipment needs refreshing. The good points are nice members, the size of the gym, free parking and the overall amount of equipment available especially when it's all working. Overall I still love the gym but there are a few frustrations.

I believe there is a manager now so hopefully things will improve again üôè
showerReviews.author: S W

showerReviews.reviewText:
For the price, its a very decent gym with a lot of variety of equipment! But, there are issues! In the men's changing room, there is only 1 cubicle toilet and 2 urinals! For the amount of men members that attend the gym, this is not enough! They should really think about getting more cubicles installed! 2nd issue with the mens changing rooms is that I think there is a drainage issue because sometimes it really smells like a used and abused toilet in there! 3rd issue with the mens changing rooms is that there are 5 showers and only 1 of them has a good water pressure! The other 4 have low water pressure! Another issue with the mens showers is that when you use furthest left or right shower, the sensors for the lights must not reach them as it goes dark quite quick and you can only get them to come back on by left the shower and the sensor picking up your movement! The showers could get a better clean too! There are also a lot of lockers which don't work!

Another issue is that most of the time, there is one or more bits of equipment broken and it takes a while until they're repaired! Considering that they have raised the money on quite a few occasions since it changed from Exercise for Less to JD GYM, they should really priorities getting equipment fixed quicker and to be honest, more equipment!

Another issue I find when it comes to the winter and the summer. They won't put any heating on over the winter and they rarely put the Aircon on over the summer.

I think if the price ever reached ¬£30 or more for a month, I would leave and find a new gym!
showerReviews.author: Travis Jones

locations.title: JD Gyms Luton
locations.address: ÓÉàChaul End Ln, Maidenhall, Luton LU4 8FD, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
The gym itself is nice, well equipped & seems to have everything you need.
Friendly staff, though they're not always around when you need them.

The problem lies with a lot of the members there who show a severe lack of respect to the gym & other members.
I've seen people take out 6-8 dumbbells at once so other people can't use them.
I've seen people finish with their weights but just leave them on the floor instead of putting them back on the racks & it's getting to the point where I feel like I may need to challenge some of the other members on this since the staff don't bother to police the gym.

People will spend 5-10 mins on machines in between their sets whilst scrolling or taking selfies on their phones.

Some days, the dumbbell & barbell racks are nearly empty cause people just leave them on the floor.

Littering is another problem. There are plenty of bins, but people just leave their empty water bottles wherever they have been working out, whether that's in the gym, in the changing room, or in the sauna.
The toilet cubicles are often littered with toilet paper, much to the annoyance of the one cleaner who seems to work 24hr shifts there, but the poor thing struggles to keep on top of everything.
The cardio equipment tends to come with rubbish or chewing gum in the cup holders.

The showers are so vile that I've stopped using them, empty toiletry bottles, used underwear hanging everywhere, people feeling the need to spit & snot everywhere as soon as they step into the shower, it's little wonder why I kept on getting ill when using them.

The sauna is nice, but again it tends to have a few empty bottles cast aside in there. Plus members tossing eucalyptus oil everywhere to the point where you're blinded by the fumes when you walk in.

Despite going here for a year now I'm still yet to find a quiet period as the place seems to be constantly packed, especially on bank holidays.

I do think this gym has the potential to be a really great place with a really good atmosphere, the colour scheme of the gym is nice & I like the decorative plants going up the wall on the stairs.

The staff just need to really step up their game of making sure members are actually respecting the environment as small notices on the mirrors of Don't drop the weights & Please return weights after using them, clearly aren't working.

Edit: They have improved things a bit. I like the new equipment & they've utilised the space a bit more. There is much less rubbish on the gym floor, however there is still quite a bit in the changing room & on the cardio machines.

There is still a very large problem with members being too lazy to put equipment back, instead opting to just kick it aside when they're finished with it. As my video shows.
showerReviews.author: Marky2409

showerReviews.reviewText:
This gym advertises 24/7, but the ventilation (AHU) is not running 24/7 as it should. It gets switched off at night and only turned back on at 5 a.m. ‚Äì which means air circulation is poor and CO‚ÇÇ levels, especially on the second floor, are extremely high. That‚Äôs not only uncomfortable but also unhealthy for members training late at night or early in the morning.

Hygiene is another serious issue. There seems to be no proper deep cleaning. For example, chewing gum has been stuck in a treadmill bottle holder for over a month without anyone noticing or cleaning it. If small things like this are ignored, it makes you question how well the rest of the facility is maintained.

Overall, very disappointing for a gym that promotes itself as 24/7. Both air quality and cleanliness need urgent improvement to meet even basic health and safety standards.
showerReviews.author: Alex

Went twice and I shall not be returning, even at a quiet time at 5am it still wasn‚Äôt worth it. I‚Äôm usually not fussed about showering at a gym, but this place is a no go zone. showerReviews.reviewText:
Been a Member for a little over 3 months and love it. Equipment, while a little older than Pure gyms, feels great to use with a much heavier emphasis on weights rather than cardio like some other commercial gyms.

Love the boxing area a great way to unwind after a stressful day with a nice amount of bags for multiple people to use at once.

Sauna is fantastic and is a great way to relax after a long session at the gym as well as the showers are great especially with the cold shower allowing you to do a sauna then cold plunge.

Only issue I have is that equipment can be out of order for a long time and it's just due to general wear and tear from lots of use.

Even with the little issues I plan to keep going on a regular basis.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Now..... 15/02/24

Disappointed Decline: My Updated Experience with JD Gym

Ten months ago, I eagerly signed up with JD Gym, excited about the prospect of getting fit and healthy. Back then, I was genuinely happy with the gym and even left a positive review. However, things have taken a nosedive since then, and I've had to make the tough decision to cancel my membership and find another gym. Let me break down why.

First off, let's talk about the changing rooms and toilets for men. It's honestly a nightmare in there. The smell hits you the moment you walk in, and there's just no escaping it. It's like there's zero ventilation. The floors are always wet, the sinks are busted, the soap dispensers are always empty, and don't even get me started on the mess ‚Äì it's like nobody ever bothers to clean up after themselves. Plus, half the lockers are busted or missing doors, which is just inconvenient and makes you worry about the security of your stuff.

I want to give credit where it's due ‚Äì the staff are really friendly and helpful. They're always there to lend a hand or offer advice. But unfortunately, their positive attitude can't make up for the fact that the gym itself feels like it's falling apart. The equipment is getting old and worn out, and it seems like nobody's bothering to maintain it properly.

So, as much as I hate to say it, JD Gym just isn't cutting it for me anymore. The decline in cleanliness and the state of the facilities have made it clear that it's time for me to move on. I'll miss the friendly faces, but I need a gym that prioritizes hygiene and upkeep.

Initial review upon joining 10 months ago
===================================================
JD Gym in Milton Keynes is an excellent place for fitness enthusiasts to work out. As soon as you enter the gym, you will be greeted by the modern and clean facilities. The gym is spacious, with plenty of room for everyone to move around without feeling cramped. The gym is equipped with a wide range of modern equipment, which is well-maintained and in great condition. This ensures that you will always find what you need to get a complete workout.

The staff at JD Gym are friendly, helpful, and knowledgeable. They are always available to assist you with any queries you may have and are willing to listen to your feedback. This dedication to customer satisfaction is reflected in the gym's amenities, which include free parking for members, saunas, and showers. These extras allow you to relax and refresh after a workout, making your experience at the gym even more enjoyable.

In conclusion, JD Gym in Milton Keynes is an excellent choice for those looking for a modern, well-equipped gym with a friendly and dedicated staff. With ample space, high-quality equipment, and great amenities, JD Gym is sure to meet your fitness needs.
showerReviews.author: Cyrus Wolf

locations.title: JD Gyms Reading - Now open! 1st month ¬£5
locations.address: ÓÉàReading Link Retail Park, Rose Kiln Ln, Reading RG2 0SN, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: JD Gyms in Reading. First trip on opening day. This is a great gym no denying it. Superb equipment. Open and spacious gym across 2 floors. Changing rooms are upstairs left for women right for men. Scan the QR code on the plaque by the turnstiles as you come in for fast WIFI - seamless add and login. You‚Äôll need a padlock you can‚Äôt have bags on the floor - buy one in the vending machine for okay price. Changing rooms really good. Sauna a bit odd, you all kind of sit in a glass box and stare out at everyone ‚Ä¶ no they are not mixed there is one in each changing room. Staff seem cool. It smells so new. Downstairs is Hammer Strength machine heaven. Upstairs is cardio and Matrix kit - the newer stuff. It‚Äôs well lit inside considering no windows or natural light source. Music is okay from considerable speaker system. Parking - good luck with that! And when leaving the tricky road layout is a white knuckle logic test for sure. Thanks to JD team member Marlena who was very helpful and answered a few questions while showing me round the gym on the first day!Recommended.
showerReviews.author: Rory Cantellow

showerReviews.reviewText:
I initially liked this gym. Good equipment and a decent suna. Issues are though, I cannot use the changing rooms late at night (inc the suna and shower, being a chef if I wanna work out after my shift that sucks) when those facilities are Available i can only really use them in the morning when it isnt jammed (given the hours i work, i tend to wake up later in the day). Also why would I go to the gym if I cant shower after, like come on i dont wanna go home in my sweaty clothes.

Will say the changing rooms otherwise are pretty good, most of the showers have hooks and shelves.

Also ive come to find its a bit nasty, hard to actually find a spay and paper towls to wipe down equipment with unlike other gyms. Its basic curtesy to do so but i feel id have to bring my own in to do so.

You have to ask staff if you want to go in more than once in a day (let's say you left something in your car for example) not to mention the full dependency on your phone, I swear there is basically no number option so if your phone is dead better hope someone is on staff.

Sadly I'll be going to another gym after trying this one out a second time now, to sadly find it hasn‚Äôt improved at all.
showerReviews.author: Jacob White

showerReviews.reviewText:
Great equipment and space, including women‚Äôs only section. The changing rooms are also good and kept in good condition/cleanliness.
Good variety of classes at different days/times too. Gemma‚Äôs spin classes are great, so empowering and get a good sweat on!
Love that they responded to customer feedback and are now 24/7, however they removed the cleaning stations last year and I can‚Äôt understand why. People now can‚Äôt clean their own equipment down which is a bit uncomfortable sometimes.
I would say the entry QR codes are a bit annoying as they only work once a day but I sometimes go twice due to work schedules and class times - even more inconvenient now it‚Äôs 24/7 and staff aren‚Äôt always available. Also there is an ongoing issue that the front door will note open with my QR code before 6am which defeats the point of being 24/7. When I raised this with staff they simply told me it was fine and invalidates my genuine issue. Also the new wifi was good for a couple weeks but now does not work so I end up using data which doesn‚Äôt always have signal.

locations.title: JD Gyms Newcastle Benton
locations.address: ÓÉàNorth Tyne Retail Park, Whitley Rd, Newcastle upon Tyne NE12 9SR, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
COOL NEW GYM!
This place used to be Xercise4Less, and it was in pretty bad shape before. But now that it‚Äôs been taken over by JD Gyms, they‚Äôve clearly spent a lot of money turning this into a super-mega gym!

The first thing you‚Äôll notice is how much space there is and the open-plan layout of the place. It‚Äôs laid out really well and it‚Äôs easy to find what you‚Äôre looking for ‚Ä¶ even though this place is a mammoth 24,000 sq.ft

The cardio area is all in a line and it‚Äôs easy to spot where machines are free. The main part of the gym floor is full of machines and plate loaded equipment, which looks awesome from above.

They have a functional Eleiko rig area with 6 Olympic weightlifting platforms, so you won‚Äôt struggle to get on anything even at busy times. And that free weights area is massive, just look at some of the pictures!

The only things that aren‚Äôt open-plan are the main studio for classes, and the cool-blue Spin room. It‚Äôs worth noting that classes are free and included in the price of membership.

The changing rooms have been upgraded, and with new lockers too, which is a bonus.

Overall for the money you‚Äôre paying (currently ¬£19.99 per month), it‚Äôs definitely worth joining - even if you‚Äôre a member of another gym already. Either cancel your old membership and join here, or just have both. It‚Äôs cheap enough!
showerReviews.author: Ninh Ly

showerReviews.reviewText:
This brand new gym is excellent!
Located right next to Sainsbury's with plenty of free parking, this gym has it all.

Brand new, loads of equipment and there's some cool things that you probably haven't seen in other gyms, like the quirky mood lighting and the foliage on the walls.

I don't think you'll struggle to find equipment to use (see the pictures) and people seem to enjoy the fitness classes, which are included in the cost of membership.

I also like the saunas in the changing room!

Overall, this is definitely worth the money - have a look around if you're not sure about joining. But I guarantee that you won't regret it!

showerReviews.reviewText:
SUPER MODERN GYM AT A LOW PRICE!
If you‚Äôre a member at JD Gyms Hempstead Valley, I recommend paying the extra money to use both facilities as this is a lush gym! If you‚Äôre not a member at all, definitely come and check this place out.

Massive floor space with lots of weights and weightlifting equipment downstairs, Eleiko kit is super cool here. And the upstairs is your cardio area, changing rooms, toning areas & a studio for classes so if you‚Äôre the self-conscious type, you could easily spend your entire workout upstairs without encountering the bodybuilder types downstairs.

The gym seems to go on forever, so if you like a modern workout space without feeling claustrophobic, this is the place for you. The fit and finish is definitely superior to any other gym you've been to.

Saunas and 24-hour access is included in the package, but the parking outside can get a little busy, so consider parking at the overflow car park where Homebase is.

Other than that, it‚Äôs definitely one of the best gyms in the area.

locations.title: JD Gyms Glasgow South
locations.address: ÓÉàRetail Park, Crown St, Glasgow G5 0US, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Having read other reviews and being a regular user of this gym I had to add my comments.

The good points - cost, some of the staff are friendly and knowledgeable.

The negatives - some of the members are a problem with their disgusting habits.   The changing rooms are too small and when busy it's not a pleasant experience at all.  Too many members treat it like their own bathroom.  I've seen people shaving at the sink in the toilets, trimming their beards and nostrils in front of the mirrors.  Gross - where's the hair going?  I don't go to the saunas, again there are members who think it's fine to use them wearing boxer shorts.

I try to use the showers as little as possible, they often stink, and people make some weird noises showering.  Best just shower at home if that's possible.

In short the changing area merits a 1/5 score.  They are gross and cramped.

The gym itself is largely ok.  As other reviews have stated there really should be some cleaning equipment.  I saw the business response saying they were from covid.  If your members want the option to clean equipment before or after use then you should accommodate that regardless, I think it's just a cost cutting measure that these are no longer available.  Especially important considering numerous reviews question hygiene and cleanliness.

The gym itself is a touch overcrowded.  I don't dare go after 4pm as it's far too busy.   I've spoke to other members who feel the same.

Some equipment is under high demand.  Some days it can be quite frustrating trying to use what you want to.  Doesn't help when some staff and gym goers pair up using a machine then do 4+ sets.

As at January 2025, there are getting to be too many people filming their workouts now.  Again if it's not staff producing content for their Instagram (which I can understand to an extent) more and more regular gym users are doing this now too, it's getting a bit much.  Does noone just workout and not film themselves these days?

Lastly.  Far too many gym users don't put equipment away after use.  For example leaving benches at cables machines and squat racks for other users to have to move.    Similar with weights, these are left all over the place, or everywhere except where they are supposed to be.

Changing area is often soaked as sauna users walk barefoot thru changing room or do what the guy in picture is doing and cool off on the benches.  Ends up with floor being wet and all the seats being wet.

Recently changed the layout.  Spacing of equipment has got worse.  I should probably collect a wage from this gym from the amount of weights I have to find, return etc.

Also worth noting - if you wish to cancel they ask for 30 days notice and will refer you to debt companies if you cancel the direct debit.  You have to contact them by email and they are very slow to respond. I've contacted them twice and they will take at least 2 weeks to reply. Having said that I received a satisfactory outcome to my email request so that's one slight positive.
showerReviews.author: S C

showerReviews.reviewText:
Having read other reviews and being a regular user of this gym I had to add my comments.

The good points - cost, some of the staff are friendly and knowledgeable.

The negatives - some of the members are a problem with their disgusting habits.   The changing rooms are too small and when busy it's not a pleasant experience at all.  Too many members treat it like their own bathroom.  I've seen people shaving at the sink in the toilets, trimming their beards and nostrils in front of the mirrors.  Gross - where's the hair going?  I don't go to the saunas, again there are members who think it's fine to use them wearing boxer shorts.

I try to use the showers as little as possible, they often stink, and people make some weird noises showering.  Best just shower at home if that's possible.

In short the changing area merits a 1/5 score.  They are gross and cramped.

The gym itself is largely ok.  As other reviews have stated there really should be some cleaning equipment.  I saw the business response saying they were from covid.  If your members want the option to clean equipment before or after use then you should accommodate that regardless, I think it's just a cost cutting measure that these are no longer available.  Especially important considering numerous reviews question hygiene and cleanliness.

The gym itself is a touch overcrowded.  I don't dare go after 4pm as it's far too busy.   I've spoke to other members who feel the same.

Some equipment is under high demand.  Some days it can be quite frustrating trying to use what you want to.  Doesn't help when some staff and gym goers pair up using a machine then do 4+ sets.

As at January 2025, there are getting to be too many people filming their workouts now.  Again if it's not staff producing content for their Instagram (which I can understand to an extent) more and more regular gym users are doing this now too, it's getting a bit much.  Does noone just workout and not film themselves these days?

Lastly.  Far too many gym users don't put equipment away after use.  For example leaving benches at cables machines and squat racks for other users to have to move.    Similar with weights, these are left all over the place, or everywhere except where they are supposed to be.

Changing area is often soaked as sauna users walk barefoot thru changing room or do what the guy in picture is doing and cool off on the benches.  Ends up with floor being wet and all the seats being wet.

Recently changed the layout.  Spacing of equipment has got worse.  I should probably collect a wage from this gym from the amount of weights I have to find, return etc.

Also worth noting - if you wish to cancel they ask for 30 days notice and will refer you to debt companies if you cancel the direct debit.  You have to contact them by email and they are very slow to respond. I've contacted them twice and they will take at least 2 weeks to reply. Having said that I received a satisfactory outcome to my email request so that's one slight positive.
showerReviews.author: S C

showerReviews.reviewText:
Hand dryer in the women‚Äôs toilet hasn‚Äôt been working for at least a month, if not more. Toilets are also always blocked or not working and there‚Äôs never any soap !!!!

Feel like we were so hygiene aware during covid and this has disappeared again. During the height of summer there were absolutely no cleaning supplies, meaning that me and everyone else were leaving machines absolutely dripping in sweat with no means of cleaning them - and no it‚Äôs not hygienic to bring and use your own sweaty towel either. Blue roll and spray at multiple stations should be an absolute necessity.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Not sure where to start the equipment or the management team. Most of the machines are out of order you would be extremely lucky to ever get the leg extension working and when you ask for an update on the machines "There seems to be a delay because of COVID" you can get away with anything by using COVID.  The 26kg Dumbbell has been missing for over 4 months and the maintenance of the equipment is shocking. The changing rooms are filthy, just be careful you do not slip as there will be water and empty bottles everywhere, this place is never cleaned.

The previous management team was quite friendly but the new manager at the gym "Laura" will get away with murder. I was recently targeted for discrimination and extremely rude behavior and when making a complaint my access has been disabled, so it will backfire if you are from a different background. So please if you are ever picked on by the manager, any racist comments or face discrimination by her, do not act just smile and carry on with your session.

You have the option for Gym Group, Extreme gym or Pure gym close by, so join a gym where you would feel welcome and appreciated as a long valued member.

locations.title: JD Gyms Farnborough
locations.address: ÓÉàFarnborough Gate, Blackwater Shopping Centre, Farnborough GU14 8BL, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
REALLY IMPRESSIVE GYM!

So I know they've advertised this for a while, but it's definitely been worth the wait.
The gym is super modern and ultra premium looking and you'll notice that the first time you step in.
The equipment looks amazing and it seems bulletproof. Especially the weightlifting area downstairs, the massive free weights bit.
And even the cardio and class studio looks super swish.
To top it off, they've got massage guns in the gym (I've never seen that before?!), nice changing rooms and saunas.

AND it's open 24 hours a day!

If you're interested in joining, it's definitely worth having a look around before signing up.
showerReviews.author: Ninh Ly

locations.title: Energie Fitness Borough
locations.address: ÓÉàUnit 4 & 5a, 1 Pocock St, London SE1 0FN, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
I joined the Energie Fitness Borough gym early September 2025 as I wanted to use the sauna. I have been pleasantly surprised by how clean the Girls' changing facilities are, as my previous gym was not well maintained and suffered from drain flies, cockroaches, and other consequences of a dirty environment.

I usually visit later in the evening and I'm often there when Adama, the regular cleaner, comes in to do her job. Adama is so considerate and helpful, she has always made sure I don't feel like I'm in her way, going out of her way to enable me to use the changing room, showers, and toilets while she's cleaning the areas.

However, I do have one complaint regarding the facilities. I no longer use the large bin in the Girls locker room as my hand got trapped by the weighted swing lid and it was very painful.

locations.address: ÓÉàJct 2, Welcome Break, Gateway Services M1, 4 Mill Hill, London NW7 3HU, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
It‚Äôs the last chance, or the first I guess, to  have a wee, get fuel, food, papers or just a coffee on the M1 Motorway. I didn‚Äôt used to like it much because the potholes were big enough to take your tyre of its rim and I dread to think how many were and how the Miriad of delivery mopeds coped. The certainly didn‚Äôt need traffic calming measures but guess what? They had the biggest road humps I think I‚Äôve ever seen.
Anyway thank the gods all those problems have gone. Tarmac is good and smooth and the traffic humps are normal. The most used part of the services are always the toilets and these are placed through the front entrance and down to ,the right. There is a Game Zone on the corner. Due to it being just below ground level the are both a few steps and a ramp for the less mobile of us. Toilets are fine with the weird Dyson hand driers stolen from scooter handlebars but they work great despite that. Coming out of the ‚ÄúLoo‚Äôs ‚Äú there is a Waitrose and then WH Smith‚Äôs on your right and then round to the left you have Subway and then Burger King. To finish the food and drink there is a Starbucks as you come in the Services entrance who have a sit in and an outside seating area for when it‚Äôs nice weather. Outside there is a washing machine pod where you can wash upto 20kg  (or so the sign says).
There are 24 Tesla superchargers then 4 Grid serve chargers by the walkway to the entrance and all round the outside left of the car park (with your back to the entrance) there are 24 charging points, but I‚Äôm not sure of the company who operates them,
showerReviews.author: Bobby Dazzler

locations.title: Welcome Break South Mimms Services M25
locations.address: ÓÉà23 M25, Bignells Corner, Potters Bar EN6 3QQ, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
I‚Äôd give Welcome Break South Mimms Services a solid 3 out of 5. It‚Äôs a functional stop on the M25, not amazing but it gets the job done. I grabbed a tuna pitta wrap from Pret A Manger, fresh, decent quality, and a nice change from the usual greasy options.

There are plenty of places to eat here, including Burger King, KFC, Subway, PizzaExpress, Taco Bell, Costa, and Starbucks (there's even a drive-thru). You‚Äôll also find a WHSmith, Krispy Kreme, and a small Waitrose if you need to stock up on snacks or drinks. So whether you‚Äôre after fast food, coffee, or something a bit lighter, there‚Äôs a decent range of choices.

The car park is big and easy to navigate. There are separate areas for cars, lorries, coaches, and caravans, which helps keep things organised. Parking is free for the first two hours, but if you stay longer, it gets pricey ‚Äî ¬£15 for up to 24 hours. Definitely something to keep in mind if you're planning a longer break.

Facilities are generally clean and up to date. It‚Äôs one of the better stops for electric vehicle drivers, with a large selection of EV chargers including GRIDSERVE, Applegreen, and Tesla. Inside, there‚Äôs also a Ramada hotel, showers, and even a small gaming area.

If you‚Äôre in the mood for something a bit more relaxed, there are a couple of pubs in the nearby village of South Mimms, like The Black Horse and The White Hart. They‚Äôre not far and might make a nicer stop if you‚Äôre not in a rush.

Overall, South Mimms isn‚Äôt anything special, but it‚Äôs convenient, has a wide range of food options, and decent parking. Not bad at all for a quick break on a long drive.
showerReviews.author: Ayyub Chowdhury

showerReviews.reviewText:
I‚Äôd give Welcome Break South Mimms Services a solid 3 out of 5. It‚Äôs a functional stop on the M25, not amazing but it gets the job done. I grabbed a tuna pitta wrap from Pret A Manger, fresh, decent quality, and a nice change from the usual greasy options.

There are plenty of places to eat here, including Burger King, KFC, Subway, PizzaExpress, Taco Bell, Costa, and Starbucks (there's even a drive-thru). You‚Äôll also find a WHSmith, Krispy Kreme, and a small Waitrose if you need to stock up on snacks or drinks. So whether you‚Äôre after fast food, coffee, or something a bit lighter, there‚Äôs a decent range of choices.

The car park is big and easy to navigate. There are separate areas for cars, lorries, coaches, and caravans, which helps keep things organised. Parking is free for the first two hours, but if you stay longer, it gets pricey ‚Äî ¬£15 for up to 24 hours. Definitely something to keep in mind if you're planning a longer break.

Facilities are generally clean and up to date. It‚Äôs one of the better stops for electric vehicle drivers, with a large selection of EV chargers including GRIDSERVE, Applegreen, and Tesla. Inside, there‚Äôs also a Ramada hotel, showers, and even a small gaming area.

If you‚Äôre in the mood for something a bit more relaxed, there are a couple of pubs in the nearby village of South Mimms, like The Black Horse and The White Hart. They‚Äôre not far and might make a nicer stop if you‚Äôre not in a rush.

Overall, South Mimms isn‚Äôt anything special, but it‚Äôs convenient, has a wide range of food options, and decent parking. Not bad at all for a quick break on a long drive.
showerReviews.author: Ayyub Chowdhury

showerReviews.reviewText: A good spot to have a break, use the wash facilities and grab a bite to eat.  There‚Äôs plenty of food choices if you‚Äôre picky, Taco Bell, Burger King, Pizza Express, KFC, Breakfast bar and much more. The seating area is very clean, the floods are immaculate and that‚Äôs the first thing I noticed, just how looked after the area were. The toilets were really well kept with over thirty toilets with disabled facilities, and baby changing too. If you want more than just food, there is an arcade to spend time in, and an electronic gadget store for all your phone bits. Friendly staff serving food. Be mindful you are praying inflated prices as it‚Äôs a service station. Double the usual rice for food, magazines, snacks and so on .

showerReviews.reviewText:
The only reason this gets 1 star is because you can't rate it 0.
¬£39 overnight parking, the parking area is full of potholes, some 5 6/7 inches deep.
You can be blocked in if leaving early as people are allowed to park anywhere (not monitored).
The showers are a disgrace,
Nowhere to hang your clothes, no flat surfaces to put anything on, the shower has to be pressed continuously, which means you have to shower with one hand (not easy). The water temperature is at best described as tepid (no temperature control)
The drain was that full of hair and grease that the water was still 2 inches deep when I left and will probably still be there if I was to ever go back (nor a chance.
Complained to staff and told to put a review on, so here it is, but as we all know, nothing will change.
¬£4,000  a night ¬£20,000 a week, and you can't even get a shower.
These places should be shut down and directors put on jail (most people would treat an animal like this
Bet they don't respond, or if they do, it will be sorry to hear about your experience. we will look into it, or we are looking to have a  refurbishment of all facilities
Stay well clear use thier facilities and parking during the day and stay well clear at night or shower somewhere else
DISGRACEFUL

Personally I don't class this as a meal after a 12 hour shift. Bring your own food, I do as been in here before. When parked today 8/10/24 was let park up and pay for parking before being told showers not working, tried a few times, I won't park again.

showerReviews.reviewText: If you plan to park for night out here you will be surrounded with refrigerators. showerReviews.reviewText:
As a HGV driver after 12 plus hour day i do look forward to a hot shower in clean facilities. On the whole in nearly 40yrs on the road, I have put up with some terrible facilities, even temporary ones when updates are in progress but this evening (11/11/25) the temporary shower (only 1) provided was freezing cold in a shower room which was awash, floor and flat surfaces soaking wet.
Found a staff member who confirmed shower was cold, next staff member (smiths) went to find manager, manager finished at 18.00 so at 18.10 I was left with............... no solution, no alternative  offered. Unlike other services providers who actually set up a room in motel for drivers to shower, MOTO doesn't.
So so fortunate I hadn't actually paid for my parking first. I departed, disappointed as yet another huge provider of service's to the motorist and rinses them while doing it, sticks 2 fingers up at the men and women who transports this country's goods 24/7/365.
showerReviews.author: Andy Martin

Female showers were spotless. The reason was. The button you press for water shut the water off as soon as you let go.
The shower head was missing replaced by a plastic bottle with the bottom cut off and there was not hot water. The duty manager told me the cleaner said it was OK. He really didn't care. And if you want to complain there is no email address. There is a write to us address at Toddington.
If this was worth ¬£32 id rather stop at road chef. Feel free to reply to this Moto. Your customer service is appalling

locations.title: Welcome Break Oxford Services M40
locations.address: ÓÉàRoad, M40 Motorway, Junction 8a Thame, Oxford OX33 1LJ, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
I stopped at Welcome Break Oxford Services (M40) while driving from London to charge my Tesla and take a short break. It turned out to be one of the better service stations I‚Äôve visited. The toilets were spotless, with plenty of cubicles available even during a busy afternoon, which made the stop quick and convenient.

There‚Äôs a good range of food options including Burger King, Subway, and KFC, along with a well-stocked WH Smith for snacks, magazines, and travel essentials. The EV charging area was easy to find and worked smoothly, though it‚Äôs worth checking availability ahead if you‚Äôre stopping at peak times.

Parking is free for the first two hours, which is perfect for a short rest or a quick meal. I also appreciated the step-free access and other accessibility features, which make the site welcoming for everyone. The green frontage and small water feature give it a relaxed, open feel‚Äînice to unwind for a few minutes before getting back on the road.

Overall, this service area is a clean, comfortable, and well-equipped stop for anyone driving along the M40. Whether you‚Äôre recharging your car or yourself, it‚Äôs a sound choice with everything you might need. Just plan a bit of extra time if you‚Äôre depending on EV chargers or particular restaurants during rush hours.
showerReviews.author: sandesh raikar

The toilets were spotless, with plenty of cubicles available even during a busy afternoon, which made the stop quick and convenient.

There‚Äôs a good range of food options including Burger King, Subway, and KFC, along with a well-stocked WH Smith for snacks, magazines, and travel essentials. The EV charging area was easy to find and worked smoothly, though it‚Äôs worth checking availability ahead if you‚Äôre stopping at peak times.

Parking is free for the first two hours, which is perfect for a short rest or a quick meal. I also appreciated the step-free access and other accessibility features, which make the site welcoming for everyone. The green frontage and small water feature give it a relaxed, open feel‚Äînice to unwind for a few minutes before getting back on the road.

Overall, this service area is a clean, comfortable, and well-equipped stop for anyone driving along the M40. Whether you‚Äôre recharging your car or yourself, it‚Äôs a sound choice with everything you might need. Just plan a bit of extra time if you‚Äôre depending on EV chargers or particular restaurants during rush hours.
showerReviews.author: sandesh raikar

showerReviews.reviewText: Spacious parking for trucks, food court with variety of places to choose from but most will be your standard fast food shops. Truck stop stinks of piss even tho there is a toilet about 50 meters away (shows the truck drivers culture really well). All in all it's ok but I would avoid parking here if I can. Toilets in the main building are ok and have been refurbished recently, showers are ok too. I personally use this services for fuel only, lack of security, poor food choices and  stench of piss put me off parking here overnight.
showerReviews.author: George Babiy

showerReviews.reviewText:
I stopped at Welcome Break‚Äôs Oxford Services on the M40 (J8A) recently during a long drive, and it was a surprisingly polished and diverse pit‚Äëstop. The place is clean, bright, and even has a free piano you can tinkle on while taking a break. The food court offers something for every craving: KFC, Burger King, Subway, Chopstix, and the bright The Good Breakfast breakfast bar (step‚Äëfree access and all‚ÄØ‚Äì‚ÄØideal for stretching your legs)  . If you're in the mood for coffee, there‚Äôs both a Starbucks inside and a separate Drive‚ÄëThru, plus a Taco Bell that opened in March 2025. And for a slightly more upscale sit‚Äëdown, there‚Äôs a PizzaExpress and a good-sized Waitrose & Partners for everything from grab‚Äëand‚Äëgo sandwiches to snacks  . Between those options and WHSmith, Krispy‚ÄØKreme, and the petrol forecourts, it really does feel like a small food village on the motorway.

From my point of view, it‚Äôs one of the best service‚Äëstation experiences on the M40. You‚Äôve got the classics‚ÄîKFC, McWhopper‚Äëstyle flame‚Äëgrill from Burger King, Subway subs‚Äîplus hot‚Äëfood diversity with Chopstix noodles and Taco Bell‚Äôs new menu. I particularly enjoyed the sit‚Äëdown at PizzaExpress; it felt like a proper break rather than just refuelling. The two hours free parking, clean baby‚Äëchange areas, EV chargers, showers, and a Ramada hotel on‚Äësite make it practical for any kind of stop‚Äîwhether it‚Äôs a quick food run or a short-freshen‚Äëup break. I‚Äôll definitely be adding this to my travel rota‚ÄîI‚Äôd rather stop here than settle for a rushed snack at a less appealing service station.
showerReviews.author: Pranav

locations.title: YHA London Central Hostel
locations.address: ÓÉà104 Bolsover St, London W1W 5NU, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Had a very pleasant 2 night stay in the female only dorm here which was perfect for my trip to London. I've never had a bad experience in a YHA and this hostel was no exception.

The main reception which doubles as a lounge is full of light and has a fun, relaxing vibe to it. I was warmly welcomed by the staff when I arrived around 10pm and they were ready with suggestions on things to do in London (you also get discounts if you book attraction tickets at their main desk). You can get a proper barista coffee or Yorkshire tea at reception, or have a beer (they stock Camden hells). They have a self catering kitchen as YHAs do, and you can also buy food at the hostel, although I didn't use it on my trip. Free filtered water at reception.

They have a lift and entry to the stairs going to the bedrooms was key card controlled, as is every room and dorm. I felt very safe. The dorms have spacious boxes under the bed that can be locked, one for each person in the room (bring a padlock) and I was able to fit a carry on inside. Beside each bed is a bedside lamp, power outlet and small shelf big enough to put your glasses on and phone. Each dorm also has coat hangers and pegs to put your coats. The rooms are clean, with fresh sheets and duvet etc. and the shared shower and toilets outside the dorm were spotless (lovely powerful shower!). I rented a huge towel from reception for a very reasonable ¬£2.50

The only comment I have about the rooms are they are very hot even with the window open, I think because of how close they are to the showers which is not something the hostel can control. But having encountered this before in other hostels round the world I came prepared.

Finally the location is excellent, easy to get to from Euston and very close to tube stations and Regents park. The area felt safe at night and it was very easy to find my way back - if you get lost, follow the BT tower and you'll be in the right neighbourhood in no time!

I met some great people in this hostel and had a brilliant time! I would definitely return.
showerReviews.author: Laura F

showerReviews.reviewText:
Location or good sleep? If you want sleep for your trip, i wouldn‚Äôt recommend this hostel. The cathedral rings in the midnight and early morning and you‚Äôll hear the door slum, chat and steps in corridor as the building is old.

No self-catering kitchen but you can use hot water dispenser in the dining area. Cold water is available from the tap in your washbasin. Luggage locker costs 2-3¬£ (only coins) or just drop in the storage room.

The most advantage here is location but the neighbor Wombat Hostel is also good distance from landmarks with sturdy building.

locations.title: Astor Museum Hostel
locations.address: ÓÉà27 Montague St, London WC1B 5BH, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: Stayed for five nights and had a great time! For a hostel it was quite clean, people were quite respectful too. i made some good friends and joined in on group activities and had so much fun! The showers dont have any shelves or baskets or ledges to set your toiletries, so make sure you have a bag of some sort since there are 2 hooks on the walls. storage baskets were a tad noisey but i had no issues since my roommates and i were all considerate with our noise and we all woke up/slept around the same time. staff are super friendly and anthony took a group of us out to a pub! location is right in central which was really nice. overall it was my first hostel experience, im a big germaphobe and managed just fine so would definitely recommend!
showerReviews.author: mia

showerReviews.reviewText: Stayed for five nights and had a great time! showerReviews.author: mia

showerReviews.reviewText:
This hostel is more than suitable for a short stay with good transport access. I stayed 4 nights in a 4-bed female dorm, and while it‚Äôs not the nicest one I‚Äôve been to, it provided me with the bare minimum of a clean bed to rest my head. Additionally, having a basin with a soap dispenser in my room was very convenient as I didn‚Äôt have to worry about waiting to use a sink in the communal bathrooms. Staff are friendly and helpful. Laundry detergent pods sold for ¬£1 at the front desk. Bathrooms were relatively clean, but shower curtains felt a bit unhygienic.

One of my biggest criticisms, however, is the laundry situation which is pretty dire, so I strongly suggest you to do your laundry elsewhere as there are only two washer-dryers and it was almost a competition to try and get your washing load in before someone else did. While not the fault of the hostel, it also didn‚Äôt help that some people wouldn‚Äôt pick up their laundry up in a timely manner so clothes would be left in the dryer for hours leaving you waiting for longer to use the machines. It‚Äôs also behind a door in a hallway that blocks access to people entering or leaving from the kitchen behind it. I‚Äôve included a photo of it for reference as there don‚Äôt seem to be any photos on their website.

Wifi was pretty patchy too and often forced me to burn up a lot of my mobile data. Power sockets near my bed didn‚Äôt work. Also no lift/elevator (like many hostels), so don‚Äôt bring any massive bags or suitcases with you unless you‚Äôre prepared to drag them up several flights of stairs if you‚Äôre assigned a top level room.
showerReviews.author: Olivia Moreira

Would definitely come back if ever in London again!

locations.title: Smart Russell Square
locations.address: ÓÉà71-72 Guilford St, London WC1N 1DF, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
As a female solo traveler, here are my thoughts:
Location - In a residential, college town area. It was very quiet and safe! The Russell Square station and other forms of transport were close by, which was great! But for my next trip to London, I would do something closer to the heart of the city.
Service - The people who helped me check in were very lovely. The reception desk is open 24 hours. They do give you flat sheets to make your bed, which didn't mind but I know some will.
Rooms - Very small. I stayed in a 9-bed all-female dorm. The room had 3 sets of 3-decker bunk beds. I had the middle bunk, and the head space you get isn't great. To give you an idea, I'm 5'1 and I bearly could sit up straight when in bed. The bathrooms were soooooo tiny. Again, I'm literally 5'1 and don't weigh more than 130lb and I barely close the door behind myself. There are lockers in the room (bring your own lock)
Overall - If this is the cheapest option you have available and you just need a place to sleep in an area that feels safe, I'd recommend this place. But if you have a bit more to spend (even just $5 more) I'd say find a place closer to the very center of London (Buckingham Palace, Big Ben, Tower of London areas) and it have bigger room.
showerReviews.author: Brittney Sanchez

showerReviews.reviewText:
Triple bunk beds are uncomfortable, you can‚Äôt even sit on the bed because there‚Äôs no space. I got the bottom bunk and it was okay but I guess the upper ones were terrible. Beds are extremely noisy and annoying! They provide earplugs but they are bad quality so make sure you have strong ones.
Dorms are also too hot so bring a thin pyjama.
Toilets are small.
Lockers don‚Äôt work if you don‚Äôt have a thick padlock.
Atmosphere was chill and there were many children.

Overall a nice hostel, if you are not very picky and you re aware of those things.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Pros: Very clean hostel, excellent location. Super useful luggage storage (free before check-in, affordable price after check-out). I walked to most of my attractions on foot, saved lots of money. üòÅ

Cons: No lift. I felt tired that I needed to climb many floors as I always used the common area for air-conditioning and water refill. Especially after a long walk of the day. üòµ‚Äçüí´ No air-conditioning in my 9-bed dorm. Thankfully to the extra 2 fans and arrangement for a bottom bulk bed near window upon my request. I was able to sleep during the hottest heatwave for a few nights. üåû I think the information in some booking websites are incorrectly stated that the rooms in Smart Russell Square are air-conditioned (WHICH IS NOT!!!!!!) ü•µü•µü•µü•µü•µ I survived with my cooling towel and mini USB fan.

To conclude, the hostel is a very good value hostel with an excellent location in London Central. Just make sure that the weather is not too hot and stuffy.

showerReviews.reviewText:
What is with this place, It feels as though smart hostels company is trying to squeeze as much money out of budget travellers as possible. The rooms are tiny but they are crammed full, no room to move around let alone for luggage. You have to make your own bed when you arrive and the duvets are also not washed between guests? Also the bathrooms and common areas were grubby as. Pretty baffled as to where our money was going to be honest.
BUT the people working there are lovely and super helpful so that is a plus, they are so hard working!

Very good value for the price.

The rooms and facilities were clean and the staff were nice and helpful. The rooms had large lockers that fit a medium size suitcase and a medium size backpack.

The beds were reasonably comfortable and had a curtain for privacy. The beds were on the smaller size, so they would be uncomfortable for anyone taller than 1,75m.

The location is good as well, it‚Äôs next to a well connected tube station and many popular places are also walking distance.

If you‚Äôre looking for luxury or something, then it‚Äôs not it. But I‚Äôve stayed in worse places for a lot more money. Quite good for a budget option.

locations.title: The Rose & Crown, London Bridge (PUBLOVE)
locations.address: ÓÉà65 Union St, London SE1 1SG, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
As a pub, this place is great. I really liked the beers and the staff was friendly and the food options seemed nice as well. But since I was a hostel guest primarily, I will base my rating on this experience. I stayed in a female dorm for three nights. The hostel in itself was... really not that good. Let's just say the restrooms down in the pub were cleaner than the toilets and wash rooms for the guests - which I found quite dubious. The showers were gross. The general cleanliness really leaves room for improvement.
The room was okay and the bed was comfortable. The best part is the location since borough market is just a 3 minute walk.

I really wish I could give 3 stars because I always feel bad when giving a bad review but it really wouldn't represent the reality.

I've been staying in hostels for 20 years and that was one of the worst things I've seen. You had to wipe the things down before you put anything on you wanted to wear after showering. The floor of one shower was broken and another one comepletly out of order but for that you got a smell that made you almost throw up from the toilet that was in there. All in all NOT a great experience. At least the pub was nice and staff was very friendly.

locations.title: The Steam Engine, Waterloo (PUBLOVE)
locations.address: ÓÉà41- 42 Cosser St, London SE1 7BU, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
I stayed here for one night during my visit to London and had a great experience overall. The dorms were clean, calm, and comfortable, perfect for a short stay. Each bed has a reading light and charging point, which makes it easy to use your phone or laptop without disturbing others. Lockable boxes are provided for storing your luggage - about 40x30x20 cm in size, ideal for small bags or backpacks. It's better to carry your own lock and key, but you can also buy one from the reception if needed. There's also a separate baggage storage area available for a small charge, which is handy if you want to explore after checkout.

The showers and toilets were spotless, with good water pressure. The staff were friendly, polite, and always ready to help. One thing I really liked is the z4-hour bar - a great place to relax or meet other travellers. The location is another big plus: it's within walking distance to the London Eye, so most attractions are easily reachable. The overall vibe was peaceful and safe. For the price and location, this dormitory offers excellent value and comfort. I'd definitely stay here again.
showerReviews.author: Anandu Lal P

locations.title: St Christopher's Inn London Bridge - The Village
locations.address: ÓÉà161-165, 165 Borough High St, London SE1 1HR, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
First time staying here.
We would have liked to rate it a 4 star as service was excellent.
Great bar right on location with live music and fabulous atmosphere.
Safe place for lone travellers.
Clean building.
The showers were ok a little tight though but hot water and cleaning to efficient standard.
Unfortunately our room was number 400 so we were situated up a lot of Victorian steep stairs and the lift was out of order!
This was an absolute no when carrying luggage.
Due to the inconvenience we missed breakfast because it was too much of an effort with the lack of lift .
Liked the bar a lot and the employeess were really friendly and helpful.
We hope they are on a decent salary.

showerReviews.author: City Star Cleaning Diorazio

showerReviews.reviewText:
First time staying here.
We would have liked to rate it a 4 star as service was excellent.
Great bar right on location with live music and fabulous atmosphere.
Safe place for lone travellers.
Clean building.
The showers were ok a little tight though but hot water and cleaning to efficient standard.
Unfortunately our room was number 400 so we were situated up a lot of Victorian steep stairs and the lift was out of order!
This was an absolute no when carrying luggage.
Due to the inconvenience we missed breakfast because it was too much of an effort with the lack of lift .
Liked the bar a lot and the employeess were really friendly and helpful.
We hope they are on a decent salary.
We would return but only if the lift was in action .
showerReviews.author: City Star Cleaning Diorazio

showerReviews.reviewText:
Unfortunately, my stay at this hostel was disappointing. The staff were not friendly and seemed to only care about doing everything quickly rather than helping guests properly.

At check-in, they forced me to install their app, even though it‚Äôs possible to get the room code on paper. The Wi-Fi in my room was very poor, so I had to use my own mobile data (LTE) the whole time.

When I wanted to extend my stay, I messaged them through the app. They told me I could either book again on the website or come downstairs, and they would handle it quickly. However, when I went to the reception, they told me to do it online instead ‚Äî very unorganized.

I also booked two nights with breakfast, but during check-in, no one gave me a breakfast voucher. The next morning, I was not allowed into the breakfast room because I didn‚Äôt have the voucher. After checking, they realized it was their mistake but still said it was my fault for not asking for it.

The rooms are very small, and there were no events or activities, even though they advertise social events.

On the first night, a fire alarm went off, and the staff were already outside. No one took care to wake up or guide the guests ‚Äî the only thing they did was collect all the towels afterward.

Overall, I wouldn‚Äôt recommend this hostel. The service, communication, and organization were all poor.
showerReviews.author: Iliass El Asri
