showerReviews.reviewText: stayed here for 4 nights in a 9 bed mixed dorm. the dorms were relatively clean but had some staining on the privacy curtains. the beds were comfortable for a hostel. the bunks however are very rickety and make a ton of noise and movement anytime someone moves. there are big lockers in the rooms that you can put your own lock on which is great. the bathrooms were cleaned often but there were roaches in them. however there are tons of shared bathrooms/showers available on the floors along with a few single bathrooms without showers. the rooftop patio had a few mice running around and the door to inside is often left open‚Ä¶not the greatest sign, but there was a few picnic tables to be able to sit at. not much common area except for the bar which from my experience seemed underwhelming to say the least. my biggest complaint is the lack of kitchen, but there is a microwave and kettle which helped somewhat. overall not the best, not the worst.

locations.title: Holiday Inn Express Harlow by IHG
locations.address: ÓÉàEssex, Crown Gate, Harlow CM20 1NB, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: I stayed here with a group of girlfriends. We had two rooms between us. Both rooms were excellent, equipped with everything you could need, hairdryers, ironing boards, tea and coffee facilities. The rooms were emaculate, (thank you  to the cleaning staff) the beds were really comfortable and had two choices of pillows, hard and soft, (something I've not come across before in any other hotel I've stayed in). Nice big TV and easy access to WiFi. The reception staff were exceptional, easy check in and really efficient and friendly. It got better. Breakfast (included) was something else. So much choice, hot and cold. The breakfast staff were also lovely, nothing was too much trouble. Coffee choices were varied and so were the breakfast choices, absolutely delicious. The whole hotel is very tastefully decorated and welcoming. More importantly, we felt safe and well looked after. Parking is easy and very reasonably priced. I would highly recommend this hotel for price and all the reasons above. I would definitely stay here again. Thank you to ALL the staff, it was an excellent stay.

showerReviews.reviewText: The Centre is very well run and caters for all ages, offering supervised team-building activities, including archery. The accommodation block is clean and welcoming, with full kitchen facilities.  Camping areas can also be booked and there toilet/shower facilities (for bookings only). Additionally, there are good barbeque areas (barbeques are not currently permitted elsewhere in Moat Mount). Excellent place for overseas visitors with bus connection to Edgware tube station (Northern Line) from where journeys into Central London take only around 30 minutes.

showerReviews.reviewText: So me and my brother booked this site as we work away from home. What a lively site, its so clean, I mean everywhere. This site is so well looked after. If you do come here you have to download an app for the electric which you top up...its so straight forward though. The staff themselves are very friendly amd welcoming. I genuinely haven't got a bad thing to say about this site....(well I kind of do) its expensive for us as we have to still pay for everything at home and here...but thats life, not the sites fault üòä seriously though, no complaints from us, well done Wyatts üëçüèº

locations.title: Crystal Palace Caravan and Motorhome Club Campsite
locations.address: ÓÉàOld Cople Ln, Crystal Palace Parade, London SE19 1UF, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
We spent a relaxing weekend staying 2 nights at the beginning of June 2024, just pottering around the campsite and local area whilst many others, predominantly Borussia Dortmund supports from Germany ventured further afield to Wembley for Champions League final.

What I would say is please don't arrive before 1pm. You won't be allowed in if you arrive before so if you do arrive early find yourself somewhere to park up and wait.

The campsite is well laid out, very well maintained, clean and well-kept. It's not uniformly laid out which is great, several grass pitches as well as hardstanding, all clearly marked and signed. The handy plan of the site provided on arrival, as with many sites, is also very handy.

The shower and toilet block was very clean. It is closed for an hour each day for cleaning. Access is via a key, provided on check-in.

It took us about ten to fifteen minutes to walk into the town whilst the park is immediately behind the site. There's a nice caf√© there and some good dog walks as well as the park's maze, which surprisingly was food fun.

Level 9 Google reviewer; 1,000 plus reviews, 1.5 million views and over 12,000 photos with over 50 million views and still going strong üí™.  Although I'm not enamoured with Google and their service at the moment ü§∑üèª‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è.  They're inconsistent.

Check out my other reviews üåü üåü üåü üåü üåü.

showerReviews.reviewText: Very nice clean site. I would recommend this camp site for a city break. As you go out of the site, there are loads of buses going to London, and other places. They also have a tent part with there own showers and toilets.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Update:June 2024
Just as good as always, but sadly, it does seem like the threat of closure is going to come true. It will be sad to lose such a lovely site (fabulous mature trees and wildlife) which is well connected to central London. The alternative is very different in its location and vibe. Visit while you still can.
Update: November 2023
Good location on the northern edge of Crystal Palace Park. Set in amongst lots of mature trees, the pitches are located on several loops off a road. There are two areas near to the office with flat grass pitches for tents.
The facilities are not the newest, but everything works well and is very clean (other site users permitting) and the toilet and shower blocks are warm and the water is hot. A pleasure to use. Dishwashing and black water disposal are outside and there is a campervan service area. These are all next to the toilet and shower blocks. There is a dog walking area on site.
There is a good selection of wildlife on site with urban foxes scouting for food (don't leave rubbish out or awnings unzipped!), lots of small birds, rooks, squirrels and green parakeets that you can always hear even if you can't see them.
The site is close to bus stops with good connections to town. The railway station and 'centre' of Crystal Palace (shops, restaurants, takeaways and bars) is about a fifteen minute walk away. For emergency purchases, there is a petrol station a short way along the road outside the site.
Being in town, this isn't the quietest site and concerts and events are held in the park and these can be loud, but they always end at 23.00. If you are a light sleeper, bring earplugs and check what events are taking place nearby. We got to hear some banging sets from acts performing at Wireless last summer, but it won't be to everyone's taste. The bass sounds were loud enough to get our VW resonating and buzzin'
We've stayed here lots of times and will continue to come back for as long as the site stays open - hopefully for many years to come.
Excellent location. Tired but clean facilities. The site is run by nice, friendly people who are very helpful. If you don't fancy the walk into town (walk in and bus back!) check out the number 3 bus route.
showerReviews.author: Jnib

showerReviews.reviewText:
Great little campsite hidden away in London, run by a great friendly and helpful couple.
Handy but basic shop.
You can pay by card for campsite fee but you need cash for shop purchases so have some ready for supplies.
Sainsbury's supermarket plus a stack of shops, bars and eatery's close by if you don't fancy cooking.
Traffic is loud at night despite the high surrounding wall so earplugs or earphones advisable.
That said, we were in our roof top tent so we were definitely much higher than ground level and nearer wall top height.
Ground tents were probably much quieter.
Toilets, showers and dish washing areas all very good, very clean and well maintained.
Would use again and happily recommend it.üëçüëå
showerReviews.author: Brad Blunt

locations.title: Thistle London Bloomsbury Park
locations.address: ÓÉà126 Southampton Row, London WC1B 5AD, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
I recently stayed at this hotel and it was one of the most disappointing experiences I‚Äôve ever had. The value for money is absolutely nonexistent. They assign rooms on the 5th and 7th floors, yet the elevators have reportedly been out of service for at least two weeks. Carrying luggage up and down multiple floors was unacceptable for the price point.they are not offering help. Also their It system was down and we waited a lot at 2 am to go room.

rooms shown online are clearly from the few renovated units, but the majority of the rooms are old, worn out, and far from clean. The carpets and curtains were stained and smelled unpleasant. There is no air conditioning, which is shocking for any modern hotel. The windows are like museum style wooden frames that barely open or close, letting in cold air and outside noise.

Another strange detail is instead of providing complimentary water for all trouble, they started to sell the waters and removed the waters from rooms  .The towels had no fresh scent and felt poorly maintained.

The bed was extremely small, barely the size of a single bed, and not even stable. The base slides to the sides with the slightest movement, making it impossible to sleep comfortably.

Overall, this hotel fails in all basic standards of comfort, cleanliness, and service. I would strongly advise future guests to avoid this place there are far better options in the same area for the same or even lower price. I wish I had seen an honest review before booking hopefully, this helps someone else
showerReviews.author: Beg√ºm Akarsu

The sheets were uncomfortable, and while the shower pressure was good, the drain was clogged. Overall, I am giving three stars, mainly for the kind hospitality arranged by the university college.

showerReviews.reviewText: Selected this hotel for our Mum/Daughter trip as our usual hotel was unavailable. The room was large by London standards with a King bed that was clean and comfortable. The bathroom was large as well with hot water (I couldn't get cold ‚Ä¶

showerReviews.reviewText: Selected this hotel for our Mum/Daughter trip as our usual hotel was unavailable. The room was large by London standards with a King bed that was clean and comfortable. The bathroom was large as well with hot water (I couldn't get cold ‚Ä¶
showerReviews.author: JenJen85254

showerReviews.reviewText:
We have stayed at the Thistle Hyde Park Kensington Gardens several times over the past years and returned twice in October. For us, the hotel offers the perfect combination of accessibility, relaxation, and comfort.

The Underground stations Queensway (Central Line), Bayswater (Circle/District Line), and Lancaster Gate (Central Line) are all within a few minutes‚Äô walk, and Paddington Station can be reached with a slightly longer stroll. The hotel is located directly opposite the northern side of Hyde Park, and as the name suggests, Kensington Gardens are just a stone‚Äôs throw away. The nearby Queensway provides plenty of restaurants, supermarkets, and shopping opportunities. There used to be a small petrol station with a convenience store right below the hotel, which is currently closed for renovation.

The rooms are ‚Äì typically for London ‚Äì compact but well designed, functional, and comfortable, usually featuring a narrow bathroom with a shower. The Rooms with a View on the upper floors are particularly recommended, as they offer a bit more space and a beautiful view over Hyde Park and the London skyline. We stayed in a family room for four people on the top (9th) floor, consisting of two rooms connected by a small hallway with a bathroom and bathtub. Each room had a double bed and a wall-mounted TV; one also offered additional seating and a small refrigerator. Despite being street-facing, the rooms were pleasantly quiet.

The hotel staff are consistently friendly, helpful, and attentive in all areas ‚Äì reception, restaurant, and room service. Early arrivals are well managed: guests can store their luggage safely and start exploring London right away. On previous visits, we were even able to check in early in the morning. On the day of departure, luggage can again be stored at the hotel until the actual time of leaving. The Uber terminal and umbrella station in the lobby are also very convenient ‚Äì both can be quite handy in London‚Äôs unpredictable weather.

If you have booked breakfast, it‚Äôs worth checking the notices in the elevators, especially regarding peak times. On weekends, the buffet area can get busy. The breakfast itself offers a wide selection of hot and cold dishes: various egg options, bacon, sausages, mushrooms, and beans, as well as a good choice of bread, cold cuts, cheese, cereals, and sweet pastries like croissants and cakes. Coffee and tea are available from several machines, alongside a variety of juices. The breakfast area is nicely arranged, comfortable, and spacious enough to ensure a relaxed atmosphere even when full.

For guests arriving by car, parking spaces are available (for a fee) both in the courtyard and in the underground garage ‚Äì a convenient option, though we usually travel by train and therefore don‚Äôt use this service.

Conclusion: A thoroughly recommendable hotel with an excellent location, friendly service, and solid comfort ‚Äì a reliable place to stay in London that we‚Äôve happily returned to for years.
showerReviews.author: Markus Tigges

locations.address: ÓÉà47 Gloucester Pl, London W1U 8JE, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Avoid staying at this hotel.  We checked in early yesterday temp really high. We were   able to leave our bags as our room was not ready.  I booked a restaurant reservation for 7pm.  Got back to the hotel up 8 flights of stairs to the top room no lift... found the electric fan not working. Phone was not working to ring reception. Went back downstairs to report fan not working was told they would replace it which he did with a,smaller fan. Insisted on showing me how to use said fan..  Then we were going to have a shower before going out went into the bathroom to find they had not  provided any towels. Had to report this to reception and wait a further 10 mins for towels. Sink faulty dripping tap the , shower went from warm to freezing cold. Bedding did not fit bed... not worth the price.
Very disappointing.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Ideally I'd like to give 2.5 stars. The price and location are great. The room was small, as expected. The biggest issue was the cleanliness. We very nearly opted not to stay. As mentioned by other reviewers, there was no mattress or pillow protectors. The bedding was too small (the sheet wouldn't tuck in so you'd likely wake up on the mattress itself). The duvet was too small (the exact same size as the mattress) and was damaged so wouldn't do up. The biggest issue was that the bedding was covered in hair and stains. I counted up to 10 hairs before I stopped! We covered the pillows in our own shirts, requested 2 sheets to wrap the mattress in and slept in our clothes. Pretty gross!

The shower was tiny too. Lucky I'm slim!

locations.title: Park Plaza London Riverbank
locations.address: ÓÉà18 Albert Embankment, London SE1 7TJ, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Horrible, Neglectful, and Overpriced Experience

This was one of the worst hotel stays I have ever had, and extremely disappointing, especially considering the price and the fact that this was my second stay here.

We booked two rooms for one week, and shockingly the bed covers were never changed during the entire stay. Housekeeping was consistently poor. In one of the rooms, the bathroom floor was dirty upon arrival, and we had to ask for the room to be cleaned again immediately.

Basic amenities were handled terribly. Shampoo and shower gel were not provided unless we asked, and shaving and dental kits were only provided for ONE room ‚Äî and only on the last day. Completely unacceptable for a hotel of this level.

The overall experience was horrible. To make things worse, we were charged extra for breakfast, and due to a mistake on their side, we were charged twice.

The reception and housekeeping staff were rude, dismissive, and unhelpful. Every day we had to complain about cleaning issues. At one point, I escalated the issue to the head of housekeeping, who actually laughed and didn‚Äôt even apologize. The level of neglect and lack of professionalism was shocking.

The only positive point was the restaurant staff, who were polite and genuinely helpful ‚Äî and the view from the restaurant, which is beautiful. Unfortunately, that is where the positives end.

The swimming pool and sauna are not freely accessible ‚Äî you must schedule in advance, which is extremely inconvenient and defeats the purpose of having these facilities.
The food is very average, nothing special, and the restaurant only serves Asian food for dinner or room service, which is very limiting.

The hotel itself feels dark and poorly designed. The lighting is terrible throughout the property. There are not enough power outlets ‚Äî only one charging spot per room, and the hotel does not provide adapters, which is unacceptable for an international hotel.

Most rooms do not have a view, and overall the hotel is grossly overpriced for the service and experience offered.

I even wrote a formal letter to the manager, and I sincerely hope it is read, because this stay completely ruined my time in London.
My first stay here was acceptable ‚Äî this one was absolutely horrible.

I would never stay here again and do not recommend this hotel to anyone.
showerReviews.author: Yousef Assy

showerReviews.reviewText:
My husband and I came to London for the first time for our 25-year anniversary. Not sure exactly where to pick we chose this hotel because it had high reviews. Check in was easy and this hotel is very nice inside. They do have room service, they have an amazing pool and steam room and cold shower. There is a Tesco grocery store a two minute walk, the Vauxhall station is a five minute walk and the London Eye is a 20 minute walk. It's in a great location clean, quiet and very safe.
One of my favorite things is my new friend that I've made Silfa, she works at the front desk she was extremely accommodating very friendly every day we got home she'd welcomed us and ask us how are day was and what we've done it made the entire stay better. Silfa was incredible and we came back for a few more night because of her.
showerReviews.author: Brittany Meyer

showerReviews.reviewText:
Very happy with my stay here!

Stayed in studio room 1559 which was newly and stylishly furnished. Good views, especially from the Executive Suite. Decent enough food at the in house restaurant, and for breakfast.

Excellent service upon check in and also by the staff in the executive suite who went out of their way to make me a special dessert as I am lactose intolerant.

The sauna is great. The swimming pool looks good but is small and often crowded. (Don't think you can swim in it, it's just for standing up in really).

Overall, very pleased!
showerReviews.author: Dave Raval

showerReviews.reviewText:
I stayed at the Park Plaza Riverbank last Wednesday and had a fantastic experience.
Reception & Check-In:
The reception was excellent‚Äîcheck-in was smooth, and the staff were really friendly and welcoming.
Lounge:
I spent some time in the lounge, which had a great selection of drinks and offered an amazing view over the River Thames.
Room:
The room was spacious with a comfortable bed and featured both a bath and a shower, which was a nice touch.
Dining:
I had dinner with a friend at the hotel‚Äôs restaurant. The Asian-inspired food was delicious, and the beers were great too.
Overall:
I was very happy with my stay and will definitely return. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting London.
showerReviews.author: Nicholas McNally

locations.title: Park Plaza London Waterloo
locations.address: ÓÉà6 Hercules Rd, London SE1 7DP, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Our stay at the Waterloo Park Plaza Hotel was generally pleasant. The breakfast and dinner served in the restaurant were of very good quality, and the concierge team were consistently friendly and helpful.

There were, however, some service-related issues. We were asked to book a swimming pool time, although no such information was provided during the booking process or at check-in. Additionally, in the restaurant we were asked to wait to be seated, but no staff member was available at the time despite unreserved tables being free.

The response from staff after we raised our concerns was professional and appreciated. Housekeeping staff were excellent‚Äîour room was cleaned daily and maintained to a high standard.

The hotel facilities were good overall. Although parking is limited (approximately seven spaces), the option to pay separately for on-site parking was convenient for us, particularly when travelling with children. However, the hotel does not offer a dedicated play area for children.

One drawback was the lack of privacy in our third-floor room, as the nearby building was very close and required us to keep the curtains closed throughout our stay.

Overall, the hotel offers good facilities, quality food, and attentive staff in many areas, with some opportunities for improvement in communication, service consistency, and room privacy.
showerReviews.author: AceDel Eiren

locations.title: Kentish Town Sports Centre
locations.address: ÓÉàGrafton Rd, London NW5 3DU, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
I‚Äôve been attending this gym for a while, and while it does have some positives, there are several major issues that need to be addressed.

First, the organization of the free weights is a disaster. There‚Äôs no system in place, and people don‚Äôt bother to return weights to their designated spots. While the staff makes an effort to tidy up, they simply can‚Äôt keep up with the constant mess left behind by members.

The gym‚Äôs layout is another major downside. One section is always overcrowded, while other areas remain practically empty. This poor design isn‚Äôt just inconvenient; it‚Äôs also unsafe. Equipment is placed too close together, creating a risk of injury. Whoever planned the setup clearly didn‚Äôt consider functionality or safety.

On the positive side, the natural light is fantastic. The large windows fill the space with daylight, creating a more pleasant environment. Additionally, the gym has plenty of new equipment, which is a definite plus. The swimming facilities are also a nice bonus for those who enjoy using them.

However, cleanliness is a significant issue, particularly in the men‚Äôs toilets. They are consistently dirty, and the smell is unbearable. For a facility charging full price, this level of hygiene is unacceptable.

Overall, this gym might be worth it if you qualify for a discount (e.g., for unemployment or disability). But at full price, there are better and more affordable options nearby.
showerReviews.author: Luiz Pimenta

It‚Äôs a great centre. The amenities are commendable. It is a perfect weekend space for family and kids.

showerReviews.reviewText:
the gym is ok, you can fit in a great workout, plenty of different machines, but it's the other things that make this gym questionable.

The main reason for cancelling my memberships is because of the staff. Particularly one of the front desk ladies, she had short blond hair and honestly she is just rudeee. One time when I was coming in to do a workout, and I always have problems scanning myself through the gates, because it's so complicated, she said 'this happens every time you come here then once when I tried to scan it through it still wasn't working so as a gate opened I just walked through it because honestly I'm not going to spend hours trying to just get into the gym, as I walked through, I had my headphones on so I couldn't hear her so she walked up to me and yanked me back by my backpack handle, she wasn't being rough but did it with enough force, who does she think she is doing that honestly, and it's not just me, I've seen her be rude with others. Absolutely disgusting behaviour!!!

Firstly the gym floor is always a little bit dirty, as well as the machines, and dumbbells all in the wrong places on the wrack, and sometimes some of them are missing.
The upstairs changing room floor is always soaking wet and water everywhere, I understand that it's because of the leaks but just fix them tbh.

This gym also needs more cleaners to come into the changing rooms to help flush toilets cause clearly some grown women can't and I'm sorry but its disgusting, not really what you want to see when you walk into a changing room. Also would be nice that people get rid of the pieces of hair they leave by the hairdryer area on the 1st women's changing room. Also you have to pay for the sauna and steam room, ¬£13 per hour, for something you're only going to use for about 10 mins LOL

Overall the gym is ok, but trust me, there's much better places, and that's where I'll be going!!!
showerReviews.author: Marianna Nu√±ez

showerReviews.reviewText:
I have been attending this gym for several years, the management and staff have become progressively worse and more abusive.

Swiss Cottage has persistent problems with leaks, the women showers not working and the smell of sewage in the toilets / sauna has never been fixed.

Other people I used to talk to in the womens changing room have also been quitting this gym over the past year and a half. I had brought up to the front desk problems with men trying to gain access to the sauna during the womens only sessions and people letting men in to the sauna during the sessions. It got so bad that we were barricading the mens entrance with a bin to stop them gaining access during the sessions.

I brought this up to the front desk where I want to make special mention of the disgraceful receptionist Russell who was extremely rude, a pattern of rude and aggressive behavior that has worsened over the last year and has been subject of complaints from the women in the changing room I have talked to.

Some of the equipment here is more updated than at other better gyms but having witnessed the escalating absolutely vile behavior of the reception staff Russell to myself and other women in the center and I can no longer support this gym with my money.

I would not recommend this gym to anyone who wants a safe place to work out where complaints are taken seriously.
showerReviews.author: Rei B

showerReviews.reviewText:
Let‚Äôs face it,  Cally Road is not the jewel in the Better crown.   But the highlight of this centre is Shareena.   She is on the ball, is on top of the systems,  goes above and beyond to sort things out, knows customers individually and handles everything with a great attitude.   She makes the whole experience a pleasure.  A real asset to the organisation.
The aqua-aerobics  classes are well attended and well run.

showerReviews.reviewText: Have been taking my daughter here for a number of years for private and group lessons.        The staff and the teachers, in particular, are wonderful and I have nothing but praise for them.           However the facilities definitely need to be looked at and monitored. The changing rooms, toilets and shower area seem to be always dirty and the place does smell rather badly. I would never dare to use the toilets due to the foul smell emanating from them and they look filthy. Also there are lots of cubicles with locks not working.            I understand that there is an extra volume of people due to Highbury Pool's temporary closure but then more staff  should be in place to keep the place pleasant. Sometimes I feel that I should be wiping my shoes off as I leave the Centre.              I have gotten used to the shared mixed changing areas and I understand that this helps with parents who may have a child of the opposite sex.                                It's a real shame about some of the problems as they really  have great teachers and if it was just based on the teachers and staff it would be 5 stars.
showerReviews.author: Lorna

Shocking to see the changing rooms, the floor is literally black for how bad cleaned that is. Showers are not clean as well, I would never use their pool.

Please, change your management!
showerReviews.author: Francesco

showerReviews.reviewText:
I went swimming here last week and was really shocked by how dirty the pool and changing rooms were. Big clumps of hair in the drains, pool toilets were vile and visible grime in and around the pool. Showers in the changing rooms need maintenance as all of them just spurt in your face.

The staff seem nice enough, but it's really unacceptably dirty. This used to be a very well-kept facility so it's a shame to see it go so downhill.
showerReviews.author: Lou Perfect

showerReviews.reviewText:
Took the kids swimming here for the first time in some years, as they used to love it. It has been ruined. Won't take the kids swimming here again.

Queue outside in the rain, let in 5 minutes before the start of the session, which is only an hour long.

Water freezing. Flume closed. Lazy river switched off. Two wave sessions in one hour. Poolside shower freezing cold. Broken showers in the changing rooms. My two year olds didn't last the hour as it was freezing. My 5 and 7 year olds obviously wanted more than an hour.

Awful, awful, awful.
showerReviews.author: Stephen

locations.title: Park Road Leisure Centre & Lido
locations.address: ÓÉàPark Rd, London N8 8JN, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Cannot, in good conscience, recommend this place if you are looking for an indoor pool. Poorly run, with the lifeguards doing nothing to encourage people to swim in the lanes that suit their ability. Whilst I was in the pool, a man dove over my head into the water of the shallow end and the lifeguard didn‚Äôt do a thing. This was one of many dangerous things and near missus I saw in the 25 mins I was in the pool.
The customer service at the front desk is abysmal. I saw them treat people before me terribly and then copped the same attitude when I presented as a walk in. I did this because the website and app are nearly impossible to use.
The female changing rooms are clean enough but there‚Äôs nowhere to dry your swim suit and it‚Äôs nearly impossible to find privacy to change if you wish it. There‚Äôs just no door on one of the changing cubicles and the lock is broken on one of the others - these are just the ones I tried to use myself.
If you‚Äôre looking to go swim some laps Id recommend almost anywhere else in the area.

showerReviews.reviewText:
The place has potential and certainly has seen better days.
Every time I visit, something is broken, not working and there is a certain feeling of desperation.
Staff at the reception are doing what they can, but there is a strong push towards membership which comes across as  a bit too intense.
It was great weather (hot) when I visited last two times, but no cold drinks or snacks were served next to the outdoors swimming pool. Assuming you guys have financial issues, that's a huge opportunity missed  for extra turnover and hopefully profit.
I don't know what's going on with the management and owners, one could speculate, that the business is run down to its knees on purpose, in order to sell the land for some property developers.

locations.title: Barnet Copthall Leisure Centre
locations.address: ÓÉàChampions Way, London NW4 1PX, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
I have been going to this gym for more than 3 months now and can say that it‚Äôs actually a very good gym with quite a lot of specialist equipment for it‚Äôs size - loads of pull up bars, an assisted pull up machine, punching bags, skipping ropes and even a curved treadmill! It‚Äôs a great place to go if you‚Äôre into functional training.
The staff there are all friendly, polite and helpful - readily engage clients throughout the day.

The male changing rooms are quite spacious with good showers. I‚Äôm aware that copthall is renown for it‚Äôs swimming pools as it contains an Olympic size pool; a second pool for adults and one for small kids as well, though I haven‚Äôt used them of late

showerReviews.reviewText:
Copthall Leisure Centre has its strengths, but also some areas that really need improvement.

Starting with the gym ‚Äì it‚Äôs a decent size and has a good range of equipment, but it‚Äôs consistently overcrowded, especially during peak hours. Unfortunately, poor ventilation makes the space feel stuffy and uncomfortable, especially during intense workouts. It definitely could use better airflow or air conditioning.

On a more positive note, the swimming facilities are excellent. The pools are well-maintained and the swimming classes are top-notch. The coaches are experienced and friendly, and there‚Äôs a wide variety of intensive classes that cater to all levels ‚Äì this is easily the best part of the centre.

The caf√© is okay ‚Äì not spectacular, but it does the job. They offer a solid selection of protein shakes, which is great post-workout, though the rest of the menu could be a bit more exciting.

Overall, Copthall Leisure Centre has potential. If they improve the ventilation and manage gym crowding better, it could be a much more enjoyable place to train.
showerReviews.author: Vahid Serpooshan

I highly recommend the swimming classes at Barnet Copthall Leisure Centre.

My 4-year-old son has only attended a few sessions, and he has already gone from being scared of the water to swimming a short distance on his back without floats! This amazing progress has happened in just a few weeks, with only one half-hour class per week.

His teacher, Adam, is excellent. You can really see that he loves what he does ‚Äî he‚Äôs fantastic at teaching children while also making the lessons fun and enjoyable. That‚Äôs the best way for kids to learn!

I am happy with the experience and grateful for the confidence my son has gained in such a short time. Highly recommended!

locations.title: Anytime Fitness Chalk Farm
locations.address: ÓÉà47 Crogsland Rd, Chalk Farm, London NW1 8QJ, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
I‚Äôve been to several Anytime Fitness locations across London, and Chalk Farm is by far the worst I‚Äôve experienced.

From the moment you walk in, there is a strong, constant smell of sewage / dirty toilets. This isn‚Äôt a one-off issue ‚Äì it‚Äôs been there every time I‚Äôve visited. The gym feels damp, poorly ventilated and unhygienic, and the showers feel grimy and unpleasant, not like somewhere you actually want to use after training.

There is no proper air conditioning, the gym is small and cramped, and there is limited equipment compared with other Anytime Fitness branches. Several key pieces of kit you‚Äôd reasonably expect at this price point are missing, and overall it does not justify the membership cost if this is your main club. By contrast, Anytime Fitness Swiss Cottage and Ladbroke Grove are clean, well-maintained and properly equipped, so the gap in standards is very obvious.

I‚Äôve also felt uncomfortable with the behaviour of the manager. On multiple occasions, I‚Äôve noticed him staring at female members while they work out, which creates an uneasy and unprofessional atmosphere. For a gym that should feel safe and welcoming to everyone, this is not acceptable.

Anytime Fitness has clearly moved towards a franchise model, but whoever is running the Chalk Farm franchise is dragging the brand down. The owner and manager of this gym are putting the reputation of Anytime Fitness into question.

I will be escalating this to Anytime Fitness management and headquarters, because this site is a serious let-down compared with other branches and needs urgent attention. Until there is a clear improvement in cleanliness, maintenance, equipment and professionalism from management, I would strongly recommend choosing a different Anytime Fitness branch ‚Äì or a different gym altogether.
showerReviews.author: Fish XD

I will be escalating this to Anytime Fitness management and headquarters, because this site is a serious let-down compared with other branches and needs urgent attention. Until there is a clear improvement in cleanliness, maintenance, equipment and professionalism from management, I would strongly recommend choosing a different Anytime Fitness branch ‚Äì or a different gym altogether.
showerReviews.author: Fish XD

showerReviews.reviewText:
I initially gave this gym a lower rating when it first opened, but after trying other gyms in the local area, I came to the realization that this gym, while not massive, has everything you need. Considering its convenient location and the fact that it's open 24 hours, you're more likely to actually go, rather than join a bigger gym and not attend.

It offers all the essentials to get strong: free weights, squat racks, pull up bars, benches, and even a boxing bag, which many larger gyms don't have. It also has private, luxurious showers and changing rooms, which really add to the overall experience. You can check the app to see how busy it is, but in my experience, I've never been there with more than 7/8 people. It's never crowded unless you go during peak times, which is the case with any gym in the world.

A lady spent too long in there and fainted when she got out so do be careful, especially if you‚Äôre a newbie to saunas/ice baths. Could be improved by having hot showers and having a clock! locations.title: Energie Fitness Gym Kilburn
locations.address: ÓÉà34a, 36 Kilburn High Rd, London NW6 5UA, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
I've been a member since 2018. It's a small local gym that has improved its space over time, but unfortunately hasn't invested in the basics - like providing clean drinking water, maintaining proper hygiene in the bathrooms, and fixing the constant water cuts in the toilets and showers. The ventilation is also very poor throughout the year with constant water leaks around it.
Honestly, I wouldn't recommend this gym, as there are now many better gyms in the area with lower prices and without all these issues related to money or comfort.
On top of that, they refuse to refund you for months you haven't used, so be very careful with the memberships it feels like they just want to keep your money!
showerReviews.author: Dayana Rodriguez

locations.address: ÓÉà115 Coventry Rd, London E2 6JB, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: I have been an extremely loyal customer of Energie Fitness Bethnal Green for over 4 years. The gym closed with absolutely no warning. I echo what has been said in previous reviews about that. Very revealing to see how customer loyalty is rewarded. By closing so unexpectedly, all my gym equipment was left in the women's changing room. This includes a weight lifting belt, wrist straps, 4 resistance bands and a foam support. When will I be able to retrieve these items. So far all attempts to contact this company have been to no avail.
showerReviews.author: Claire Eleanor

showerReviews.reviewText: I have been an extremely loyal customer of Energie Fitness Bethnal Green for over 4 years. The gym closed with absolutely no warning. showerReviews.reviewText:
I‚Äôve been a member at Energie Fitness for a while, and honestly, since the change in leadership and the new CEO came in, the standards have absolutely fallen off a cliff.

The toilets and changing rooms are constantly filthy ‚Äì it feels like they only bring in a cleaner once a week (if that). There‚Äôs almost never toilet paper or soap available. These are the absolute bare minimum essentials any gym should provide.

The equipment situation is just as bad. Machines are out of order for weeks on end with no sign of repair. To make things worse, they‚Äôve removed paper towels and antibacterial spray under the excuse of ‚Äúreducing unnecessary waste.‚Äù Let‚Äôs call it what it is: cutting corners to save money at the expense of members‚Äô hygiene.
Removing paper towels I could understand, but taking away the spray? Are we supposed to magically disinfect the equipment with our towels alone? What a joke.

On top of all that, loads of machines and weights have been taken out of the gym. I‚Äôm hoping it‚Äôs for the planned refurbishment, but right now it just feels like the place is being stripped down and neglected.

And to top it off, the gym is constantly unstaffed. There‚Äôs rarely anyone around to help or maintain standards.

Unless conditions improve after the refurbishment, I‚Äôll be cancelling my membership. Right now, this gym is embarrassing compared to what it used to be.
showerReviews.author: Marina Beybudyan

showerReviews.reviewText:
Lovely staff who are always welcoming and very helpful.  I‚Äôm so pleased I found this gym.

The range of equipment is excellent and well maintained. The gym is kept clean and this includes lockers, showers and loos.

The choice of equipment means that if I‚Äôm using the gym during peak hours, there are always options to keep me busy.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Today I realised I‚Äôd left something behind at the gym (either in the lockers or on the gym floor) and when I called up, the staff were incredibly helpful. They took the time to search everywhere and managed to find it for me, which I really appreciated. It reminded me how great this gym is, not just for the facilities, but also for the genuinely friendly and supportive team that run it.

The facilities are excellent ‚Äì clean showers, WCs, and locker areas. There‚Äôs plenty of equipment to get a solid workout in, and they‚Äôve clearly thought about what members need. For example, there are extra squat racks upstairs (4 squat racks plus 1 Smith machine), which makes a big difference on busy days. They also have more benches (5) than most other gyms in the Tooting area ‚Äì something worth mentioning because free weights and benches are always too scarce in commercial gyms, but not here. On top of that, there are loads of machines and cable options so you‚Äôre never short of variety.

Overall, a fantastic gym with great staff, clean facilities, and more than enough equipment. Highly recommended.
showerReviews.author: Agnes Brull

Top price (as you have a few options) is ¬£35 with ¬£12 food voucher. Other options  are for ¬£6/¬£31  and so on. ¬£ 12  feed you everything  from menu apart from fully monty grill  ¬£15.95
Food menu is massive,including  burgers,curry,kebabs,home made pizza sandwiches  and so on. Food is awesome!  Trucker next to me said they try to kill you with the size of those portions. I saw different  platters out and all was great and when ask all said amazing. So a big shout out to a kitchen staff!

Staff mostly  very friendly  and kind, one bad egg but it might  be not his day so I won't  blame or judge  his life  on that. We all had it.

If by any  chance  I will be around, even  for a sneaky 45 I will be there!

I would recommend it 100%

showerReviews.reviewText: If you are visiting Southampton, Cartland are opening a new truckstop in Southampton docks opening 1sept 2025 6am with 130 parking spaces , shower / toilets 24/7 - a menu with home cooked food open 6am - 22.00 Monday - Friday - 8am -14.00 Saturday closed Sunday for food . showerReviews.reviewText:
It's a relatively new truck stop, but the showers and toilets are disgraceful.

There are 2 showers for 130 spaces plus any that want a break. The showers spray water everywhere but down towards you. The shower heads are full of limescale it is clogging the holes in the shower head. The water temperature is hit and miss, if it is freezing outside then the showers will be cold. If it's hot outside then the showers will be very hot. The showers look as if they have never been cleaned, they are yellowing, slimy and mold is starting to grow.

The toilets are filthy and are only cleaned once a day if they are lucky. There are 4 toilets (2 are unisex instead of female only) for 130 truck drivers plus any that stop for a short break. The toilets and floors will be covered in wee and poo. Toilet  paper and soap regularly run out. They have replaced the electric door locks that failed to work 100% of the time with flimsy flip locks that can be easily broken.

They have switched off heating in the disabled/unisex toilet which has stopped the hand dryer from working. The water to wash your hands is freezing cold unless you have 5 minutes to waste to run the water until its warm.

For something that's less then 6 months old, it is falling apart fast. The management have neglected the facilities as it costs them money.
showerReviews.author: Nathaniel Crowe

showerReviews.reviewText:
Well done on the investment, parking was great, food was great, showers and toilets are a joke to whoever designed it!
It's like they ran out of money, toilets are better in the Tesco Rdc (and that's saying something)
Need to look at the stock yard truckstop at their shower block and replace asap..
Other that the showers and toilets, this would be a superb place to stay, but drivers will avoid due to the above..

showerReviews.reviewText:
Stopped off here for a bite to eat, in our motorhome.
Although it's a truckstop car's and Motorhomes are welcome here.
If you want to stop overnight during the week you would have to pay the HGV rate, which is around ¬£23. At weekends the price is negotiable, although the cafe isn't open, but there are still toilets, showers and 24 hour security.
Everything was very clean.
The food was good home cooked meals, which were huge and piping hot. I had the special sauagemeat and sage pie, with mashed potatoes, cabbage, carrots, peas and gravy, plus 2 slices of bread and butter and a mug of tea, lovely.
showerReviews.author: Elizabeth Jackson

showerReviews.reviewText:
Toilets and shower blocks are disgusting.  No lids on the toilets so fecal matter just sprays all over the floor, showers and sinks after every flush.  Trying to exit the shower without touching the disgusting floor and mouldy shower curtain is an absolute mission.
The parking bays are badly laid out and it can be impossible to exit some spaces in the morning without tail-swinging into someone's cab.
It redeems a star because the security staff do a good job and it does seem to be secure.
showerReviews.author: Michael Hodkinson

showerReviews.reviewText:

showerReviews.reviewText:
This used to be a good place to park securely and comfortably for the night. They have recently rejigged the toilets and showers there used to be some large cubicles with toilets and showers and some just showers and some just toilets. Now it is 7 toilets and showers. They have put rubbish shower heads on that are loose, so they flop about, and the water just pours out like a hose pipe. I tried 2 other showers and found the same things wrong. due to lack of pressure. There was also water spraying out of the top of the shower tap. This results in a stream of water just going all over the tap instead of spraying you. The drains were also just a hole in the shower tray. Which doesn't drain well. There was hardly any water pressure. All in its ruined what was a good place to park. Think I'll park somewhere else next time I'm in the area.

UPDATE.
I tried 2 other cubicles and found the same issues. So it's not an isolated incident.  In my opinion, due to lack of pressure, the shower heads can't do their job. As shown in the video, once the button is pressed, it takes a while until the water comes out.
showerReviews.author: Graham Bailey

showerReviews.reviewText:
I am so amazed by the serious hygiene protocol at this branch and the capacity of the machines they use here.
Elsa gave me the treatment today, and she was very caring and professional. I could feel that Elsa truly puts the client at the highest priority. I highly recommend this branch for your beauty treatment :)

locations.title: Kabannas London St Pancras
locations.address: ÓÉà79-81 Euston Rd., London NW1 2QE, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Unfortunately it's a big disappointment.
It's not properly structured to be a hostel, what I mean is
- not having hooks in the right places (rooms and bathrooms),
-lockers make horrible sounds because they are in metal so at any point of the night and day you can't rest
- no fan or Aircon, it's so damn hot and you cannot open the window fully (suicide block and extremely loud on the street)
- Shared bathroom outside in the common areas has 1 toilet, 1 sink, 1 shower that's it. You constantly have to wait your turn
- the room is in really poor quality, in terms of painting, lockers, furniture, bunk beds... It feels almost abandoned.

Other issues:
- pillow super thin, hardly a pillow.
- the shared bathroom inside the shared bunk bed room gets cleaned once a day, and never early in the morning so it's smells and is not feasible to be used - imagine 8 people showering and using one toilet (consider that because the shower drain is clogged all the water floods the toilet)
- as above, too hot to stay in for the summer - I sweated all night - no fan no Aircon. Super small room with 8 people breathing.

Location: PERFECT. 3 mins from the tube station
Staff: EXTREMELY NICE. Very kind and always ready to help.

Last but not least, now everything you need extra you need to pay for, I can understand the padlock and the towel - all over the world is like that - but that you charge also storing the luggage is a bit TOO MUCH in my opinion.

I wouldn't come back unless they would improve tonnes.
showerReviews.author: Giulia Oliveri

locations.title: Palmers Lodge Swiss Cottage
locations.address: ÓÉà40 College Cres, South Hampstead, London NW3 5LB, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
I was absolutely pleasantly surprised with my stay here, it was perfect. My bed was comfy with a charger and shelf to put a few items, and curtains all around for privacy. The ceiling was tall as well and was easy to climb in and out of the top bunk. There was ample room to put bags and clothes. The room was carpeted which really helped make it quieter as well, I didn‚Äôt even bring earplugs and was just fine. Also no issues with lights at all. The toilets are clearly regularly cleaned and the showers were spacious and private as well. There was no queue either, even the day I showered right before checkout time. There is also a nice vanity area in the corridor so you can do skincare or whatever in a dry area without waking people up. Staff were friendly and helpful as well. This was honestly very peaceful. I am very reserved so I didn‚Äôt go to these but there were some fun looking social events as well if you want to make friends.

The location is very good, felt safe in a posh area right near a bus stop and the Swiss Cottage tube station. Tesco express nearby with a coffee shop and a laundromat as well.

Overall I thought this was nice, especially for the price, and would absolutely stay again next time I have a short stay in London.
showerReviews.author: Robert

showerReviews.reviewText:
The high ratings have to be a joke or some sort of bots

It‚Äôs set in a beautiful old building but that‚Äôs all that is good about it.

The rooms are small and have zero ventilation, it smelled like sweat the entire time and windows open barely 5cm

Showers are inside of plastic boxes that make you feel like you‚Äôre in a public toilet.

The doors always slam and are incredibly loud

Most of the employees were disinterested, unfriendly and borderline condescending

The majority of guests are over 40 years old and it shows, the atmosphere is dead and depressing.

I‚Äôve stayed in hundreds of hostels in my life and never one as bad

showerReviews.reviewText: Overall a good experience, I've stayed here twice now (both times in a private room) and the location, atmosphere and friendly staff really make it worth it.  There's plenty of outlets, excellent view from the top floor and comfortable beds. showerReviews.reviewText: First time staying in a hostel. Overall a good experience. I booked an all female room, in the basement. Which had a co-ed bathroom/shower beside it. Bring earplugs if youre a light sleeper. Found out halfway through my stay there is a female only bathroom 2 floors up. Kitchen closes at 1130pm (ive been told from other girls traveling that its unusual, most hostels have it 24/7) bed was comfy, clean, nice to have curtains for privacy. You cant choose your Neighbour's and we had a few louder girls (4am packing loud or slamming the door) but most girls were considerate of others and tried to be respectful. Train or busses nearby. I would stay here again. Stayed in November, I imagine mid summer it would be brutally hot with a room full of people and no AC
showerReviews.author: Desiree Schambach

locations.title: Clink261
locations.address: ÓÉà261-265 Grays Inn Rd, London WC1X 8QT, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
The location is excellent, very close to¬†King‚Äôs Cross, which is definitely one of the biggest positive points of this hostel and makes getting around London very easy.

The¬†reception staff is friendly. The Brazilian guy in charge of breakfast is¬†super kind and attentive. I would also like to highlight¬†Adam, the blond guy with curly hair, who tried to help me when the washing machine was not working. I was told that there is a¬†special key used for these situations, but unfortunately it was¬†lost. Still, his attitude was very helpful and professional. The guy who did my check-in,¬†Lachlan, was also very kind.

The¬†common areas are nice¬†and pleasant to spend time in, and the¬†breakfast is good for the price.

However, there are some negative points:¬†the beds are extremely uncomfortable, and the¬†bed sheets were dirty and yellowish, which should be improved urgently.

The atmosphere inside the rooms, in particular, did not feel like that of a typical youth or traveler hostel. At times, it felt more like a¬†shelter for homeless people, which is not a pleasant environment if you are looking for a traveler or social hostel experience.

After mentioning this to one of the¬†reception girls (I don‚Äôt remember her name, but she told me she is from Lithuania), she explained that because¬†London is such an expensive city, many people with family or work-related problems end up staying in places like this.¬†I understand and empathize with this situation, but hostels and hotels are usually meant for travelers, and when the room atmosphere is not traveler-oriented,¬†it is not a pleasant environment¬†for guests looking for that experience.

In summary, great location and very friendly staff, but issues with comfort and the atmosphere inside the rooms.
showerReviews.author: Raissa Cruz

showerReviews.reviewText:
Love this place. It‚Äôs my first time traveling to London and I‚Äôm very happy with the hostel. It‚Äôs very close to King‚Äôs Cross St. Pancras station. Easy to go to the British Museum and the Big Ben. Just feel stops away from the major theaters and the Regent street. Perfect if you want to see the famous tourist attractions in London.
Facility is adequate, if you are looking for toilets made with gold choose somewhere else, otherwise it has all the facilities you will need. You can freely use the kitchen in the basement floor from 12:00pm. Breakfast is provided at 5.5 pounds. Laundry is 5pounds for the wash and 2 pounds for the dry, very fair price cuz I can chuck all my winter clothes in at once.
The room is pretty decent with individual lockers and charging stations for each bed. But be aware that the locker is not big enough to put suitcases bigger than 24 inches. But you can just put your larger suitcases in the open area in the room with your own lock on and it‚Äôs safe. Remember to bring a lock for the locker.
showerReviews.author: Alice

showerReviews.reviewText:
Here is the English translation:

I came from Taiwan and stayed at a 2-person room on the 5th floor for 13 days at the end of November. At first, I saw many mixed reviews, but after staying here, I truly felt the staff were very friendly. The room was clean and tidy, and I had no bad experiences. There was no curtain beside the bed, but there were four outlets in the room, which was more than enough. The food sold on the first floor was affordable and tasty, and it‚Äôs also a good choice if you want to have a drink. If you need hot water, you can ask for it at the bar. The self-service breakfast costs ¬£9.5 and is enough to make you full. The bathrooms and toilets were clean too, although some locks were broken, but it didn‚Äôt affect usage. The heating starts at 8 p.m. and lasts until the morning; sometimes it starts earlier or ends earlier. I am still staying here now, and I highly recommend this place to travelers who come to London and don‚Äôt have very high requirements for accommodation.
showerReviews.author: ÊõæË±äÊñá

showerReviews.reviewText:
This hostel is huge. Has a bar, lots of games for people in their teens and twenties. Lots of bathrooms. The basement washroom/shower is definitely a gay cruising spot, and there's nothing stopping any old Joe off the street going in for a shower honestly. The dryers.... They're in dire need of a deep clean. I went to tell reception that maintenance should look at them and he snickered "it's not a maintenance issue"... There's a buildup of debris and lint under the lint tray that gets sucked up onto the silver extractor pipe. This prevents hot air from escaping so you could dry it 6-7 times and still have wet clothes. I did what I could to fix them, and offered to do the job to completion but was never called back about this: this leads me to believe they leave them in disrepair so they make more money out of you. My advice; take your laundry out the hostel and turn right, then right again and there's a laundromat there.
Cellphone service is near non existent, as is usual in old police buildings.
showerReviews.author: James

showerReviews.reviewText:
üåü 5-Star Review for Royden Marina Village üåü

I can‚Äôt recommend Royden Marina Village highly enough ‚Äî this place is a hidden gem that truly exceeded expectations!

I stupidly booked via "booking.CON"
Who said it was the last superior room, then when I got confirmation said it was standard!!

I rang them and they up graded to superior

From the moment we arrived, we felt genuinely welcomed. The marina itself is beautifully maintained, with tranquil surroundings and stunning views that create a peaceful, relaxing atmosphere. Whether you're visiting by boat or just looking for a lovely spot to stay, it‚Äôs the perfect escape from the hustle and bustle.

The facilities are excellent: clean, modern showers and washrooms, well-kept pontoons, ample parking, and a fantastic caf√© serving great coffee and homemade cakes ‚Äî ideal for a leisurely afternoon. The entire site is immaculately presented and clearly cared for with pride.

The staff deserve a special mention: professional, helpful, and always ready with a smile. Nothing was too much trouble, and their attention to detail really made the whole experience stand out.

The village itself has a lovely, friendly feel with plenty of walks nearby for anyone who enjoys nature and the outdoors. It‚Äôs also a great spot to moor up and explore the surrounding area.

In short, Royden Marina Village is a perfect place for boaters, holidaymakers, and anyone looking for a peaceful getaway with top-class facilities and service. I‚Äôll definitely be back ‚Äî it‚Äôs a place you won‚Äôt want to leave!

showerReviews.reviewText: We stayed at this hotel for one night when visiting Abu Simbel. The location is excellent. It is right next door to a larger well known resort. We were able to easily walk to the temple complex. (We were not there for a view as we did not plan on being at the hotel except to sleep) Price was great. Beds were clean and comfortable. Nice towels, toiletries and hair dryer provided. Small refrigerator in room as well as electric kettle to make our own tea or Nescaf√©. AC worked great and it was around 100F when we were there. They offered to make us breakfast but we declined and they gave us some fruit. Young man that runs it very friendly. Picked us up and dropped us off at the airport. Arranged for a boat ride on Lake Nasser for sunrise at an extremely reasonable price.

locations.title: Holiday Inn London - Camden Lock by IHG
locations.address: ÓÉà30 Jamestown Rd, London NW1 7BY, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Thoroughly wonderful 2 night stay.

Arrived 4 hours before check-in to drop off the bags to find the room was ready. Great view overlooking Camden Lock.  Perfect location for Camden and close to the underground to explore further afield.

Speedy check-in service, and as an IHG member have free late checkout (2pm).

Couldn't fault the room. Fantastically comfortable bed with amazing duvet and pillows.

Shower to die for and controls away from the showerhead so no getting wet when turning on the water.

All the services you could want in the room, tea/coffee, iron, ironing board, hairdryer and safe. Plenty of space for clothes.

Add in the sofa and coffee table and a little home away from home.

Well done Holiday Inn
showerReviews.author: Chris Storey-Hill

showerReviews.reviewText:
Stayed here for 1 night after a day out in London.
We arrived at 3pm, and checked in very quickly. They are currently renovating the rooms, but this wasnt reflected upon arrival (high standards etc) We had a free room upgrade to one of their new rooms overlooking the docks. As an IHG member we could of got a late check out but unfortunately we had to be home early.
The floor we were on, was very nice and you could tell it had been renovated, it was very appealing. The room itself was very spacious, clean and trendy. The window was like a door and opened wide overlooking the docks, it was really pleasant. Bed was super comfy as were the pillows, the bathroom had an amazing shower and a big mirror.
We didn't have an evening meal there but there menu was good and you had the option of room service too.
Although close to the nightlife of Camden, the windows were soundproofed from the main hustle and bustle although a bit of noise seeped though... we were provided with ear plugs which was a nice touch (we didn't use them, but I definitely took them home with me!). Slept really well.
Had breakfast in the morning which was well attended by staff, they were very helpful. Breakfast was good, there was a good selection of foods and drinks to choose from. Check out was smooth, quick and easy.
Highly recommend.
showerReviews.author: J

locations.title: 1 Craven Hill Gardens
locations.address: ÓÉà1 Craven Hill Gardens, London W2 3ES, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Very bad customer service.

We were emailed the morning of arrival, to say that check in is closed at 9pm. We arrived early as we landed in from Dublin early. We left our bags there until check in & told Sanjana, we are going to Winter Wonderland and we would be back before 9pm. She told us to make sure we are back before, as she will be going home at 9. So that was fine.

We got to the hotel at 8.40pm & she opened the door to us, in the utmost of ignorant attitudes. She said ‚ÄúFinally. I have been waiting a long time for you. I have been emailing you because check in is closed at 9.‚Äù And then was giving out to because I never responded or arrived earlier. I didn‚Äôt see her emails and I was too busy having fun. We had until 9pm to check in anyway, as informed, so I didn‚Äôt see what the big problem was. Someone was obviously wanting to go home early. I have worked in a hotel for 10 years myself & I know that you do not speak to guests in this manner.
I did not appreciate being spoken to like this, just because we didn‚Äôt arrive at a time that suited her own schedule. I will not be recommending anyone to stay here, nor will I be returning myself.

Also on a side note, shampoo & shower gel are provided in 1 sachet per person & I do not know how they expect people to wash themselves with that because there is barely anything in them.
showerReviews.author: Sinead Dodd

showerReviews.reviewText: There is a huge misleading information here - it says that hotel is 4 stars, but unfortunately it wasn't even standing next to 4 stars. Overall, the impression of the hotel is bad. It looks dirty, unclean, like nobody cares... Our room was very claustrophobic, with a few details that could be improved. Firstly, I am not sure is air-conditioning was working, as I couldn't change any settings. Secondly, visible cracks on the walls which could be fixed easy and fast. Thirdly, dirt around chower cabin and shower tray, also small bits of mold around shower gel. And fourthly, one of the toilet paper rools was wet. Don't think we'll ever get back to this hotel.

locations.title: Highbury Leisure Centre
locations.address: ÓÉàHighbury Cres, London N5 1RR, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
They don‚Äôt understand hygiene standards here at all. The floors of the locker room are absolutely filthy. As are the toilet areas. There‚Äôs infrequent cleaning. At the same time they request people not wear shoes in their disgusting ü§¢ locker rooms. They do not understand that foot fungus spreads by NOT wearing shoes. Basic science. Everyone should have shoes ON until they reach the pool and the floors need frequent cleaning with anti bacterial products. The opposite of what they are doing. I refuse to walk in there in sandals or flip flops.

The swimming classes are relatively useless as they teach kids in very shallow water where they can easily stand. That defeats the purpose entirely. People need to be confident in water they cannot easily stand in and also how to tread water effectively. Yes it‚Äôs cheap, but after a certain point it‚Äôs a waste of time. And we‚Äôve had foot fungus 2 times on top of this üò°
showerReviews.author: Stephanie Gosman

showerReviews.reviewText: I used to go here quite alot but since trying out the Brittania centre I now much prefer going there even though its much further. My 2 main issues with the gym are - 1. There  is no water fountain you can actually drink from, you can only fill up your water bottle if you remember to bring one,.  2. The lockers, instead of having a combination lock panel  you have to buy a ¬£1.50 token which invariably ends up getting lost or swallowed/stuck in the machine. You then have to carry the key plus massive plastic attachment thing round with you (along with your water bottle if you've remembered one). These 2 issues mean that i never just spontaneously go in on my way back from work i always have to plan for a visit. So much hassle. Sort it out highbury.

Reviewing the pool... It's an amazing facility... One of my favourite pools of London. Good temp, and often not too busy... Especially after you figure out when the lessons are on, which can take up two of the lanes (though swimming is to be encouraged, so carry on!)
The changing rooms and showers are much cleaner of late as they have (finally) started policing the no shoes rule that previously was almost entirely ignored. Keep up the improvements Better, it's being noticed!

showerReviews.reviewText:
Extremely obnoxious deputy manager named Dmitry Golubstaf. Have been coming to this gym regularly for the past year. Unfortunately my membership expired a few days ago, explained that this was being renewed through work and provided evidence of this. He refused me entry despite another member of staff allowing me in previously. Walked over to the Market Road gym and they let me in without issues.
The gym itself is quite basic and dirty, changing rooms are in a state and lots of equipment is out of use. Clearly management have no oversight or just don't care.
I would seriously consider going to another site, egotistical managers that have such poor customer service skills is worrying. How they expect to increase revenue when you are actively discouraged from using the gym in mind boggling. Avoid!

locations.title: Virgin Active
locations.address: ÓÉà333 Goswell Rd., London EC1V 7DG, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: Don't know why I'm bothering leaving a review, nothing will change except the prices, which will continue to rise. "Management" will get ChatGPT to generate a response to my comment to make it seem like they care, which they don't. In short, there are obviously much better gyms in the area in terms of workout equipment, which is very old and impossible to get to in peak times here, but I joined solely for the jacuzzi and pool. Unfortunately the pool is always full of screaming kids on the weekend and evenings, because apparently the extortionate membership fees aren't enough to keep them solvent, they have to turn to swimming lessons as a financial lifeline. Locker rooms even worse, uncontrolled screaming kids running around with their parents incapable of keeping them in check. So the idea of relaxing in the pool or the jacuzzi go out the window because there's no peace whatsoever - it's either the screaming kids or the songs that the swimming lesson instructors lead them in that are apparently an essential part of their swimming learning, or bunches of guys talking at the top of their voices in the jacuzzi, or shouting to each other from across the wet area like they're at home. Something in the spa area is always broken and I mean literally always. For the last few months it's been the jets in the circular spa bath area of the jacuzzi, prior to that it was various other elements of the jacuzzi, or the steam room, or the sauna, etc. Temperature of the jacuzzi also used to be nice and warm, is now just tepid. But again, no point mentioning it, because the management cares only about the next monthly price increase. The only time I saw the them move to do anything was when I told them there was a homeless guy in the change rooms - in the family area too, which is the only place you can get a locker because they let people leave their padlocks on their lockers for days and probably months on end, so at the start of every day if you're the first person in the door there are maybe only ten lockers free. Homeless guy was standing in the middle of the family area shouting to himself, just about to do god knows what. Not sure how this can happen but nothing surprises me about this place
showerReviews.author: Tony McIntosh

showerReviews.reviewText:
I have been training at the Anytime Fitness in central London for some time, and it is my preferred gym among other central London facilities I‚Äôve visited. The clean, spacious facility features seasonal decorations and effective lighting, creating a pleasant workout environment.

The practical layout includes well-maintained lockers, changing rooms, showers, and restrooms on the ground floor, with the gym and stretching area in the basement, allowing efficient workouts. The equipment range is sufficient, with minimal wait times.

The staff are courteous and attentive, maintaining a safe and tidy environment, even during busy hours. This branch stands out for its accessibility and welcoming atmosphere, fitting seamlessly into my routine.

showerReviews.reviewText:
This Anytime Fitness is simply spacious, beautiful, and clean‚Äîabsolutely fantastic!
As soon as you enter, there‚Äôs a sofa and a coffee machine, followed by lockers, changing rooms, and further back, shower rooms, toilets, and a makeup room. The built-in hairdryers are Dyson, which is a nice touch. Plus, there are amenities provided, which is delightful. Amazingly, you can get coffee from the coffee machine for just one pound.
The lower floor is the gym area, fully equipped with everything from treadmills to free-weight spaces. The machines are well-spaced, making it easy to move around. It‚Äôs relatively empty on weekday mornings, but Saturday mornings can get crowded. The staff occasionally do checks, and the atmosphere is really great.
So far, I haven‚Äôt found anything that needs improvement. As I keep saying, the cleanliness and the stylish lighting in the gym area really boost my motivation to work out. I absolutely love this Anytime Fitness!

showerReviews.reviewText:
I changed jobs recently, and the Angel branch is now my home gym. The facilities are clean, staff are helpful and friendly. Coffee machine with heavily discounted prices is a nice tough. They have GHD hair straighteners and hair dryers, hair ties + deodorant on hand.

Gym equipment wise I can‚Äôt fault, there are 4-5 stair masters and an abundance of treadmills. Not the mention the professional grade squat and bench racks. Heavy and steady benches for free dumbbells weights and benching. I think there‚Äôs about 6+ squat/bench racks. A bucket full of clips and some more, an abundance of plates to use.  2 smith machines, so there is never too much overcrowding and forced turn taking between sets. There is a CrossFit section, Olympic ropes, RDX cables, 2-3 double cable machines for a good chest and shoulder day.

I would say my only small gripe is scrambling to find the foam roller, I have sciatic pain from time to time so I do need the foam roller to stretch out my muscles.  There‚Äôs only about 2-3, maybe add another 2?
showerReviews.author: Kim Pham

showerReviews.reviewText:
I changed jobs recently, and the Angel branch is now my home gym. The facilities are clean, staff are helpful and friendly. Coffee machine with heavily discounted prices is a nice tough. They have GHD hair straighteners and hair dryers, hair ties + deodorant on hand.

Gym equipment wise I can‚Äôt fault, there are 4-5 stair masters and an abundance of treadmills. Not the mention the professional grade squat and bench racks. Heavy and steady benches for free dumbbells weights and benching. I think there‚Äôs about 6+ squat/bench racks. A bucket full of clips and some more, an abundance of plates to use.  2 smith machines, so there is never too much overcrowding and forced turn taking between sets. There is a CrossFit section, Olympic ropes, RDX cables, 2-3 double cable machines for a good chest and shoulder day.

I would say my only small gripe is scrambling to find the foam roller, I have sciatic pain from time to time so I do need the foam roller to stretch out my muscles.  There‚Äôs only about 2-3, maybe add another 2?
showerReviews.author: Kim Pham

showerReviews.reviewText:
Been here with Classpass but will consider a membership! The gym is clean and well kept even during peak time (not that busy either compared to other gyms of the area!)
The staff are very friendly and available to show you around. Great facilities with private cabins/showers! Will definitely be back!
showerReviews.author: Giulia Berardi

showerReviews.reviewText:
WOW WOW WOW. Best Gym I've Ever Been To!

Anytime Fitness Angel is hands down the best gym I've ever had the pleasure of working out in!  I‚Äôve been going to one of the other local Anytime Fitness‚Äôs but decided to walk the extra 10 minutes from Kings Cross Station yesterday to try out the Angel - gosh I can see this becoming my regular Anytime Fitness.

They have 7 racks, which is so dreamy. There are 3 functional trainer cable machines also meaning there's always one available when you need it. Plus you‚Äôve got cable pull downs and seat cable pull equipment - something the ones nearby do not have. You‚Äôve got all your plate machines all in one zone then you pin machines in one zone also - very well laid out if you ask me.

‚Ä¶ oh and two of each of the sets of free weights for the most popular weights meaning you can pretty much always life your target weight.

The facilities are top-notch‚Äîplenty of showers (I have to queue at the ones nearby), Dyson hair dryers in the vanity section, plenty of toilets also. It‚Äôs clear the staff take pride in maintaining a clean and welcoming environment. There‚Äôs also plenty of space to move around, even during peak hours, which makes every workout stress-free and enjoyable.

Then you stumble into the spin studio or the dance/multi purpose studio which are both LOVELY!

If you're looking for a gym that has everything you need and more, look no further than Anytime Fitness Angel. Highly recommend it to anyone, whether you're a beginner or a seasoned gym-goer. üí™üëè
showerReviews.author: Jack Jackson

showerReviews.reviewText:
I  joined PureGym and  use multiple site in London and Kent due to my job. I must say, my experience has been nothing short of fantastic! From the moment I walked through the doors, I was impressed by the management's commitment to creating a welcoming and supportive environment. The staff is always friendly, approachable, and eager to help, making it easy for newcomers to feel right at home.

The cleanliness of the gym is truly commendable. It's clear that the management prioritizes hygiene, as the facilities are consistently spotless. Whether it's the workout areas or the locker rooms, everything is well-maintained and organized, allowing for a pleasant atmosphere to focus on fitness.

The equipment at PureGym is top-notch. There‚Äôs a wide variety of machines and free weights available, catering to all fitness levels and workout preferences. I love that I never have to wait for a machine, thanks to the abundance of options. The gym is well-equipped for both strength training and cardio workouts, making it easy to mix up my routine.

Lastly, I‚Äôve met some amazing members who share the same passion for fitness. The sense of community here is uplifting, and it‚Äôs inspiring to see others pushing towards their goals. Overall, I highly recommend PureGym to anyone looking for a clean, well-managed gym with excellent equipment and a welcoming atmosphere!
showerReviews.author: Kante Abdoulaye
