locations.title: Sobell Leisure Centre
locations.address: ÓÉàTollington Rd, London N7 7NY, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
We love love love this place. Whether you live far or close this is a great place for your little ones. Firstly you can bring your buggy/prams as they have a place for you to park it, secondly you should buy your tickets online to save time and thirdly bring plenty of water as you will need it. I went here with my toddler and she loves it. They have a huge space dedicated to the giant jungle gym where you can either play in the under 2‚Äôs area or where all the other older kids go. This is adult friendly and strong enough for you to also enjoy and bring out your inner kid. After 10 minutes I was already sweating and felt like this was PE all over again. If can get very busy as we saw multiple birthdays parties here booked into different time slots. Depending on when you book you will be given a coloured paper wrist band on your child‚Äôs wrist that determines the time for you leave. The allocated time slot is definitely enough time for your little ones to work up a sweat and for you to leave with them ready for nap time. Highly recommend this place to all parents who want a nice day out that won‚Äôt break the bank and has clean changing facilities in multiple toilets so even if you have to wait it won‚Äôt be for too long. They also have a cafe on site so you can refresh with sweet treats and even a refreshing slushy. We came here by guys and it was easily accessible with the buggy and easy to find.
Heads up parents you should be dressed comfortably as you too will be moving around and  climbing, jumping and rolling around.

locations.address: ÓÉàGordon House Rd, London NW5 1LT, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: I booked the adult improvers course not knowing what to expect but wanting to feel more confident swimming front crawl. Elly was simply amazing! It was incredible how much technique she managed to teach us and how attentive she was to us each given the short, 30 minute, sessions. I was surprised to see improvement daily after she broke down everything into bite-sized chunks and then neatly pulled it all together. I finished the course feeling more confident and with the understanding (and notes, thank you!) to support me as I continue to practice independently. I highly recommend Elly for anyone of any level wishing to improve their swimming and relationship with the water!
showerReviews.author: Ashana Crichton

showerReviews.reviewText:
Booked to go for a swim on Sunday, paid ¬£11.50 for an hour which is very overpriced for the facilities available.

They also had a security guard/bouncer patrolling the pool who was waking sunbathers up and asking them to leave after their 50 minute slot had expired. He would stand next to you whilst you folder your towel up and was hurrying mothers and babies up - awful behaviour.
showerReviews.author: Harry Keam

showerReviews.reviewText:

showerReviews.reviewText:
I came here today due to the warm weather and suitable for outdoor swimming, otherwise I wouldn‚Äôt visit if temperatures were below 25c as the pool doesn‚Äôt feel heated at all.
The cost for a child at ¬£5.50 is very good value but ¬£11.50 for an adult is overpriced.
I don‚Äôt understand why adults always have to pay twice the amount when we go to do the same thing!
I did not enter the pool and let my son swim for the hour due to skin allergies. he is also a strong swimmer but an adult must accompany him as he is 7 years old.
I would advise maybe lowering the cost of an adult ticket and maybe for those parents who won‚Äôt be using the pool to charge a small fee.
Overall though the place is kept clean with lots of cubicles and showers.
The staff at the front was overwhelmed there for more staff needs to be available as families were not entering on time for their time slots, there is also someone who comes round asking you to show your time slots which was not the easiest when you are trying to sunbathe!
To police this better I would suggest that at every hour you have everyone leave the pool, and then the next lot of customers can enter.
Some families weren‚Äôt leaving and it can become overcrowded.
showerReviews.author: Sam Acton

Must amend this review to include Chelsea who " clarified " my entitlements while having my membership changed, she's a üíé üòâ
showerReviews.author: Kevin Barry

showerReviews.reviewText:
If you want to actually swim for fitness look for another place.
The pool itself is nice, but all the times I went for a swim for fitness session (¬£11.50 for non members and ¬£9.50 for members of Better gym) I‚Äôve encountered several issues:
1) in the medium and fast lane there are people just walking or standing in the middle of the lane. The staff doesn‚Äôt really tell them to go to the slow lane, even though there‚Äôs the risk of crashing. In other Better facilities like the Aquatics Centre they would direct clients to the suitable lane.
2) toilets and showers are extremely dirty, people just throw toilet paper everywhere but in the right place. I even found the packaging of some goggles inside one of the toilets.
3) most of the toilets and showers cannot be locked, resulting in people opening the door continuously when you‚Äôre trying to have a shower and relax. Maybe let‚Äôs fix them?
4) mothers going to the female changing room with boys and leaving them roaming around. One of them today opened the door of my shower multiple times because he was left alone in there by his mother (again, let‚Äôs fix the door lock).
5) even though the price is not low (see above) there will be a guy that kicks you out after your 1hr slot is over. And, considering the issues with all the people not swimming in the medium and fast lane, it‚Äôs really hard if you have a training programme to follow and a target distance.
The only positive thing I can say is that the swim doctor classes for adults are good, hence I‚Äôm giving 2 stars and not just one.
showerReviews.author: Chiara Grosso

showerReviews.reviewText: Big pool! (50m, with wide lanes) which encourages decent distance swimming even for those who are amateurs. Pleasant, helpful staff, nice showers, good lane segregation for those that want to splash around or swim at different speeds. Secure bike parking outside, 30p locker tokens from machine (lockers are tall, but narrow). Decent, down to earth facilities, only request would be why not add chairs to the non-members sun lounge, as it's currently a large, unused space? Nice visit.

locations.title: Ruislip Lido Beach
locations.address: ÓÉàHHQC+85, Ruislip HA4 7TX, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Ruislip Lido is a fantastic option if you're looking for a family day out that feels like a trip to the seaside without leaving London. The sandy beach is a huge hit with kids, and the pirate ship playground is genuinely brilliant‚Äîit kept my little ones entertained for ages. The miniature railway is a lovely touch and a fun way to see the whole area. There's a real sense of community here, and it‚Äôs great that entry is free.
My main reason for the 3.5 stars is to manage expectations for anyone new. First and foremost, you can't swim in the lake, which is a bit disappointing for a "lido." The water is beautiful to look at, but if you or the kids are hoping to jump in, you'll be out of luck. Secondly, on a sunny day, it gets incredibly crowded. Be prepared to hunt for a parking spot and find your patch of sand in a sea of people. The facilities are basic, and the queues for food and toilets can be quite long.
Overall, it's a brilliant place for what it is‚Äîa free, family-friendly beach experience in a beautiful woodland setting. Just go in knowing it's more about the sand and the playground than the swimming, and you'll have a great time!
showerReviews.author: Hyrax

locations.address: ÓÉàUnit, A, Eaststand Apartments, Avenell Rd, Highbury Square, London N5 1FE, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è

I honestly cannot recommend PT Bernard at Fitness First Highbury enough ‚Äì he has completely changed my life!

My story:
I had almost given up. After 1.5 years of sciatica pain and 6 months away from the gym, even basic daily movements left me in pain. I tried swimming just to stay active, but I didn‚Äôt enjoy it.

Then one day, the pool was closed, and I happened to speak to Bernard. He asked why I wasn‚Äôt lifting weights, so I explained my situation. He offered me a session to assess, and I gave it a try.

I thought whatever. I have tried all the possible treatment and spent so much money on it!

After just two sessions, all my pain was gone. Within a week, he had me lifting my previous personal best ‚Äì something I never thought possible again.

Now I‚Äôm lifting weights I couldn‚Äôt even dream about before. I‚Äôm pain-free, stronger, more confident, and finally enjoying working out again.

Thank you, Bernard ‚Äì you‚Äôve truly given me my training (and life!) back. üí™
showerReviews.author: Papp Alexandra

The #FitnessFirst branch whereby all 18 members of staff actually care about your wealth of health & wellbeing!
Ofcourse I've faves but truly respect & appreciate all the staff, they model kindness politeness & run the best health and fitness sessions.

Ina and Lewis ran a training on trax which changed my life as I noted ‚úÖÔ∏è my body transformation and growth in exercise knowledge and understanding. About 10years ago I was broken Runako was always one of the ones that said keep pushing you got this-he would most days with other staff watch me take the stairs in agony and opt for the lift-sat in with the towels. Fond memories of tannoy announcements of please and thanks of put your equipment back by famous George and Lilly Andre Ayten, Hamasa, Kamala et al. [I couldn't write only been typing this note for 30mins] adore you all!

My story my journey back to fitness has been moulded and encouraged by all the staff team-it's like a family where as Kai says all is #Sensational ...and not least adding Auntie Olivia who keeps the place clean and tidy for us all!

The facilities are always checked and we're kept safe warm and all is clean. Post the pandemic the management has kept all staff and this assurance must continue...that all employees work must be kept-as no such thing as a job for life but we meeting fitness pals for life!

showerReviews.reviewText: I genuinely love this gym overall, but there are several hygiene issues that are concerning and take away from an otherwise great experience at Fitness First Highbury. The showers are often dirty, with an unpleasant drain smell, and the sauna, steam room, and spa areas feel unclean, with walls, tiles, floors, and mirrors in the changing rooms clearly in need of thorough cleaning. There also appears to be a damp issue behind the water fountain near the steam room, which feels unhygienic and shouldn‚Äôt be present in that area, especially as it attracts bugs and bacteria. While the gym itself is excellent, the changing rooms and spa facilities would really benefit from a deep clean followed by consistent, regular maintenance to ensure the environment remains clean, safe, and hygienic for members.
showerReviews.author: Jodie Anne Taylor

locations.title: JD Gyms Darlington
locations.address: ÓÉàJohn St, Darlington DL1 1LG, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Disappointing Experience ‚Äì Safety, Accountability and Respect Ignored.

I‚Äôm writing this review to share my deeply disappointing experience with JD Gyms and to warn other members ‚Äî particularly women ‚Äî about the way concerns are handled by management.

During a recent visit, my phone was greatly damaged as a result of reckless behaviour by a group of young males in the gym. Despite having clearly set up equipment for myself, one individual jumped onto it, dislodging a weight which landed on my phone, leaving me feeling intimidated,  upset and frustrated. Staff later confirmed the incident via CCTV, acknowledged the behaviour, and even banned the individuals involved ‚Äî implicitly accepting the behaviour and actions were unacceptable.

Despite this, JD Gyms has completely refused to accept any responsibility. Their management has shown little interest in resolving the matter or even offering support. I was told to take it up with the individuals involved ‚Äî rather than the gym recognising that they failed to enforce their own rules or provide a safe environment. Their attitude has been dismissive, evasive, and frankly disrespectful.

This isn‚Äôt just about a phone. It‚Äôs about how a business responds when a female member is made to feel unsafe, ignored, and passed around between managers who want to wash their hands of the issue. There was no apology, no accountability, and no effort to make things right ‚Äî just an attempt to pass the blame.

JD Gyms may have impressive equipment, but their attitude toward member safety and responsibility is seriously lacking. I wouldn‚Äôt feel comfortable recommending them to anyone who expects even basic standards of care, support, or professionalism when something goes awry.
showerReviews.author: Karimah Miah

locations.title: Prime Backpackers
locations.address: ÓÉà333 City Rd, London EC1V 1LJ, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
First time staying, received a very warm welcome (American guy- didn't get his name sorry!) guided tour round the facilities.
Stayed in Covent Garden, 8 sleeper room, but there were only 2 of us so that was great. Beds were comfy and rooms were nice and warm. Liked the private bathrooms on the top floor, used the other showers, great pressure, lovely and hot.
Generally every where was clean and tidy, lucky to stay at the weekend and free pancakes were being served with a choice of toppings. Massive kitchen/dining area and cute little courtyard.
As a woman travelling on her own I felt perfectly safe, other staff and residents all very friendly.
Great location for attending gigs at Union Chapel. Very short walk from Angel tube station and lots of buses nearby, plus every shop you could ever need. Really good value for money. Looking forward to my next stay already.

Issues that need attention...
The blind in the room, needs taking down, not fit for purpose.
Mirror needed in the room, so you can do your hair without getting in the way of people using the communal area.
Shelf in the shower cubicle for putting your products/key card on.
More mugs and teaspoons needed in the kitchen.
A reminder to people about quiet hours over night, maybe it was just because it was a Friday? But it was noisy, people using facilities at 2/4am, music on somewhere in the building. Free earplugs might be a nice touch.
showerReviews.author: Kirsty J

There is a shelf, a light and charging stations above every bed which was great because that way I can sleep knowing that my valuables are next to me and I will also hear my alarm clock in the morning. Very good locker space. The showers are clean and spacious. Also there is a very nice bar and a lounge. 10/10 would recommend.

showerReviews.reviewText:
I had a great four-day stay at Clink78. I was in an 8-person room. They did a good job of booking people into the room who would also be there multiple days. There were a few people who came and went, but for the most part I was familiar with most of the people during my stay.

The toilets and showers were what I would expect at a hostel. Very simple and acceptable.

The Community areas were great. The TV and Computer rooms were unique and kind of fun to spend some time in. The bar area was fun. A lot of room to find a place to sit. I met great people there that made my trip even better.

I loved the location of the building. A bus from the Kings cross station dropped me off right in front of the building. The bus wasn't really necessary either. It was only a short walk to the station. There are plenty of restaurants along the way too.

Overall, great experience.
showerReviews.author: EdoftheDead

showerReviews.reviewText:
I had a great four-day stay at Clink78. I was in an 8-person room. They did a good job of booking people into the room who would also be there multiple days. There were a few people who came and went, but for the most part I was familiar with most of the people during my stay.

The toilets and showers were what I would expect at a hostel. Very simple and acceptable.

The Community areas were great. The TV and Computer rooms were unique and kind of fun to spend some time in. The bar area was fun. A lot of room to find a place to sit. I met great people there that made my trip even better.

I loved the location of the building. A bus from the Kings cross station dropped me off right in front of the building. The bus wasn't really necessary either. It was only a short walk to the station. There are plenty of restaurants along the way too.

Overall, great experience.
showerReviews.author: EdoftheDead

showerReviews.reviewText: I really enjoyed my stay at this hostel. Rooms are quiet and the beds are partitioned off so you get some actual space to yourself. Each bed has a light, an outlet, and a USB port. Lockers were big enough for my hand luggage. You can have quiet in your room, or if you're looking to stay up, enjoy the bar in the basement, which also serves food. Staff are friendly and do a wonderful job keeping the place very clean. This would have been a five star but I just couldn't stand how jam packed and crowded the kitchen/dining area always was. The tables, vending machines, benches and counters are just not spaced appropriately for many people are always in there, and you really can't even move at breakfast. The hallways are also very narrow, but I understand that it's an old building. I would absolutely recommend this place, and will likely be back!!
showerReviews.author: Mari Eileen

showerReviews.reviewText: Great hostel. Great prices, super duper clean, staff committed and speak your language if needed. I came by myself, no contacts and am leaving with great memories and friendship. Working people and travelers mix in harmony. What I appreciated the most is being able to party without being surrounded by binge drinking backpackers. Had great conversations. Shower super hot, loved it. Just didn't receive any information about the rules of the establishment nor the way it worked, especially the kitchen.

locations.title: Journeys King's Cross Hostel
locations.address: ÓÉà54-58 Caledonian Rd, London N1 9DP, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
This is the first time I've ever given a five star review. This is without a doubt the best hostel I've ever stayed at, for so many reasons. The rooms are cheap, and you get what you pay for having to share the room with strangers. But this is much better than any other hostel even at twice the price.

Excellent staff, friendly and helpful. Great location close to the tube and many nearby restaurants and stores. Free breakfast, not great but much much better than nothing (I had tea, juice and toast with jam, worked fine). Wifi everywhere. The showers are much better than hostel standard, and I never found them to be too cold as some others have posted, they were just perfect.

The fuse by my bed broke when I was here, and the staff was fantastic at fixing it right away. They have strict rules for orderly conduct at the hostel, and they seem to follow up on it since everyone was extremely well behaved.

I have absolutely no negative comments. As long as I can't afford a private hotel room, this is where I'm staying while in London.
showerReviews.author: Anton Nordenfur

showerReviews.reviewText: Located right next to King's Cross station, this is an ideally placed hostel. Which is probably the best thing it has going for it. Stayed here for two nights in a twin room with my travel companion. Room consisted of a twin bed, safe, small table and chair, small TV and a window. It was tight, as was the rest of the place, not a big deal but people who travel with a lot of or big luggage might have a tough time. "Breakfast" consists of toast a variety of jams and coffee and tea. Bathrooms and Showers are shared, clean, small and limited stalls. There is a kitchen and bar although I did not make use of them. Staff is friendly but everything is pretty much self service. Price is relatively cheap when talking about London. All in all its very average but your milage may vary...
showerReviews.author: Ignatious Rozario

Overall we had a good experience. The welcome cookie was a nice touch at check in. Brilliant!

showerReviews.reviewText:
This was the most disgusting hostel I‚Äôve ever stayed at, and I‚Äôve stayed at hostels all over the world. Where do I even start?

There were boogers all over the wall next to my bed. The floors in our room were never cleaned. How do I know this? Someone spilled nuts all over the ground on my first day and I just left today, three days later, and they‚Äôre still there.

The bathrooms are absolutely foul. They stink, the showers smell horrendous and the toilets are only cleaned once per day (two toilets per floor). You can imagine how disgusting they get. Zero toilet paper by the end of the day but nothing gets done about it. No outlets in the bathrooms so good luck shaving, straightening hair or blow drying your hair.

The only good thing about this place is the staff. They were super friendly and you could tell they would get embarrassed when a guest would complain about something.

I‚Äôve gone to another hostel here in London and it‚Äôs the same price and much cleaner, much better facilities and way better atmosphere.

Get it together restup.
showerReviews.author: Stacey Barrett

showerReviews.reviewText:
We stayed for one night at your hotel and had booked a room for four people. Unfortunately, the room was not fully prepared for all guests ‚Äî one person had no bedding, pillows, or blankets. Additionally, there were not enough hand and bath towels, and the sink plug was stuck. When we reported this to the night receptionist, we were provided with towels , but there were no extra pillows available, and nothing could be done about the sink at that time. So we used the towels as pillows and had no blankets for the night.

However, I would like to highlight the exceptional service provided by Carolina at check-out. She was very friendly, empathetic, and solution-oriented. After we shared our experience with her, she sincerely apologized for the inconvenience and even offered us complimentary breakfast as a gesture of goodwill. Thanks to her, we left the hotel with a positive feeling after this.

Carolina is truly a role model for customer service ‚Äî thank you again!
showerReviews.author: Razwan Mahmood

locations.address: ÓÉàThremhall Ave, Airport, London, Stansted CM24 1PY, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Really pricey for what you get, but at least everything‚Äôs modern. We were there for 1 night. If you need anything the staff is really helpful. We were messing with the thermostat because it was blowing really loud and cold air. It wasn‚Äôt saving what temperature we set, so we were hoping to not freeze overnight if it doesn‚Äôt heat up. (Luckily it did somehow)
In the bathroom the lightning is bad so if you do your makeup or something I recommend doing it in the room instead.
Not the cleanest hotel I‚Äôve been to but I would say it‚Äôs 80-90% clean based off of mirror/carpet and dust on signs and stuff.
There‚Äôs shower gel, shampoo, hair dryer, clothing iron and also towels.
Breakfast options are okay, for the small space it‚Äôs good selection. Was yummy, the area looks nice and the staff there is also really sweet and welcoming!
Shuttle bus is expensive (¬£4 for like 2mins) but convinient because there‚Äôs no way you‚Äôre walking to the airport.
Overall, I would‚Äôve stayed longer. :)
The photos were taken after we already packed out our things and got comfortable so don‚Äôt mind that.

locations.title: Islington Inn
locations.address: ÓÉà366 Essex Rd, London N1 3PD, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Negatives- A small room which barely fits a double bed and a table. The bed was very hard! like sleeping on the floor, it was by far the worst part. The phone service was terrible, no one wanted to talk and help. And I hope you like waking up early, the walls are thin and the maid was shouting and banging around and complaining about her job at 6-7am. Not good when you want a lay in.

Positives- the shower was probably the best I‚Äôve ever had. Amazing warmth and outstanding pressure. Although in a small shower cube.
The desk service was helpful, provided us with extra duvets to try and make the bed more comfy.

Would not be staying here again.

locations.title: Park Villa Boutique Hostel
locations.address: ÓÉà51 Grove Rd., Bow, London E3 4PE, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Great: got a really nice dorm room with just one other person, quiet restful night, friendly reception, possible to get a charger/converter, lock, paid towel, very convenient location for the metro, ok clean.

Some of the bathrooms smelled a bit moldy but there are more than enough to avoid those, and it's a hostel after all. Didn't use the kitchen.

Here is my number one problem why I cannot give full stars: I woke up with a couple of spots in one place that looked like bedbug bites. I did not find any other traces of these, so maybe it was something else, but I am still doubtful and the lockers are on the floor right under the bed,  so even though I tried to check my luggage I still worry about that sometimes.

locations.title: Four Points Flex by Sheraton London Shoreditch East
locations.address: ÓÉà309-317 Cambridge Heath Rd, London E2 9LH, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
This location was formerly a "Yotel" last year, rebranded as a Four Points Flex recently.
Rooms are tiny but clean.  My room had a double bed, a small window that didn't open, and the only space for suitcase storage was under the bed.  No closet, minimal storage, and no back for the desk chair. The shower was (again) tiny, but had multiple shower options, with an overhead rain type and a standard power shower wand.
The website does not show that they have breakfast, but they actually have a pretty standard UK Marriott breakfast bar.  Eggs, beans, streaky bacon, toast, pastries, plus juices, tea, and coffee / espresso.
The staff was friendly, and did what they could with their limited resources.
Location is great, the Bethnal Green underground station is incredibly close.  (However, there's stairs and an annoying change at Holburn from the Piccadilly to Central line.)
I was unable to check out the accessible rooms, but the lowest level was listed with an accessable WC on the elevator sign.
As a single traveler with a short, busy schedule, I'd stay here again.  But for longer term stays or a need to work from the room, I'd look for somewhere else.
showerReviews.author: Daniel Joseph

locations.title: Queensbridge Sports and Community Centre
locations.address: ÓÉà30 Holly St, London E8 3XW, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Great location and plenty of parking available in the evening and weekends (free after 6.30pm).

The facilities are pretty clean and tidy. It's quite small with the mens toilets only having one cubicle.

The gym is nice and spacious. I used it for Badminton and they had 5 courts available. It gets pretty busy and booked out really quickly.

The last slot is from 9.20pm to 10pm but the centre closes bang on 10pm so no option to use changing rooms to shower.

Very reasonable prices and cheaper if you do pay as you go annual membership.

My local gym.
I try to come once a week.  They have a number of facilities at this liesure centre but not as many as the others in Hackney.
They do not have swimming pool, a health suite or squash facilities.  Normally I use the gym which is good but could do with a few more options.  However sometimes I look to do some of the other activities that I mentioned above.  For those I have to use other leisure centres which is a bit inconvienient.  Otherwise I would have given it 5 stars.

locations.title: Clissold Leisure Centre
locations.address: ÓÉà63 Clissold Rd, London N16 9EX, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
The competition pool is deep from one side to the other and has spotlights on the ceiling which help create quite an impressive atmosphere. The attempt to not allow footwear in the changing rooms (in Japan they manage this more nearly but theft is less an issue there )  is welcome as is the instructions to shower before swim.
Changing room would benefit from simplifying: get rid of the cubicles and stick to open plan + showers + lockers  ( the Oasis pool is a good example ) for a less cramped feel . Nice vibe overall .
showerReviews.author: Morgan Hayes

The gym environment has become extremely toxic recently, staff dont seem to care at all as they seem to be friends with the users. Shame as clissold has one of the best gyms in any of the better leisure centres in or around hackney.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Recently booked an annual membership here and I'm saddened to report how disappointed I am.

I came here on Tuesday for the morning Swim for Fitness booking and the evening Swim for Women booking. In the morning, the main pool had a nice temperature and it was deep. Yet as i was doing my laps, i could see shocking objects floating past me: hair, plasters, chewing gum. The same thing applies to the shallow pool. It was absolutely disgusting seeing the amount of hair in the pool and the unknown objects floating by. My face felt waxy and dirty after my session, something that has never happened to me at other Better centres.

The changing rooms are cramped and dirty. The shower space is extremely small and barely functioning. I felt so claustrophobic showering in the cubicle, with its low water pressure but at least the water was warm.

I'm appaled and embarrased to say that I've caught ringworm which has affected my quality of life and the people around me.

Clissold is a beautiful and nostalgic place but there needs to be immediate changes to ensure every user can leave in a healthy and satisfied state. I have read your replies that insinuate there will hopefully be new changes with the changing rooms. Please, listen to your customers and take our personal experiences into consideration
showerReviews.author: Marwa

locations.address: ÓÉà763 High Rd. Leyton, London E10 5AB, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: Had a great time here today. The pools were all well managed by the lifeguards, they were actively checking how busy the pools were, closing them at capacity, making sure children were using the slides correctly etc which was nice to see. The two smaller pools were great for my toddlers and they really enjoyed the slides. We travelled half an hour to get here as we don‚Äôt have anything like this near us so it was a nice change. The only improvement for us would be more family changing rooms as they were full when we got there and the small changing rooms were very tricky to change twin toddlers in. They can‚Äôt help the size of the building though! We‚Äôd visit again

If they actually tried to stop people pushing through the gate for free they may be able to offer proper paper towels rather than toilet roll on the gym floor

Edit: great to hear one week later you have replenished the towels..

Regarding gate security it's simply not true. People shamelessly wait in the reception area so they can run through the gate as people leave or force arms through to hit the exit button so they can force the gate. I‚Äôve been really impressed with this leisure centre. The facilities are clean, modern, and well-maintained, making every visit enjoyable. The staff are friendly, approachable, and always willing to help with any questions. There‚Äôs a great variety of activities available, from the gym and swimming pool to classes that suit all ages and fitness levels.

What stands out most is how welcoming the atmosphere is ‚Äì it feels like a community space rather than just a place to exercise. The equipment is up to date, and the pool area is always tidy and well supervised. It‚Äôs excellent value for money, and I always leave feeling refreshed and motivated.

I would highly recommend this leisure centre to anyone looking for a reliable, professional, and enjoyable place to stay active.

showerReviews.reviewText: Women‚Äôs only gym that is big with good variety of equipment. Access straight into changing room and showers. again very spacious. One thing I would like to say is that I think all the changing rooms, shower rooms and toilets need to either be updated or refurbished to better the quality. On the weekends and on a Monday I take my children to their swimming classes and the cubicles smell awful. I mean most of the time it is well maintained but of course very outdated and especially with the traffic of people I understand that this is bound to happen. Perhaps there is a need for more maintenance staff during busier periods busy days. The staff are really nice.
showerReviews.author: p s18

showerReviews.reviewText:
It feels worthwhile to let people know that I literally contracted a UTI from the swimming pool here, especially if you‚Äôre compromised in some way.

Tried swimming here for the first time and experienced irritation immediately after, which cleared up by the end of the day; thought nothing of it, normal chlorine irritation etc‚Ä¶ Went again 2 days later and that time it didn‚Äôt clear up!!

I take all the preventative measures, showering before and after I swim and getting out of my costume asap, but that unfortunately means nothing if the pool isn‚Äôt being maintained properly / others aren‚Äôt doing the same!

It‚Äôs a shame because this is my local pool and I was really excited about getting into swimming here, but now unfortunately I‚Äôm too worried to go back. So much for free swimming if we‚Äôre all dunking ourselves in a pool of bacteria lol‚Ä¶.. I wish I took a tube of the water and got it tested.
showerReviews.author: emily :3

showerReviews.reviewText:
This was my first time bringing my kids for a swimming class, and unfortunately, it was a very unpleasant experience. As soon as I entered the swimming pool, one of the staff members came closer, stared at me, and pointed at me while using her  phone and chatting with a colleague ‚Äî it was extremely uncomfortable and unprofessional.

To make things worse, the receptionist was very rude when I asked about the entry card for the sessions. She didn‚Äôt take any time to explain how the system works or offer any help. showerReviews.reviewText:
I have been going for more than a month now, and I can say that it is worth it for what you pay. Here are some pros and cons that I have personally experienced. ‚¨á

Pros ‚úÖ
1. The gym premises are very clean, and staff are sanitising very often the machines
2. Friendly trainers and if you ask their help, they are more than happy to assist you
3. People in the reception are very kind
4. The gym has good ventilation, and the space is broad, so even at the peak times, you don't inhale any unpleasant smell

Cons ‚ùå
1. Due to Covid rules, the changing rooms are not in use, even the lockers are out of use (so, in space 2m x 2m, inside the gym room, they have put on the floor, laminated A4 papers with numbers and you leave your personal belongings at any of these available numbers)
2. If you purchased the ''activeBaseline'' there are specific hours that you can book a slot for free and enter the gym. If you need a different time, you have to pay extra

PS. I haven't used the swimming pool yet, but when I will, I'll keep you posted üèä‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è
showerReviews.author: Nafsika Sougia

showerReviews.reviewText:
The management is very poor. Many fitness classes were cancelled without any notice or suitable replacement. More than once, we were already in the studio ‚Äî or even in the water for Aqua Aerobics ‚Äî only to be told to go home. It would cost nothing for the gym to send a text or make a quick call to inform members.

Additionally, the cleanliness is inadequate, and the showers frequently have no hot water. After three years of paying regularly and consistently, I‚Äôve finally decided to give up my membership.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Would give it zero stars but it was not an option. The staff at the counter are so unprofessional and condescending. One staff member had their feet up on the chair, uninterested, hostile and obviously bored in front of paying customers. They do not communicate at all when asked for help ie with swimming, or timetables, or gym. An instance where me and other members were changing, a male staff tried to come into the changing rooms though he had asked another female staff before trying to enter - it was still disrespectful regardless and completely ignorant of what modesty means to covering Muslim women.

Improvement could look like: better showers, partitioned hairdryers station, trained polite staff, and overall clarity of enquiries which the app does not solve.
showerReviews.author: Sayemah Bsh

showerReviews.reviewText: I go there few times a week for swimming. It‚Äôs not the cleanest, especially the changing rooms. The staff don‚Äôt enforce shower before the pool or the swimming caps and this contributes to the dirt in the pool. Staff also don‚Äôt tell people off for floating in the fast lanes, so sometimes it‚Äôs not a great experience if you come there for training. Today asked my gf to record my swimming technique and got told off by staff for recording as other people could be inadvertently filmed in their swimwear. I was alone in the swim lane by the side of the pool with no one around me - guys, this is UK and this is a public swimming pool - you are allowed to film in public.
showerReviews.author: Roman Makarov

showerReviews.reviewText: This place has the dirtiest shower areas I've seen in my life. The hygiene standards are extremely low. The whole leasure center is no one's baby as management is not there to deal with complaints. People come to the pool not showered and basically have a bath inside the pool, even sometimes with clothing on. Pool is not usable in many evenings most of the week as there are specific woman-only hours... sometimes the gym is also split in half with a wall in between... Is this London or Saudi Arabia??? Overall this place has great potential but unfortunately is ran by irresponsible management and staff who don't do their job correctly and don't even wanna keep the place clean...
showerReviews.author: Navid Homayoun

showerReviews.reviewText:
I have been coming here for about 3 years and the gym equipment is good, the areas are cool and the some of the equipment has cooling included.
I‚Äôve never used any of the classes or have had any support from the staff at the gym during my whole time being there.

They have a separate section for women only to work out, this is usually only for a couple hours but  you have too look out for men sliding the door, some do not know it‚Äôs shut off or some may do it intentionally.

I have used the swimming facilities a few times but the slot times were never updated correctly which made it confusing for lifeguards on shifts.
I do not like the pool facilities it‚Äôs not clean enough so I try to use the pool early mornings.
The hot water is hardly working in the showers.
I feel like the toilet changing rooms are not clean at all!

The staff are okay, the male staff are friendly and helpful however, the females that work there are not and have always had a weird attitude.
The manager from Mile end was working there temporarily and he was really empathetic and kind to me, his level of customer service was nothing like the poplar bunch, which is why I stopped coming after that day.

I‚Äôve cancelled my membership and I‚Äôm glad, this place needs to improve.
showerReviews.author: K G

showerReviews.reviewText:
Gorgeous place for an outdoor swim. One way although route with different distances between 50m-400m. All the normal open water swimming rules apply: ie cap must be worn, no swimming on your back or they'll assume you need assistance and kayak over to check on you.

Only downside: It's a bit expensive for non-members. The facilities will be nicer once the big upgrade has happened (due to start summer 2025).
showerReviews.author: Louise

showerReviews.reviewText:
A little gulag for swimming enthusiasts. You must wear a silly brightly coloured hat! You must put on a rubber bracelet! You must get a plastic inflatable and strap it to your body (not making it up)! There is only ‚Äúmixed changing‚Äù (no separation by gender). You cannot linger and sunbathe. You cannot go to water for the second time (because they took your rubber bracelet)!!! There is barely any seating. So be a good stoic, go in, go out, change with all people watching and be on your way.

You HAVE to book in advance through terrible better app (the name of the app is a comic misnomer) and one off swim costs ¬£13.15 in July 20025.
showerReviews.author: Max Black

showerReviews.reviewText: Ridiculous. ¬£13+ for a 50 min dip in open water, if you haven't brought the right colour cap you have to buy one for ¬£6.75, or wear any headwear of the specified colours. I ended up swimming in a pink woolly hat which actually soaked up water and weighed me down but I was not allowed to remove it. There is only a small concreted area to rest, all the surrounding areas had been closed but entry price remained the same. Honestly not worth the cost and sucked the joy out of open water swimming.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Lovely staff, simple and informative induction. Tow floats provided. Red/pink/orange swimming caps required (purchasable on site).
It was my first time there on a Monday evening and it wasn't too busy but nice seeing people ending their day with a swim. Some people were doing a proper swim session but a few (myself included) had a nice chat and swam with friends. Plenty of space for everyone along the routes.
Booking through Better is very easy. Your name is on their system so you don't need to bring up your booking when you arrive, just give your name.
showerReviews.author: Illia Surya Afifuddin

So if you don‚Äôt feel confident, do talk to the staff before you get into the water and they‚Äôll help. Shame they don‚Äôt do classes there but it‚Äôs probably also due to capacity while the upgrades are happening. locations.title: Fit This Hackney Gym
locations.address: ÓÉà3 Reading Ln, London E8 1GQ, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
I‚Äôm deeply disappointed by my experience at Fit This Gym, Reading Lane, Hackney.

After being physically assaulted by another member in the ladies‚Äô locker room, I reported the incident to staff straight away. Instead of receiving support, I was spoken to harshly by management and banned from the gym, while the woman who assaulted me faced no consequence.

During that conversation, remarks were made about my personality and the way I carry myself ‚Äî including comments about how I ‚Äúwalk‚Äù and how I‚Äôm ‚Äúpopular‚Äù with staff and members. These comments were completely inappropriate, unprofessional, and felt personal and discriminatory. I was even described as ‚Äúwild‚Äù and told I didn‚Äôt know how to behave, which was deeply insulting and unfair, especially as I was the one who had just been assaulted.

As a woman of colour, I can‚Äôt ignore the racial bias and stereotyping that seemed to shape how I was treated. Many members who have known me for years reached out afterwards, expressing shock and sadness over how this situation was handled, and some said they no longer feel comfortable attending the gym.

I do want to make it clear that the staff and members at Fit This are phenomenal ‚Äî warm, supportive, and professional. My issue lies entirely with the management, whose handling of this situation was unacceptable and unprofessional.

I hope they take this as a moment to reflect seriously on accountability, respect, and the importance of addressing racial bias. No member should ever feel unsafe, dismissed, or humiliated in a place meant for wellbeing and community.

Following the manager‚Äôs public reply to my review, I felt it was important to respond with clarity and honesty so that my experience is fully understood.

Thank you for your response. I appreciate that the gym takes incidents seriously, but I want to clarify that my account is truthful and comes from a place of genuine hurt. I was physically assaulted and then spoken to in a demeaning way, being called ‚Äúwild‚Äù and told I ‚Äúdon‚Äôt  know how to behave.‚Äù

Despite being the one who was assaulted, I was banned indefinitely, while the other party was allowed to remain. Fairness would have meant both individuals being asked to leave pending investigation ‚Äî instead, only I was penalised.

It is well known among staff, members, and even the manager that I did not lay a finger on the person who assaulted me, yet he continues to describe me as ‚Äúthe aggressor‚Äù and my behaviour as ‚Äúthreatening.‚Äù I genuinely do not understand what he is referring to, as I did not behave violently in any way.

His comments about CCTV also gave me pause for thought ‚Äî particularly as there is no CCTV in the ladies‚Äô locker room, making it impossible for him to have reviewed the most crucial part of the incident. Any conclusions drawn from footage could only reflect what occurred at the main desk, where my attacker continued to goad me while I reported the incident to staff. Even then, I did not act violently or in a threatening manner; I simply raised my voice in distress after being harmed.

The manager stated that he acted fairly, yet his decision to immediately ban me indefinitely ‚Äî while reassuring the individual who assaulted me ‚Äî demonstrates the opposite. His actions and language throughout this incident reflect a very clear racial bias, and the events that took place only reinforce that. Describing me as ‚Äúaggressive‚Äù and ‚Äúthreatening‚Äù for expressing justified emotion after being assaulted is a damaging and racially loaded stereotype that should never have been used.

Several members who witnessed what happened have since reached out, expressing shock and disappointment. My concerns about bias and how the situation was handled remain sincere. Unfortunately, the manager‚Äôs response failed to address my concerns directly and instead relied on widely used rhetoric that doesn‚Äôt reflect the reality of what took place.

I continue to wish the wonderful staff and members ‚Äî who have always been warm and respectful ‚Äî all the very best.
showerReviews.author: ambreen butt

showerReviews.reviewText:
Located under the railway arches of Cambridge Heath station, it‚Äôs very easy get to. There‚Äôs plenty bus stops around it as it‚Äôs in the corner of a busy cross junction. If you prefer to drive then there‚Äôs free parking after 5:30pm and all day Sunday‚Äôs.

It looks very small from the outside, as you can‚Äôt see how many arches they‚Äôve taken. But it‚Äôs actually quite long and also us a women‚Äôs only workout area if the ladies prefer segregation. They have great equipment, enough space and also a spacious changing room with a sauna inside it. The shower cubicles are the biggest non-family cubicles I‚Äôve seen! The neon lights everywhere makes the place feel alive, even when there‚Äôs not many people in the gym (gives you good energy for a good workout). The staff there are really friendly too!

showerReviews.reviewText: If I could rate it 0 stars I would. To begin, the ‚Äútrainer‚Äù at the gym who welcomed me could not explain to me absolutely anything about the body scanner, how it works and what the results mean.. secondly, the matts were atrociously dirty and many people working out there need a serious BO check and learn about showering and the use of deodorant so that they are mindful of everyone else working out there that is trying to use the space without gagging (and no, in case you are wondering, I am not exaggerating). Lastly, first look around the gym when touring everything seemed great so I accepted to pay the monthly membership cost in full. Once I finished my workout I shared this negative experience with the front desk and asked for a refund and that they keep the 10¬£ day rate charge. They hounded me on whatsapp for a tour but when it came to cancelling - radio silence. I had to dispute this transaction as they were unwilling to help. Terrible customer service.

showerReviews.reviewText: Great gym with good apparatus. It‚Äôs 24hrs which is handy if you work late sometimes. Located on the high street in dalston area, but parking is not free till after 6:30pm in the area, and you have to walk a little as there are no parking bays really close. The gym was a little small for my liking. Im a free weights person, and having only three benches in the dumbbell area just wasn‚Äôt for me. I went to check the place out on a day pass and luckily found one spare when I went on peak times‚Ä¶ but I know this wouldn‚Äôt be a regular thing if I joined. Upstairs was boiling hot (don‚Äôt know if they have AC or if it wasn‚Äôt working). Downstairs was very cool and fresh feeling as the AC was on. The entire gym was a bit too small for my liking as I had to walk in zig zags to not interrupt the members workouts. What I did love about the place was that they had individual shower area with connected changing area. It‚Äôs like having your own changing room! They also had a separate changing room cubicles. Again that was your own cubicle so you get maximum privacy when you get changed or you‚Äôre showering. Overall it‚Äôs a nice gym, but it was too small and busy for the times I go to the gym.

locations.title: GYMPODS
locations.address: ÓÉàDalston Square, Dalston Ln, London E8 3FS, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Really great experience and will definitely be back.

I booked the Pilates reformer via ClassPass and check in was easy. The room was wiped down after the last person finished up. The room came fully equipped - the reformer with a tower, boxes, ring, ball, foam roller. It‚Äôs still a new facility, so the springs on the reformer are pretty tight.

There is an iPad in the room that you can use to stream reformer workouts online, otherwise I figure you can play from your own device. I played around with it a little, but for the most of my time there, I played around without a set routine in mind.

The bathroom was clean and there is a shower in the facility. I saw the rest of the pods and everything looked beautiful.

I‚Äôd recommend this for all sorts of users - new to fitness, recovering from an injury or pregnancy, not wanting to deal with a crowded gym or those just wanting some private time. Also a great alternative for those who like to film fitness content, since you won‚Äôt have to worry about getting other people in your film.

Highly recommend checking it out.
showerReviews.author: Cat

showerReviews.reviewText:
Came here to train with a friend while out in London and it was amazing!

Really easy to book a pod online, we did it while on the train into London. We even arrived earlier than the booking time and were able to move our booked time to an earlier one which was really useful.

We booked a Strength pod and were really impressed with the space itself and equipment. Really clean, private space with everything you could need for a workout.

The individual shower/changing rooms were also great and really handy, plus really well maintained. Being able to hire a towel for only ¬£1.50 each was also really convenient as it saved us needing to bring our own.

The woman working on reception and the co-founder who was in reception were both really friendly and helpful while greeting us and showing us round.

For what you get and the quality of the equipment, it's really well priced. Would definitely come back here to train in future!
showerReviews.author: Jordan Kennerley

showerReviews.reviewText:
I recently joined GYMPODS and have had an outstanding experience from day one. The owners, Mike and Simon, are not only experienced professionals but also lovely, down-to-earth people who genuinely care about their members. Mike went above and beyond to assist me in applying as an Instructor at the gym, and the turnaround time was impressively fast.

The staff at GYMPODS are fantastic, creating a welcoming and supportive atmosphere that sets the gym apart. It's evident that they are committed to providing a positive and inclusive environment for all members.

The gym itself is well-equipped, with spacious pods that offer a private and focused workout experience. The added convenience of showers and toilets is a definite plus. The overall cleanliness and maintenance of the facility are top-notch, reflecting the dedication of the management to providing a comfortable and hygienic space.

One of the standout features of GYMPODS is the genuine atmosphere it exudes. It's not just a place to work out; it feels like a community. My clients have expressed their satisfaction with the facility and the services provided.

Moreover, the location is easily accessible, making it convenient for anyone looking to incorporate fitness into their daily routine.

I highly recommend GYMPODS to anyone looking for a gym that not only helps you achieve your fitness goals but also fosters a sense of community and well-being.
showerReviews.author: Mark

showerReviews.reviewText:
I‚Äôve been doing group swimming lessons at Kings Hall Leisure Centre for a while now, and I just realised I‚Äôve never left a review even though I‚Äôm really happy with the service and staff! The pool might be a bit old and dated, but it‚Äôs always pretty clean, and everyone there is super friendly.
My swimming teacher, Ileana, is honestly the best! I actually go there just because I enjoy her lessons so much. She makes every class fun and always mixes things up with diving, jumping, and different swimming styles to keep us excited.
Thanks so much for giving me confidence in the water and for making learning to swim such a fun experience!

showerReviews.reviewText:
I kid you not each week another machine disappears or becomes out of order. The machines are never cleaned. The staff mop and hoover every day but never properly, very badly done and therefore constantly missing large areas of the gym, etc. The swimming pool has been a mess for literally more years than I can count. Have avoided it my whole life which is unfortunate because I love swimming. The lack of clean and functioning machines which again, literally decrease by the week, is ridiculous and the membership fee should not be more than ¬£10-¬£15 for what you‚Äôre actually getting with the state of things. They need to hurry up and sort all the machines out, or start refunding membership fees. I know they‚Äôre planning some type of renovation but this has not actually started, it‚Äôs been getting pushed for months and months now and in the meantime they‚Äôre not fixing or replacing the machines. Abysmal management all around. Literally any O Better gym is better than this location.

Every single toilet is not maintained and cleaned, the disabled toilet hasn‚Äôt even had hand wash for weeks now. I wish I was exaggerating in saying the state of all the toilets stinks and it is so run down you‚Äôd think you‚Äôre in a third world country‚Äôs market toilet! You feel disgusting using the toilets there.

Unfortunately, I am restricted to using this location only due to disabilty and that just means I‚Äôm paying for a treadmill and if I‚Äôm lucky 3-4 functioning machines. Insanity that this has gone on as long as it has and Lord knows how much longer it will likely continue!
showerReviews.author: Queen Ameera

showerReviews.reviewText:
‚Äãüö® Formal Complaint: Urgent Improvements Required at Everyone Active Stratford
‚ÄãTo the Management Team,
‚ÄãI am writing to express my significant dissatisfaction with several persistent issues at the Everyone Active Stratford leisure center, where my family has been a member for approximately 18 months. The following areas require immediate management attention and permanent resolution, as they are severely impacting the member experience:

‚Äã1. Persistent E-Gate Malfunction (Facility Integrity)
‚ÄãThe electronic entry gate has been consistently unreliable for the entire duration of our membership (1.5 years). Today, the ongoing fault reached a critical point, signifying a complete failure of the system.
‚ÄãIssue: The e-gate is perpetually broken or malfunctioning.
‚ÄãImpact: This creates unnecessary friction at entry and defeats the purpose of an automated access system.
‚ÄãAction Required: I request that this system is fixed permanently and thoroughly, not just temporarily reset. This has become a chronic and highly annoying operational failure.

‚Äã2. Poor Customer Service and Reception Staff Demeanor (Staff Conduct)
‚ÄãThe general demeanor and attitude of the reception staff are consistently unprofessional and unwelcoming.
‚ÄãObservation: Staff members frequently appear moody, do not smile, and project an air of annoyance towards members.
‚ÄãImpact: This creates an unwelcoming atmosphere and makes members hesitant to approach the desk.
‚ÄãSpecific Incident: When attempting to raise a complaint about the changing rooms (see point 3), the staff member offered an unhelpful response, stating, "unfortunately, I can't help you with this," rather than escalating the feedback or logging a maintenance request.
‚ÄãAction Required: Management must address the customer service standards and provide necessary training to ensure staff adopt a professional, helpful, and welcoming disposition.

‚Äã3. Unsanitary Changing Room Conditions (Hygiene and Maintenance)
‚ÄãThe cleanliness of the changing rooms, particularly on the floor, is unacceptable and reflects poorly on the facility's hygiene standards.
‚ÄãObservation: The changing room floors are often visibly dirty, especially around 11:00 AM, with excessive amounts of hair left after members use the drying facilities.
‚ÄãImpact: This creates an unpleasant and unsanitary environment for all members.
‚ÄãAction Required: Cleaners are employed to maintain hygiene. Management must ensure that the cleaning schedule and standards are strictly enforced, with frequent checks during peak usage times, and that staff are held accountable for their duties.

‚Äã4. Lack of Communication in Swim Stage Progression (Children's Programs)
‚ÄãThere is a significant failure in communicating the progression path for children enrolled in swimming lessons.
‚ÄãIssue: Instructors do not adequately explain the criteria for moving from one stage to the next, nor do they clearly communicate the child's individual growth and necessary next steps.
‚ÄãImpact: Parents lack transparency regarding their child's development and the value of the lessons.
‚ÄãAction Required: All swim teachers must be instructed to provide regular, clear, and actionable feedback to parents on how their child is progressing and the specific skills required to advance to the next stage.

‚ÄãI expect a formal acknowledgment of this detailed complaint and a clear plan of action regarding these four fundamental areas of service and operational failure.
showerReviews.author: Audrius Urbonavicius

showerReviews.reviewText: I'm a regular sauna user and this one is magnificent.  Worth the price as the private space, complimentary and paid refreshments are so lovely.  The view from the sauna is great, and the heat of the sauna itself is top notch.  The showering facilities are nice, and it's a relaxing atmosphere.  The front desk staff are helpful and personable.  The time slots are quite strict, so make sure you take them seriously - but it does give confidence in knowing that they ensure cleanliness between patrons.  It's too bad that it's booked up so far in advance!  I would love for them to expand their offering, and hopefully build more facilities!

Free water and tea. Cold plunges and cold showers too. Lockers also. Amazing spot and unlike SO much in london, you don‚Äôt need to book weeks in advances and the pricing is fair. Everyone is respectful so you don‚Äôt get idiots ruining the vibe.

Definitely recommend and great cafe afterwards (Hermanos) for some great coffee!

Firstly, it's very hard to find this place as there's no noticeable sign labels of it.  Especially in the evening, it becomes very hard to locate it. showerReviews.reviewText:
Love this place! I wasn‚Äôt sure what to expect, so my expectations were low‚Äîbut I couldn‚Äôt have been more wrong.

At this location, there are three saunas: a medium-heat larger one, a very hot slightly smaller one, and a silent one. There are also three cold plunge baths (8¬∞C, 3¬∞C, and 2¬∞C) and free filtered water and tea.

All the saunas were great. My favorite was the silent one, as some groups in the other saunas were quite loud, talking as if they were in a bar. The silent sauna was just perfect. They even bring in crushed ice with essential oils‚Äîit smells amazing! The downside is that it‚Äôs small and can get packed.

The cold plunges are big and very cold. On a chilly day, it‚Äôs easy to just step out and cool down naturally, or use the cold shower, which is just as cold.

One thing to note: there‚Äôs no hot shower, so no way to wash or dry your hair. I did my research and was prepared for that.

Besides that, the team is friendly, the saunas are perfect, and the prices are amazing. Will definitely be back!
showerReviews.author: Ausra Stan

The cold plunges are big and very cold. On a chilly day, it‚Äôs easy to just step out and cool down naturally, or use the cold shower, which is just as cold.

One thing to note: there‚Äôs no hot shower, so no way to wash or dry your hair. I did my research and was prepared for that.

Besides that, the team is friendly, the saunas are perfect, and the prices are amazing. Will definitely be back!
showerReviews.author: Ausra Stan

showerReviews.reviewText: Really enjoyed the facilities. There are a variety of differently shaped saunas, and a few ice cold plunge pools. The hot tea was a really nice touch. A few more lockers would be helpful, and I wish the sessions could be longer than an hour. An hour is not enough!

showerReviews.reviewText:
Fantastic outdoor sauna. They have 3 wood fired saunas in different styles, excellent temperature controlled cold plunges and open air showers.

The team at Hackney Community sauna have done an excellent job with this outpost in Stratford. I slightly prefer the venue here, with its great layout and the surrounding trees and buildings.

There are lockers (You need to bring your own padlock), 5 changing booths as well as 6 spaces to lock your bike up inside the venue.

Bring your own towels or rent them for a modest surcharge on arrival. Daytime "off-peak" sessions (until 17:00) are particularly good value.

Free herbal tea is supplied in a samovar, as well as chilled water to help you stay hydrated during the session.

During the sessions (and on request) they bring in crushed ice with essential oils that they can put on the sauna rocks for a wonderful, relaxing steam infusion which really adds to the experience.

Worth considering membership for regular attendees, this gives you 50% off entry for each session and costs ¬£23 per month.
showerReviews.author: N Hov

showerReviews.reviewText:
Traditional and infrared sauna and copper ice baths, superb facilities. Changing rooms are big, everything is spotless clean.

Only recommendation that hairdriers would need to be installed in the changing rooms or toilets to dry hair. These are necessary especially during these winter months.

showerReviews.reviewText: I have been here a few times now.  My most recent visit was a bit shocking.  There is little to no sauna etiquette from other patrons.  The single sauna was over crowded, and people were leaving their towels in the sauna to claim seats.  It was deeply uncomfortable and not very considerate.  The staff seem like genuine friendly people but they don't really say much upon arrival as most of the staff I've met have either been on the phone to a friend wearing headphones, or have been taking up the sofa by the entrance with a friend to socialise with them.  I think this lackadaisical approach is what could be leading to the poor etiquette by patrons.  During my last visit it seemed as though there were a number of people who were not staying within the slot they had booked for.  I don't think policing this sort of thing is nice for anyone, but if the slots are all booked up, it leads to a poor experience for everyone.  I think a bit of a time reminder for everyone wouldn't hurt.  For a sauna that charges a little more per visit compared to others, this experience is really subpar.   The facilities aren't bad and I wish the etiquette was better - I think there are absolutely ways to improve the experience, and I really hope issues are corrected soon.  Otherwise, I would just travel further for a nicer experience.
showerReviews.author: K Webb

locations.title: PureGym London Hoxton
locations.address: ÓÉàRosewood Building, Unit 14 Cremer St, London E2 8GX, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
I came here today for the first time, after having issues getting in when it first opened.

This is the replacement of the closure of PureGym Shorditch. It‚Äôs not as big as the shorditch branch (shorditch was two floors) but it‚Äôs bigger than it looks in the pictures taken of the gym. It‚Äôs very spacious and very well kept. All the weights were where they were supposed to be, and the changing room was very clean too. The studio looks amazing too.

My membership covers me to use any branch, so I tend to use different gyms at different times (I choose to go quiet moments as you get a better workout in a shorter amount of time), but this gym seemed to be just perfect for me. The worst part of going to the gym for me is waiting for an apparatus.

I‚Äôm glad this branch opened‚Ä¶ it‚Äôs closer to home for me too, so it‚Äôs a win win for me!

I want to give this gym more stars but i cant.... I use to go here when it first opened and it was great. but since moving back to the area and returning to the gym im a bit concerned about hygiene issues..... the bathrooms STINK! genuinely it cant cost that much to invest in some sort of air freshener or get some proper ventilation. Air is always so thick in the gym but the bathrooms are another level. i just don't get it.
i wish people weren't so gross as well.... so you cant always blame the gym for people being gross, but its the gyms responsibility to make it a comfortable space for people to change/shower/get clean. i always feel more dirty

showerReviews.reviewText:
I have been coming here for a year compared to the other pure gyms this one is one of the worst
But lets start with the positives, it is nice and clean comes with free WiFi and is in a nice location in the basement
Open 24hrs like all pure gyms are
Now the negatives, unfortunately the equipment is wearing out compared to the other pure gyms they have not replace or fixed broken equipment all the treadmills are worn out they have broken fittings if you put them on a basic incline the all begin to squeak. The weight machines need some seeing to as some of the seats are lose and need to be screwed back down. But then the cleanliness is questionable. We know it is a busy gym it has alot of coming and going but we see inside bottle holders with dried up mess, lack of paper towels and cleaning spray for people to clean the machines down, as well as the toilets as you can see many complaints about that
And here we are paying ¬£40 A Month for this
I wonder do the pure franchise managers read these comments
showerReviews.author: Fong Long

showerReviews.reviewText:
The gym has been completely refurbished, I would say within the last year, with top-of-the-line Puregym kit, all straight out of the box, and not a scratch on any of it.

It only has one issue really, which is size, being one of the smallest I've been in, it's split over 2 floors as seems common, but the class areas are small, and there's not even enough room for separate changing rooms, so they're shared, with individual shower rooms, which to be fair, is smart use of real-estate, as is a sensible amount of cardio kit for the space available.

Quality over quantity, it scores lower for variety of kit than some, and only really worth the extra cost whilst not so many people are turning out, during the crisis.

locations.address: ÓÉà189-219 Isledon Rd, Finsbury Park, London N7 7JR, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
I‚Äôve been going to this gym since April, and I usually work out after 11 p.m. when there are fewer people. Overall, I like this gym because it has everything I need for my training.

However, there are a few downsides. Not everyone puts dumbbells and other equipment back in their proper places, so quite often I have to clear and reorganize things before I can start my workout. I understand that this mostly depends on gym members themselves, and the staff cannot control every individual.

Another issue is that sometimes homeless people are in the gym . Once, a woman was sleeping in the women‚Äôs  changing room with several bags next to her, and unfortunately she was next to my locker. I had to wake her up to get my belongings.

Despite these small issues, I still enjoy this gym and try not to focus too much on minor inconveniences.
showerReviews.author: Kim Kein

showerReviews.reviewText:
This gym is DIRTY!!! Cleanliness and hygiene clearly is not a priority for the staff at the gym.

First of all the sanitisation stations on the gym floor (of which there are nowhere near enough) are almost always empty of spray, or the paper has run out. The staff do not fill these up frequently enough, so you cannot wipe down equipment before/after use‚Ä¶.gross.

Second, the changing rooms and shower facilities are horrendous . The drains STINK SO BAD it makes me feel sick. The smell hits you as soon as you enter the changing rooms. And the showers are FILTHY, just look at the photos. The showers have a serious drain fly infestation, as I often find several flies sharing the shower with me in the mornings. The showers are not regularly descaled. Mould is growing in the cubicles, and they‚Äôre just generally filled with dirt and muck.

Im a regular visitor to this gym and I often see the cleaners in the changing rooms doing no cleaning whatsoever, they just sit down chatting on the phone, clearly not talking about work. Ive never seen a cleaner present who actually cleans, and the lack of hygiene just reflects that. It‚Äôs absolutely disgusting. There needs to be a major overhaul in the cleaning/hygiene of this gym.

**edit**

I wrote a review on this place about 9 months ago saying how dirty it is, and unfortunately nothing much has changed since.

Cleaning appears to be non-existent in this gym. Just one example, ontop of the various ones I mentioned in my previous review above. the sanitary bins in the female changing rooms are left overflowing, (see photo attached) which is straight up disgusting??? How do the staff let hygiene standards get this low?

The cleaning stations are always either missing spray or tissue, theres hardly ever both present. So you can rarely wipe down your equipment because the staff don‚Äôt replenish the cleaning stations. This is on-top of the changing room toilets, which often lack any soap, so you can‚Äôt actually wash your hands most of the time!?!?

Within the entrance to the gym, before the one way turnstile pods, most days there are usually homeless people camping out, using drugs and whatnot. This creates a very unwelcoming environment, as you need to walk right past to actually access the gym floor. The staff seem to do absolutely nothing about this, as this happens almost everyday I enter the gym. On the rare occasions there aren‚Äôt any homeless people, the rubbish they leave in the entrance is not cleaned by staff, looping back to the poor hygiene standards‚Ä¶.

I wish i didn‚Äôt have to go to this gym, but unfortunately theres not much choice in the area, as this puregym is the only commercial gym in Finsbury park. I suspect this is why this gym is so poor, because there is practically no competition nearby. Thank god GymBox has FINALLY announced they will be opening around the corner in the summer, I cant wait to leave this place, and go to a gym that actually has hygiene and cleaning standards.
showerReviews.author: Niamh

locations.title: PureGym London Whitechapel
locations.address: ÓÉà100 Whitechapel Rd, London E1 1JG, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
I've been a member at Pure Gym Whitechapel for nearly three years, and while the location has its merits, there are some significant issues that need addressing.

On the positive side, the gym offers a wide range of equipment suitable for various workout routines, and the class schedules are fairly diverse. However, the most glaring problem is the state of the toilets. In all honesty, they are possibly the worst I have ever encountered. The persistent foul smell and the lack of cleanliness make them almost unusable. It's genuinely difficult to even step inside without being overwhelmed by the conditions.

Another major concern is the presence of mice running around the gym. This is not only unsettling but also raises serious questions about hygiene. Despite these drawbacks, the gym's location is convenient, and the membership price is competitive. However, the poor hygiene standards significantly detract from the overall experience. I hope management takes these issues seriously and implements immediate improvements.
showerReviews.author: Shayful Islam

showerReviews.reviewText:
A very ordinary and unremarkable gym, the only thing that really attracts people to this brand is the price. However, recently there will be an additional ¬£4 charge, increasing the price from ¬£23 to ¬£27.

This gym is not worth the price at all, as the equipment is deteriorating in just 5 months (despite the renovation they did and the purchase of the previous gym in the same location).
I don't know how it is in other places, but in this particular location, it's always super busy. A workout that would normally take a maximum of 45 minutes easily turns into 1h30m due to machine waiting time.

The machines are outdated, and the weight area remains tiny (the same problem as the previous gym brand in the same location). Men's bathroom is disgusting, always wet and with a horrible smell, the lockers are tiny compared to the gym that occupied the same location before.

There's nothing special about this gym that justifies the price increase in just 5 months and there are other competitors in the same area with better prices and more benefits.
showerReviews.author: Diogo Figueira

First of all there is no spray to wipe down machines, nasty! Asked team members why and got a very fobbed of response. I was told the company are not providing sprays anymore and we should bring towels‚Ä¶‚Ä¶ not sure about this when I‚Äôve been to other gym groups and they still provide them. Can we just have one story and stick to it please. It‚Äôs either you do provide it or you don‚Äôt

New parking validation machine system in place members not sufficiently notified resulting in many of us getting PCNS. There is no signage in or around the centre to notify that this is now  what we need to do. After receiving my PCN on a new day I went to log my reg before starting my session and the machine wasn‚Äôt even logged in!!

It didn‚Äôt used to be so unorganised here

Update post managers half hearted response:
This was a very dismissive answer and why couldn‚Äôt you address the parking and lack of signage?

showerReviews.reviewText: A nicely refurbished gym taken over by the Gym Group from Fitness First. Pricing is ok for 24/7 access but it gets very busy in the evenings. Now for some odd reason they don‚Äôt provide any sprays or towels to wipe down the equipment before/after a workout. Sometimes there‚Äôs so much sweat on the machines it is quite disgusting. You‚Äôd think after covid (arguably still ongoing), providing sanitising products would be mandatory. It is a health hazard in my opinion. The changing rooms are tidy but the choice of furniture is so odd! The bench is made of three wooden sticks with huge gaps which make sitting very uncomfortable. Plus they put rows of hooks right above the bench which could be ok for jackets but people hang their underwear and sweaty clothes on these hooks. All very unhygienic. The gym doesn‚Äôt always have staff onsite which makes me think what would happen if there was an emergency. It is remotely monitored but from who knows where. I guess you‚Äôll have to rely on a member knowing CPR when it happens. The gym music is often too loud and I have to turn up the volume in my headphones even louder. I guess you get what you pay for.
showerReviews.author: Kuskus Belchonok

locations.title: The Gym Group London Stratford
locations.address: ÓÉàUnits 8.5 and 8, 6 Victory Parade, Fortunes Walk, East Village, London E20 1JF, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
I‚Äôve always been a member of the gym group. My first membership was at the one in Leyton, I then took a break and I joined this gym. I‚Äôm glad I made the move, this gym is more spacious, more equipment and also they have different equipment that my last gym didn‚Äôt have.

Absolutely love this gym! The equipment is always clean and well-maintained, the staff is friendly and knowledgeable, and the atmosphere is super motivating. The space is so big and there is a lot of equipment available. Another thing to mention is that this gym is run my camera‚Äôs so there‚Äôs no staff in the gym 24/7, they are watching on the camera‚Äôs. The only staff you see in the gym are the personal trainers and class leaders.

There‚Äôs also a great sense of community here people are respectful and focused, and there‚Äôs a supportive vibe that makes it easy to stay consistent. The locker rooms are clean and well-stocked, but the parking options here are quite poor. Most of them are Monday - Sunday 9:00am - 11:00pm or Monday - Sunday 9:00am - 9:00pm. Even if you do come in between those times all the parking spaces are always full.

The gym group app is very useful. They have lots of different work out and stretches for you to choose from so you can create your own gym routine, and create your own list. You can set goals, book classes and book personal trainers aswell. The app also lets you know how many people are at the gym.
showerReviews.author: Honest Reviews

showerReviews.reviewText:
