showerReviews.reviewText:
It‚Äôs an acceptable gym if you go off peak, and remember it‚Äôs cheap. But there are a lot of faults.

Firstly, the door situation is kind of dangerous - you need to scan a QR code to enter and exit, but there is no mobile signal inside and no working WiFi. So you can easily become trapped inside.

As with most commercial gyms, there are not enough squat racks so you‚Äôll probably have to wait. Even when the gym is at 40% capacity you‚Äôll have almost no luck getting any equipment. If it‚Äôs over 30% personally I will avoid it.

The gym is very disorganised. Plates are left all over the place, in no order. Bumper plates are mixed in with machine plates. Some racks and machines have no plates, others have a bizarre distribution. Clips and collars left all over. Barbells get used by people for hip thrusts and just left on the floor instead of being returned.

The gym does not provide paper towel or wipes, so bring your own and remember most other users do not clean up their own sweat.

There are no bands, pvc pipes or dowels etc for warming up and only one technique (8kg) barbell and one womens weight barbell (15kg). But they do have bumper plates and lifting platforms so it‚Äôs ok for Weightlifting if you get a rack.

Not sure what time they clean, but when I arrive at 6:30ish there are often many empty cans and bottles on the floor as well as other general litter.
showerReviews.author: Stuart B

showerReviews.reviewText:

showerReviews.reviewText:
Very disappointing on all levels. The gym is OVERCROWDED during peak times - you are looking at 130-160 people in a small gym. If you are OK with waiting to use a squat rack or a bench for 20-30 min, then you shouldn't have a problem.
This gym is a grand waste of time when it comes coming in for a workout and having to compete with others for equipment. It's like the Gym Group doesn't care about max capacity and overcrowds the gyms.

The people at this gym lack etiquette. Expect to find people hogging machines, talking on their cell phone, texting between sets on the machines, leaving weights and plates all over the place when finished, not unracking weights, etc. the list goes on and on...

There are no spray bottles or paper towels to wipe down equipment, so after hundreds of uses from members, nothing is wiped down. You are laying on someone else's sweat and stink between sets.

You get what you pay. Pay cheap and get very little in return. I have buyers remorse of this place and wish I did not sign on for a 6 month contract. I definitely will NOT be returning to this gym ever again.
showerReviews.author: Trevor Smith

Some of the cardio equipment could be fixed or maybe I just couldn‚Äôt figure them out not sure will ask next time I go for some help (they have a free get to know and understand the gym session included in your membership I just have done it as yet). Other regular equipment is awesome and it has 2 floors where the ground floor is more for heavy lifting and top floor for machines, dumbbells, cardio and stretching.

showerReviews.reviewText: I didn‚Äôt stay in one of their rooms, just stopped off for a 45 minute break, went to the counter, validated my token and was asked if I‚Äôd like to shower or use the toilets and was directed to where I needed to go. Facilities and supplies are plentiful and staff were not only very polite and friendly, but also falling over themselves to help with whatever I asked. Food looked and smelled amazing (I was gutted to be completely devoid of any sort of an appetite during my visit) and was very reasonably priced indeed. I cannot believe that in 4 years of truck driving I‚Äôve never been here before - I‚Äôll definitely be making an effort to stop here again! Can‚Äôt recommend it enough.

showerReviews.reviewText:

Highly recommend if your around this way. Ideal if double manning with a hotel on site .

showerReviews.author: James Paterson

showerReviews.reviewText:
First time visit to Onroute Truckstop Jcn 29 of the M1. First of all a congratulations to all the staff on site, I engaged with ground staff who were at the fuel pumps, shop staff, the catering team in the restaurant and visited the truck wash.

On arrival, my purpose of the visit was to refuel, quick shower, some breakfast and wash my truck. All of which were the result of my eroute @SNAP app. Fuel pumps were easily accessible with over head canopy at 5m height restriction.

Keyfuels, UK fuels and Silvey Fuel cards accepted with loads of information boards encouraging you to sign up to the Onroute app and collect loyalty points which can be reclaimed onsite as discounts towards purchases, and 50% off your first restaurant order. A few minutes later my app was installed and breakfast ordered whilst stood at the fuel pumps!

Parked up and next on the agenda was a quick shower. Straight into the shower block which was spotlessly clean on entry with a separate changing and drying area. A bit old school but better than trying to dress on a wet floor. Striped off and wondered into the shower cubicle to find a vending machine at the shower with a notice to buy a token from the shop at ¬£2.50 for the pleasure. I was sorely tempted to walk back out naked to get my token but decided as time was of the essence and my breakfast was being cooked, to dismiss the shower for now. Perhaps moving the notice to the shower door would be advised? As a result no review to the showers or the hot water, but looking at the shower curtains, stained and tired looking, we‚Äôll leave that there.

The shop staff, stock available and friendly engagement was first class. I picked up some Tacho rolls and paid via Apple Pay at the till and was given a receipt without asking. Conversations were flowing and a happy environment - 10/10.

In the foyer and just outside the front door with the usual slot machines and laundry facilities, all working and available for use.  Plenty more information on hand about facilities on offer and selection of advertising.

Into the restaurant and again a joyful atmosphere with happy staff and a greeting by another member of staff ensuring I had downloaded the Onroute app and even offered me a fuel card application for silvey - nice touch. Food was presented bang on time as per the app order, was piping hot and further enquiries if I needed anything else, which I didn‚Äôt. They catered for everything. Very well done 10/10.

After breakfast I retired with my coffee to the seating area outside for my cigarette and the smoking area was fully accessible, clean and tidy.

Finally the truck wash, which was the purpose of the visit. I departed Driffield in Yorkshire on route to the South West and my collected trailer was black. It was supposed to be white!  Logging into the Snap app my first available truck wash on route was here. So this was a fairly integral part of my visit. You can imagine my disappointment to pull up and find it abandoned and closed. 0/10

All in all, not a bad experience, not sure if the truck wash is permanently closed but it‚Äôs let the site down in its overall scores.
showerReviews.author: Casper Roe-Lavery

locations.title: Onroute Truckstops - Swindon Truckstop
locations.address: ÓÉàSwindon truck stop Oxford road, Oxford Rd, Swindon SN3 4ER, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Wow! Onroute Truckstops have been very busy at Swindon! What an amazing difference! My last visit to Swindon was shall we say, ‚Äòbelow expectations‚Äô; I really struggled to believe this was the same place.

On arrival the entrance was clean, clear and has obviously been attended to with the usual rubbish and debris cleared away. The security hut has had a complete refurb which was much needed. As a driver attending any truck stop if your first line of sight is dirt, rubbish and dilapidated buildings it immediately raises alarm bells as to what sort of site you‚Äôre visiting.  Signage to parking was clear and concise, and there was ample space available.  Traffic flow was moderate and free.

First engagement was the canteen, by which entry was via a newly developed entrance.  Stunning.  New groundwork‚Äôs was colourful and very pleasing to the eye.  There were new picnic tables positioned outside - and were being used.  New plants were positioned, giving the homely welcome.  A huge effort has been made to greet customers to this area and the transformation from the old side entrance is worlds apart.  There are new big screens displaying menus, new information points, leaflets, all safety measures present, serviceable, in date and correctly placed where applicable.

I met ‚ÄòClaire‚Äô behind the counter, who was welcoming, bright and bubbly and just what you need to lift your spirits from the drama and stress of the highways. Also in attendance were approximately 4 other staff and the whole food counter experience was top class.  A very nice touch was a bowl of free healthy fruit for visitors. Well done there.  Food service was very quick - top marks.

The canteen was spotless. There were plenty of customers throughout the day (I was there for a 24hr stop) and I watched with interest the positive energy this team had going on. Everyone was greeted with a welcome and a smile.  No name badges though, I‚Äôd like to have seen that - it‚Äôs a more personal presentation to thank someone and show appreciation by referring to them by name. It‚Äôs also awkward to have to ask, maybe this should be considered. On the opposite side of the coin it equally encourages staff to deliver excellence as it‚Äôs much easier to identify individual failings. Certainly not the case here today however.

No sooner had a diner finished a staff member was instantly on hand to clean and disinfect and prepare the space for the next customer.  There was also excellent promotion and encouragement by the staff to download and use the Onroute app.

Feedback: drivers are still struggling to find the SNAP terminals to pay for parking and are constantly having to queue and ask at the counter, disrupting staff from the catering flow.  The terminals hidden away in the toilet corridor and are not signed. A staff member had put a handwritten sign on the access door to highlight the location but was told by management to take it down. This was a poor decision and negatively impacted good staff initiative.  It may not have been ideal or as professional as a custom branded sign, but it was better than nothing!  There is still no clear signage to the SNAP payment terminals and needs addressed for full score achievement.

The shop was well stocked and inviting. It‚Äôs bright and has most of the essentials needed for drivers. As soon as I approached the shop a member of staff was there to assist if needed. I made several purchases and the whole experience again was very good.

The toilet corridor from the canteen leads to access snap terminals, ladies, gents and disabled toilets, and showers.  It was clean, fresh, clear of debris; and both snap terminals were fully functional. All fire safety measures were present, in date and clearly identified.  Health & Safety measures were also in place and being used effectively.

Unfortunately I can‚Äôt give any further details as I‚Äôve run out of characters! Happy to be contacted if necessary. Staff deserve special credit for a near perfect experience. Well done. Very well done.
showerReviews.author: Casper Roe-Lavery

showerReviews.reviewText: It's been upgraded. Tepid soup was the order of the day and it just about made it out of the "cold " bracket. It's now a very small space in which the drivers eat compared to previously. Showers and toilets get the thumbs up though. I've eaten better food for less money. Next time I'll go to Sainsbury's next door and just buy something from there, it will be tastier than what I had. Do something about that soup, it's really bad, it was the vegetable soup and it was like someone just decided it would be best to use the old vegetables up by making a soup. The chef can't be happy, or doesn't have a tasting spoon. A dreary 1 star. Overall the old place was better for space. It feels cramped with 10 people in there
showerReviews.author: Mick Ward

showerReviews.reviewText:
üëç The Good
Secure parking ‚Äì that‚Äôs a big win, especially with today‚Äôs load theft
Well-marked bays ‚Äì no guesswork, no getting blocked in
Decent layout ‚Äì you can actually park without playing Tetris with a 44-tonner
On paper, it ticks the boxes.
üëé The Bad (the stuff that actually matters at 2am)
2 toilets for 100+ spaces
That‚Äôs not a truckstop ‚Äî that‚Äôs a queue simulator.
Cubicle size designed for jockeys
If you‚Äôre built like a proper driver and not a racing whippet, you‚Äôre fighting for elbow room just to sit down.
Only 2 showers
Again‚Ä¶ for 100 trucks ü§¶‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è
Token-only showers
And here‚Äôs the killer:
How do you buy a token when nobody‚Äôs around?
Answer: you don‚Äôt.
So you‚Äôre:
tired
parked up legally
doing the right thing
and still can‚Äôt wash or take a dump in peace
That‚Äôs when a place officially fails as a driver facility.

showerReviews.reviewText: Overpriced but by time you look for the next petrol pump near this area, you'll be wasting the same fuel that you've saved. locations.title: Hostelle London
locations.address: ÓÉà458 Bethnal Grn Rd, London E2 0EA, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: Recently booked a last minute night in London. Hostelle was not only very affordable but women's only! I saw a few mixed reviews, but honestly thought it was in my top hostel experiences! It's certainly not a new and flashy hostel, but a comfortable, well thought out and safe space for women to stay. The 14-bed dorm I stayed in was not very spacious but I had a curtain and the bunk bed was sturdy and didn't rock about. The showers and toilets were clean. Both receptionists I came across were really relaxed and friendly. As for location in London, it's a little way out. But it's very close to Bethnel Green tube station (2-min walk) and there are a couple of very cool beer and wine spots within 5-minute walking distance. Overall just feels very comfortable being around women who are there for the same reasons as you. Will defo be back! Many thanks.
showerReviews.author: Ash

showerReviews.reviewText:
Very disappointing stay

I booked Hostelle in London and unfortunately had a terrible experience. The hostel was dirty, and both receptionists I interacted with were unhelpful and surprisingly indifferent. Not the supportive, welcoming atmosphere you would expect from a women-only hostel. When I arrived early on Friday morning, the receptionist stayed on her phone, offered no guidance, and barely acknowledged me.

When I got to the room, there was no heating, and later, when I went to shower, the water was ice-cold. The bathroom was freezing, making the whole experience extremely uncomfortable.

For a place that advertises safety, comfort, and understanding for women, this hostel fell far short. I cannot recommend Hostelle. Even basic cleanliness, warmth, and respectful staff interaction were lacking. After staying there for 2 hours, I ended up booking another place that was way better than Hostelle.

You can see in the pictures: 1)  There was a dirty Kleenex left on the floor right next to my bed ‚Äî completely unacceptable. 2) There was what looked like hair and even an old pistachio on the floor right next to my bed ‚Äî completely unacceptable.
showerReviews.author: Michelle Marinho

showerReviews.reviewText: Had a great stay here. Room was spacious enough for three people. The building is right next to the Overground station, but the windows point the opposite way, so it is not a problem. There are several cafes (with free wifi) on the ground floor. We could leave our luggage for free at reception outside check-in hours. Room: spacious (for London), clean, good towels and bed linen, USB charger slots, electrical tea can and cups in-room, dark blinders, large TV. All in all great value for the money. Highly recommend!

showerReviews.reviewText:
I strongly advise against spending your money on this establishment. The premises were in an unacceptable condition, with pervasive unpleasant odours and an overall lack of hygiene that was both disturbing and unsanitary. The room provided was unreasonably small for a family, and to make matters worse, it was infested with bed bugs.

As a result, I was unable to sleep and subsequently developed an infection in my leg, which rendered me unable to walk the following day. This experience was wholly unacceptable and poses serious concerns regarding health and safety standards.

In my considered opinion, this hotel falls far below any reasonable standard of accommodation, and I would strongly recommend avoiding it altogether.

locations.title: Wombat's City Hostel London
locations.address: ÓÉà7 Dock St, London E1 8LL, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: Probably the best hostel in all of London! The location is great, just a 10 minute walk from Tower Bridge and Tower of London, which is also a Circle and District line station, making travel around the city very easy. Check in was simple, and the rooms have pretty comfy bunk beds with assigned lockers to store your things. Everything was clean and tidy, and the staff were very kind should you want to replace your towels or linens or anything. The shower is notably wonderful -- great pressure and temperature. We were lucky enough to get a room with a view out onto this gorgeous church next door! There's fans in each bunk if you're too hot, and radiators if you're too cold. The bar downstairs only opens at 6, but it's a great spot to hang out with lots of mat-covered benches, a pool table, and an L-shaped bar in this cool arched brick space, staffed by super cool and friendly people (shoutout to Cassie here!) and full of friendly fellow patrons who are happy to chat to anyone in the vicinity. Laundry was somewhat expensive at 5 pounds a load for washing, but they provide detergent which was a godsend, and let's be honest, this is London. The cafe near reception has great coffee, and a variety of pastries, as well as a nice little sit-down, bookshelf-laden area to enjoy them. I'd recommend them any day, and will likely be booking back in again in the near future! Thanks so much Wombat!
showerReviews.author: Madison Riley

showerReviews.reviewText:
This might be one of the nicest and most affordable hostels I've ever stayed in. All the staff were lovely. The rooms were nice and clean. The curtains and lockers on the bunk beds were fantastic. As a single woman traveling alone, it felt very comfortable and safe. The hostel has a bar, a guest kitchen, a garden, a laundry room, and a caf√©. The bar area, in particular, is very spacious and has an event almost every evening. The bar prices aren't expensive. The hostel's location is also excellent, about a 5-6 minute walk from Tower Hill station. The Circle and District lines run from there, making it very convenient. I think it's about the same distance from Aldgate East station, which also has Hammersmith & City and the Overground. It's very close to Tower Bridge, so I bought breakfast every morning and ate it by the bridge.

However, the sink being right next to the shower is a bit of a problem. You can‚Äôt wash your hands while someone else is showering. I think this problem would be eliminated if the shower cabin was made of an opaque material rather than glass and had a door.
showerReviews.author: Beril Comments

Unfortunately, I canceled my reservation at a more centrally located hotel in favor of this one because of its good facilities and large room. As you can see from the photos, the room doesn't match the picture at all. Furthermore, the hygiene is appalling; it was filthy everywhere.

The room is nothing like the rooms advertised in the photos. I feel cheated. Dirt everywhere.

I was kept outside for over half an hour because they kept asking for a reservation code, which wasn't correct. No one came to help me. The free coffee and tea were nonexistent. The facilities are old, poorly maintained, and unhygienic. HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE

locations.title: Dover Castle Hostel
locations.address: ÓÉà6A Great Dover St, London SE1 4XW, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
It was a positive experience. The showers and bathroom were clean and well-maintained. There is no secure place inside the room for luggage; however, they offer storage options, such as a free room near the front desk where you can leave your luggage, or you can rent lockers for ¬£1 per day. I used the free room and had no problems.

There‚Äôs a kitchen with appliances and cutlery available. It's worth noting that there is no elevator (this didn‚Äôt matter to me, as I was only carrying a backpack). There was no outlet by my bed, which was unfortunate, but some beds did have outlets‚ÄîI was just unlucky.

Recommended for a cheap short stay in London. The location is very convenient

showerReviews.reviewText:
I stayed here with 2 friends,  we took 3 of the 4 rooms available, we wanted to be in a quiet area close to Dalston/Islington and I must say I was delighted with the accommodation, we all were.
The place is modern, light and airy, our 3 bedrooms were on the ground floor, my room was at the back of the building and was very quiet, opened out into a little courtyard garden, the bed was really comfortable, the pillows were excellent which is often not the case with a lot of rentals...everything was provided, the bathroom had good quality toiletries...excellent shower...upstairs is a large spacious communal dining/seating area with a couple of sofas and large dining table, and a kitchen where you can help yourself to teas, coffee, snacks and breakfast.
James the owner popped in to check that we were ok...the place has a lovely relaxed atmosphere, I would definitely recommend it...and would happily revisit

locations.title: Everyone Active
locations.address: ÓÉà223 Vauxhall Bridge Rd, Pimlico, London SW1V 1EL, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Good reasons
I'm happy with the price, staff and equipment. I like the gym lockers though a few are a bit stiff and the shower temperature is always good and controllable.

However the sauna has not been fixed for long enough that the ink on the sign is discolouring.

The showers don't have any sort of lock function just a door (doesn't especially bother me but it's certainly disconcerting when midway through someone pushes it semi open. One of the shower doors didn't exist.

Overall 4 star because it does what I need it to - be a gym and swimming pool. The app is pretty good (much better than the website) and the staff were all nice to me. I use the showers every time excluding that one occasion no one else has pushed on the door while I was using it and I continue to use them.

Overall 4 star because it does what I need it to - be a gym and swimming pool. The app is pretty good (much better than the website) and the staff were all nice to me. I use the showers every time excluding that one occasion no one else has pushed on the door while I was using it and I continue to use them.
showerReviews.author: surver

showerReviews.reviewText:
I‚Äôve been a member here since April 2023, and honestly, the experience has gone downhill fast.

1.	Locker room chaos ‚Äì On a Wednesday at 6:30 p.m., there were four of us wandering around with no available lockers. The place was so overcrowded that I literally had to leave because there was nowhere to store my belongings. Even worse, about 30 people were crammed into the changing area and showers ‚Äì completely unacceptable for such an expensive gym.

2.	Permanent ‚Äúprivate‚Äù lockers ‚Äì On a Saturday morning at opening time (9 a.m.), I was the very first person in the locker room, yet around 30% of lockers were already locked. Clearly, some members are allowed to use lockers permanently, leaving everyone else scrambling. That‚Äôs poor management and unfair to paying customers.

3.	Price hikes with no improvements ‚Äì Since joining in April 2023, my membership price has gone up by 12%. At the same time, the gym keeps pushing for new sign-ups, making it more overcrowded every month. Higher prices, more members, worse experience.

For a premium-priced gym, this is completely disappointing. Overcrowded facilities, zero locker availability, long waits for machines, and unfair locker practices. I do not recommend this gym.
showerReviews.author: Simon Ch√©n√©

showerReviews.reviewText:
The Victoria branch of the gym has added a lot more equipment recently, but the machines are crammed far too close together. Strangely, there are still patches of wasted space, such as the old bike area, which makes the layout feel poorly planned. The new setup places cardio equipment right next to weightlifting, so you often end up working out face to face with loud grunting and clanging. The weight area in particular feels very male-oriented and dominated by people more interested in their self-image than training.

Many visitors seem to be there to film content rather than exercise. The space itself is dark and designed to mimic a nightclub, with loud and intrusive music even though most people wear headphones. The whole "coolest interiors and biggest beats in London" branding might appeal to teenagers, but for anyone seeking a serious training environment, it quickly wears thin. The very young crowd the gym attracts often comes across as unfriendly and self-absorbed.

At peak times, it is overcrowded and unpleasant, though during the day it is more manageable. The sauna is a plus, and the showers are fine, but the musty smell of dried sweat lingers throughout the space.

Overall, despite some potential, the poor layout, superficial atmosphere, and unfriendly clientele make this gym difficult to recommend and I cancelled my membership because I didn't find it good value.
showerReviews.author: Wendy Bav

There are always lots of space in the changing rooms, lockers and the gym because I think the location is also quite hidden.

locations.title: Turner Swim - Adult Swim Lessons London
locations.address: ÓÉàMarriott County Hall Hotel, Westminster Bridge Rd, London SE1 7PB, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Alice is a phenomenal coach. I always disliked being in water and could not go beyond moving for 5 meters or so in a frantic puppy style. But I decided to challenge myself and overcome my fear. Alice has been a major help in achieving this and helped me get to the point that I thought could never reach. Now I can confidently swim 35 meters or so with front crawl, on back, and head-up breaststroke. Not only Alice is knowledgeable and highly skilled as a teacher, but also very perceptive and flexible, making each session meaningful and rewarding.  It is such a joy to work with her, I genuinely look forward to each session.  As a teacher myself, I truly know Alice is an outstanding and excellent coach, and I really can‚Äôt recommend her enough to anyone who wants to become a confident swimmer.  I decided to keep working with Alice and go for the breaststroke course, which I am very much looking forward to.

Regarding their teaching approach: I finished the learn-to-swim course, which is impressively methodical and effective.  I didn‚Äôt know anything about swimming, so initially, I wasn‚Äôt sure what I was getting into, but I decided to trust the system. And for me, it worked like magic. What‚Äôs amazing about the course is that they compartmentalise essential elements in swimming and make you master them one by one. What this means is that I am now able to detect what‚Äôs wrong with my swimming when something isn‚Äôt working, and to correct myself.   I am now training on my own to extend the distance on front/back, and I actually get to be flexible and I‚Äôm able to effectively tweak different elements to make them suit my body/condition. This is because I understand the fundamentals, thanks to the course.  I very clearly see and feel the effect of their teaching method, and I am truly impressed.

Mariko
showerReviews.author: putitalain

showerReviews.reviewText:
Taking swimming lessons with Jazz has been an incredible experience. Jazz is not only a highly skilled instructor but also an exceptionally patient and encouraging teacher. Her ability to connect on a personal level made each lesson enjoyable and confidence-building.

Progress came quickly thanks to her clear instructions and genuine enthusiasm.

Her professionalism and warmth created a supportive environment that made every session something to look forward to. She consistently went above and beyond‚Äîcelebrating milestones, offering helpful feedback, and pushing me to keep improving.

I wholeheartedly recommend Jazz to anyone looking to learn how to swim or improve their skills‚Äîespecially those who may feel nervous or uncertain. An easy 5 stars!
showerReviews.author: alex redfern

showerReviews.reviewText:
I've been having regular lessons from Lindsay for three months now, and the swimming lessons are really excellent. Lindsay has a wealth of technical knowledge and swimming experience that really shows.  She also is a great coach,  technique is taught clearly and she adapts what to focus on in each lesson based on my individual ability and current progress - this helps make the learning process more effective and learning technique more digestible.  Lindsay has a patient and energetic coaching style, and I'm seeing great progress against my own swim goals - thank you!

I'm fairly new to the triathlon world, and prior to starting with Turner Swim, I've previously really struggled with swimming, and nearly gave up triathlons as a result.   However, I decided to get lessons with Turner Swim - I'm so pleased I did!  I'm more confident, and my swimming progress has been greater than I personally expected so I'm really pleased!

showerReviews.reviewText:
I completed the Learn to Swim program with Leanne at Marriott County Hall. I highly recommend the program and my instructor.

I have previously attended group swimming lessons elsewhere but was still was unable to swim after it. I decided to give swimming lessons another go, but this time on a private ONE-ON-ONE basis with Turner Swim. I am very happy to say that I can swim now (freestyle & backstroke) with good technique. I am ecstatic with my results!

Leanne is an excellent teacher. She provided lots of constructive feedback during our sessions. She carefully observed my swim and suggested tweaks that made a world of difference to my technique. This was the key element that was missing from my previous group lessons - the teacher's undivided attention to my performance. I also felt like Leanne genuinely wanted me to succeed and was keen to see my progress. I left each session motivated and excited for the next one.

Overall, I am very happy with the Learn to Swim program. I know it's a lot of money, but it was an investment for a skill that I can use for the rest of my life. The results and the quality of teaching I received was worth it!
showerReviews.author: Jam Creencia

showerReviews.reviewText:
I just completed the front crawl course with Thomas at Turner Swim and signed up for the Improver course. Thomas is very professional, he gives very good recommendations to improve swimming techniques. He has the wonderful ability to encourage one to raise the bar. He combines his ability with patience and warmth.

Their online booking system is very easy to use, you could also choose a package of 5 or 10 hours (or off peak) for a friendly price. All the coaches are professionally trained and their methods are very effective. The pools that the company partner with are all very nice and easy to travel to (I've been to two different ones in central London, both with good facilities)

I highly recommend Thomas and Turner Swim to swimmers at all levels.

Prices increased and swimming pool, changing rooms etc are not ready yet. Management does no longer reply to email. Classes are always full for people that work full time jobs. Locked in a year contract where value does not meet offering. I recommend you are given written down specifics on facilities termination before signing up.

showerReviews.reviewText:
** Jan '25 update:  unfortunately the recent hike in prices has left many members feeling like they're being robbed.  My monthly rolling membership will increase from ¬£51 to ¬£69 as of Feb '25, a 35% increase.  Given the service has actually worsened, there are no changing rooms, the toilet is external to the facility, the pool/sauna/steam room/tennis courts are still not ready despite the refurbishment having started in 2021, the increase is unacceptable & many long-standing members have decided to leave the club for other better options nearby.  I'm considering leaving also, despite the fact that I've been coming to DSQ for about 6 years **

I've been coming to DSQ fitness club for a few years.

Before the ongoing refurb started, I really loved coming to the Yoga classes (especially Leticia's Yin Yoga ones), to the swimming pool/sauna/steam room, and to the gym for PT sessions.  I used to buy the guest passes in bulk, as the membership wasn't convenient for me. I also used to often use the Hammam Spa, which was just an amazing place to really decompress.

Since the refurb started, I've now started being a member & I mainly come for Yoga (Leticia, Federica, Sahara, Antonia), Pilates (Violetta), PT sessions (Karen). I also sometimes do Yogalates (Angee), when schedule allows.  Sal, the manager, is cool & normally on top of things.

I really like the instructors - so I will keep coming.

The new booking system is pretty glitchy, and comms re the refurb are non-existent.  Defo something that could be improved.  It would be such an improvement also if the lights in the Yoga studios could be changed to enable them to be dimmed.

I can't wait for the pool, steam room and sauna to be open again.

I'm aware that the Hammam Spa won't re-open, which is a real shame - it was a gem of a place, with a lovely team.  I've spent far too much money there!!

All in all, pretty happy customer.
showerReviews.author: DG

showerReviews.reviewText:
Absolutely love this place. Staff are extremely friendly, they've been helpful ever since I joined two years ago, and when I re-joined earlier this year.
The facilities are of great quality and varied: gym, swimming pool, sauna, steam room, tennis courts, squash courts, etc... The gym isn't the biggest ever but if you know when to go it won't be an issue. The pool is clean and the temperature is just right, and the club offer free towels upon every visit. I go there regularly and it's definitely worth every penny!.
showerReviews.author: Florian Aucomte

showerReviews.reviewText:
I would have given them a -5 star if there's that option.
First of all, the gym receptionists are rude, arrogant and patronizing. The gym facilities are fairly outdated, lockers jam on their own on a daily basis, and I'm pretty sure everyone that go there knows about this. So, I have to go to the reception and get help, instead of being helpful. All I got was attitude filled responses like, 'Do you even know how to use the lockers? *with an eye roll*'. The changing room is fairly dirty, towel every, damp and 8 out of 10 showers have some sort broken parts (broken locks, broke shower head, flies infested) that's been unfixed for months. The gym membership claims that there's free towel service and it has been fine for months since I joined. However, today I got told by a receptionist that I will have to pay an extra fee for using more than two of the towels that they provide on the reception desk. OUT OF NOWHERE! It was not written on the terms and conditions, nor specified by the staff when they handed me the contract to sign for the gym membership. So it feels like it's just some made up rules that they're using to patronize me while I AM THE PAYING CUSTOMER!
So overall, I highly would not recommend this place to anyone who's looking into joining. Since you won't be getting the customer service nor gym experience that you should expect for the price of the membership.
showerReviews.author: Z Z

What I love mostly though, is the atmosphere. There‚Äôs a real sense of community here that you just don‚Äôt find everywhere. Whether you‚Äôre working out, swimming, or simply grabbing a coffee, there‚Äôs this uplifting energy that makes you feel part of something special. I‚Äôd wholeheartedly recommend this club to anyone looking for a place that combines excellent facilities with a warm, welcoming environment. It truly feels like a second home. üòÖ

locations.title: JD Gyms Coventry
locations.address: ÓÉàBelgrade Plaza, Upper Well St, Coventry CV1 4AJ, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
It's a shame with how lovely the staff is, but the quality overall seems lacking.

Some improvements since the last review, but it seems like they forgot to put any money into actually improving/fixing machines.

I don't know if the owner willingly ignores the quality issues with machines, or for some other reason pays no attention and just doesn't allocate money or resources.

The bench press assistance arms are still broken on some, the benches themselves move more than they should and are not stable.

Both of these wouldn't really be issues at low weights, but when you you're nearing and going past 100, stability starts to become a bit more important.

I suppose they're just waiting for someone to injure themselves so they can go "whoops", knowing nobody will challenge them on it.

Leg press backrest is loose. Foam on the quad extension roller is almost fully worn. Few quid to fix it? Nah, not with how busy they are. It's so bad you either need to be willing to hurt yourself on it at higher weights, or use shin pads.

I'm sure there's more issues around, just haven't bothered to look so closely.

Rules are hit and miss. Go topless in the middle of the gym while crowded? Sure. Not frequent but still happens.

No real enforcement if at all with putting weights back, or on clothing. No bike signs downstairs are more suggestions.

Even the small puregym near the Transport Museum had it in it's budget to place a cleaning station or two with paper towels around, but this was too much for JD with its higher prices and much larger footfall. Got to clean up the sweat and grime of everyone and their mother with your own things.
showerReviews.author: Codrin Gherman

showerReviews.reviewText:
I usually like JD Gyms, but this branch is really disappointing. There‚Äôs a clear lack of gym etiquette among many users. People regularly leave weights lying around instead of putting them back‚Äîexpecting someone new or less strong to unload multiple 25‚ÄØkg plates from a barbell or leg press is unreasonable.

Dumbbells are often left scattered on the floor near benches, creating obvious trip hazards. If someone were to fall or injure themselves because of this, it could easily lead to legal action. Safety should be taken seriously. If someone is strong enough to lift the weights to use them, there‚Äôs no excuse for not racking them properly afterward.

I also can‚Äôt stand how some people have no respect for personal space or hygiene‚Äîincluding groups of students and Uber drivers who seem more interested in staring at women than actually training.

I understand people need to rest between sets, but it‚Äôs frustrating when they take 10 minutes just staring at their phones or having long conversations, with no regard for others waiting to use the machine.

On top of that, some of the equipment is badly in need of maintenance or replacement. For example, one of the calf raise machines feels like the bearings are shot, and the loading pole on the leg press is so angled it looks like the plates could fall off at any moment.

Overall, the entire branch feels neglected and seems to be relying solely on the JD Gyms name to keep attracting members. With so little competition in the area, it feels like there‚Äôs no incentive for management to address these issues.
showerReviews.author: Latif Ad Din

showerReviews.reviewText:
Nice gym, plenty of cardio equipment. The free weights area is now better after the refurbishment.
I try to avoid the times between 4PM-8PM as that's most busy and you may struggle to find a bench, barbell, dumbell or plates. Also some members just hog the equipment when it can be shared between sets.
Plenty of lockers available but just 2 urinals and 2 toilets.
I suggest management should invest in more frequent cleaning and maybe some sort of air freshener equipment around the locker room and the main entrance.

I suggest management should invest in more frequent cleaning and maybe some sort of air freshener equipment around the locker room and the main entrance.

locations.title: Getters Fitness
locations.address: ÓÉà91 Westminster Bridge Rd, London SE1 7HW, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
I recently had the pleasure of experiencing the exceptional personal training services offered at Getters Fitness, located conveniently in the heart of the city. From the moment I stepped in, I was greeted by a warm and welcoming staff who were always eager to assist. My training sessions with Sam have been nothing short of remarkable. His expertise in health and fitness is truly impressive, and I've seen significant improvements under his guidance.

Finding a personal trainer who not only possesses extensive knowledge but also operates within a boutique, purpose-built training space in London can be a challenge. However, I can confidently say that my search has ended with Getters Fitness. I wholeheartedly recommend this establishment to anyone seeking to elevate their health and fitness journey.

Furthermore, as a busy professional with a constantly shifting schedule, I appreciate the flexibility and dedication of the team at Getters Fitness. They consistently go above and beyond to accommodate my busy lifestyle, making it easier for me to prioritise my fitness goals amidst a hectic routine.

In addition, the facility offers clean, spacious changing rooms equipped with bathrooms, allowing you to freshen up and shower after your workout. This convenience ensures that you can seamlessly transition back into your day, knowing you've completed a productive session with a knowledgeable trainer.

Undoubtedly, if you're looking to transform your health and enhance your fitness while navigating a busy schedule, Getters Fitness is the ideal choice. Trust me, you won't be disappointed.
showerReviews.author: Nick Ncube

locations.title: Energie Fitness Gym, Acton
locations.address: ÓÉàUnit A & B, Joyce Court, Bollo Bridge Rd, London W3 8DR, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
The gym itself is okay, but overpriced for what it offers.
While you‚Äôll be able to train, the variety of machines is limited, and the stretching area is quite small.

1. Poor Air Conditioning in Summer
During the summer, the gym gets very hot. The AC isn't powerful enough to cool the space, making training uncomfortable and discouraging on warm days. The showers also turn into a sauna, which makes cooling down after a workout even worse.

2. Often Unattended
One of the worst aspects is that the gym is frequently left without staff. I often see people waiting or calling from outside with no one available to let them in or answer.

3. Gympass Users: Not Worth It
If you use Gympass, this gym is not a good choice. Since there‚Äôs often no staff present, there's no one to check you in, meaning you might not even be able to enter.

4. Slow Repairs, No Alternatives
When machines break down, they take a long time to be fixed. And because the gym is small and lacks variety, it's hard to find alternative exercises when something is out of order.

5. Issues with Multigym Memberships
If you come from another location, they might not have your details in their system. With no staff, you won‚Äôt get in, even if you‚Äôve paid. If staff are present, they‚Äôre often unsure why and may call your home gym or just send you back, but even your home gym may not know how to fix it.

üìå Update after owner response:
I do come to this gym regularly. Some of the issues I mentioned earlier are still ongoing, including the gym being unattended and machines remaining broken for over a week.
(Photos attached as reference.)
showerReviews.author: SET

locations.title: ENERGYM | LONDON WEST EALING
locations.address: ÓÉà104 The Broadway, London W13 0SY, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
ENERGYM in West Ealing is hands down one of the best gyms I‚Äôve trained at. From the moment you walk in, you can tell that this gym is run with professionalism, care, and genuine passion for helping people improve their fitness and confidence.

The equipment is top-tier and extremely well maintained. Everything you need is available, from free weights and resistance machines to cardio equipment, all laid out in a way that makes training smooth and efficient. The gym never feels cluttered, and there‚Äôs always enough space to train properly without feeling rushed or overcrowded.

Hygiene and cleanliness are clearly a top priority at ENERGYM. The gym is spotless at all times, equipment is regularly cleaned, and the changing areas are always tidy and fresh. This really adds to the overall comfort and safety of the training environment.

What truly sets ENERGYM apart, however, is the coaching ‚Äî especially Sofia. Sofia is an exceptional teacher and coach. She is incredibly knowledgeable, supportive, and attentive to every individual, regardless of fitness level. Her communication is clear, motivating, and encouraging, making each session both productive and enjoyable. She takes the time to correct form, explain exercises properly, and adapt workouts to suit your goals and abilities.

Sofia creates a positive and welcoming atmosphere where everyone feels comfortable and motivated to push themselves. You never feel judged ‚Äî only supported. Her passion for fitness and genuine care for her students really shines through in every session.

Overall, ENERGYM is more than just a gym ‚Äî it‚Äôs a community. If you‚Äôre looking for a clean, well-equipped gym with outstanding coaching and a motivating environment, I couldn‚Äôt recommend ENERGYM in West Ealing highly enough.
showerReviews.author: Ash Salavati

locations.title: √©nergie Fitness Brentford - USE CODE "HALFPRICE" GET 50% OFF YOUR FIRST TWO MONTHS AND SAVE ON YOUR JOINING FEE
locations.address: ÓÉàGround Floor, Westgate House, Building 2, Greatwest Quarter,, Ealing Rd, Brentford TW8 0GN, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
I've been a member at this gym for almost 3 years now.

Pros: gym is the only decent option within 15 mins of walking from my place, and most of the staff is quite good (as far as i could see) as PTs and very frendly as well.

Cons: for the membership fee the gym is lacking some features like pipes that don't leak for 2 weeks (resulting in buckets all over the place, especially the past weeks (May, 2024)), missing TVs here and there, no refreshments, only 4 (maybe 5?) 10kg plates, not enough bars to accommodate even medium customer loads on semi-busy afternoons. Usually there are also at least 5 broken or bent lockers and locker lock levers at a time - one of them even ruined the bend of my lock when i tried to close it.

So overall not the best, but at least the staff is good.
showerReviews.author: Viktor Schmuck

showerReviews.reviewText:
Had a great wee at the Heaton West Services. It went straight into the urinal where a yellow silicone guard prevented unwanted splashback.
My daughter thought the toilet paper was way too thin and did not enjoy the freezing hand dryers or the unsatisfying texture of the liquid soap. But she did enjoy the Costa coffee stop because of the pleasant seating arrangement and the differing furniture choices. My son found the taps in the men's washroom unresponsive and was frustrated.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Disgusting. I'm so appalled
(Hgv driver overnight)
There is plenty of hgv parking as it seems to be a quieter service stop and I now see why.
Snap account parking is available.

There was a terrible odour when in the lorry park I don't know of what. The place looks run down broken front door, dirty and the showers are something of a SERIOUS HEALTH HAZARD which I will be reporting to environmental health. I will never stay at these services again, full of rust and mould I did not want to inhale in those showers. I actually ended up using the sink instead, it made me feel sick and at risk. The step is rotten and a trip hazard as you can't step on it and have to hop over it. There are ONLY 2 SHOWER CUBICLES so it's not exactly hard to maintain some sort of cleaning standard because it's clear to see these showers have been abandoned for a WHILE. They are very big cubicles with just a small shower and sink I think space could of been utilised better with additional showers but not if they end up the way these are left to rot.
Beside the shower, there was a foul smell in the toilets (not just a public toilet smell) it just seems so unkept. Would rate 0 stars if I could.
showerReviews.author: J4y J

They use snap and you can pre book. There is a nice walk along the sea front and other restaurants located 15 minutes walk away if you‚Äôre not fancying what‚Äôs on offer.

Someone is available to park you and there seems to be a lot of space or at least has been every time I‚Äôve arrived.

Security is 24/7 and I‚Äôve never had any issues parking here.

One thing I would mention is there is pot holes driving in but nothing that my truck couldn‚Äôt handle‚Ä¶ just go slow.

Cheers and see you lot again when I‚Äôm in the area!

Adam @ Meachers in BKV ‚ò∫Ô∏è

showerReviews.reviewText: Stopped here last night, read the reviews and they looked decent, I wouldn't stop here again if someone paid me it was horrendous, asked about a menu but they don't have 1 so asked the lady behind counter what food they do, couldn't understand what she was saying so agreed to something which come out looking like something people in prison would get. Then had a shower which literally is a little room with 4/5 showers with just curtains which wasn't too bad until someone opened mine whilst I was washing my hair so that poor soul had to see my big white arse. There was 4 foreign blokes still sat outside the cafe area drinking and being loud at 12.30am which isn't any good when your up at 4... all in all I would rather stop on the gaza strip next time.

locations.title: Astor Victoria Hostel
locations.address: ÓÉàVictoria Hotel, 73 Belgrave Rd, Pimlico, London SW1V 2BG, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
So you stay here for the location. Breakfast was not expensive but you got the bare minimum. I passed.

The dorm I stayed in was cramped, not very clean and the shower was pretty dirty and tiny, tiny. There was just one power bar to be shared by 8 people - not enough!

Still don't understand why some hostels don't have privacy curtains. I had to use a towel to create some.

The lounge area was not very big and also not overly clean.  The rate was not unreasonable but they could definitely work on cleanliness.

Staff was helpful and accommodated my need for a lower bunk and lower floor due to mobility issues, so I greatly appreciated that effort.

Didn't take any photos as it was not that memorable.  Once again, the location is the reason to stay here.

I feel London hostels do the bare minimum because they have so much demand. It's a shame.
showerReviews.author: Margarita Ibbott (DownshiftingPRO)

showerReviews.reviewText: In general, it's a good hostel. Located in the Westminster area, nearby the Pimlico station, 20min walking from the Big Ben and the Buckingham Palace. It's worth it. The bed was a little small and thin so I didn't sleep very well, but it was clean ! There was a locker for our luggage. The kitchen is big and we have enough space to cook and put our stuff. The shower and bathroom was good, not a lot of pressure for the shower, but it's not a big deal! Worth it for a zone 1 hostel !! The staff was really nice and the hostel is secured. For a weekend I recommend

showerReviews.reviewText:
My journey started with changing my reservation dates as I needed changes for my flight. The stuff helped me to rebook the dates. Awesome help.

Now I am staying here, clean kitchen, toilets and bathroom. Toilet sink is super smol in size so difficult to wash face and brush teeth but still, the toilet paper, soap, room spray etc are provided and helps to have nice resting area after indian foods lol. You need to wash your dishes in the kitchen. You can also cook for yourself and store your food in fridges! Tea and coffee is available until kitchen closes.

Theres no AC but fans everywhere! You will feel chill with these.

Luggage room is also very practical and its great they have CCTV.

I paid for mixed room but all were men so I asked for a women room since I wouldn't like to be only woman in a mixed room. They helped me to switch my room! Beda are comfortable. The bedsheets are super clean and nicely ironed. Under beds there are locking cage area and this is the best to fit your belongings. Its always good to being your own lock yet they still can help you with this.

Reception seems not very good tho. Still you may access wifi by only registering your email address.

15 mins to Victoria Station. Easy to walk around for historical and cultural places.

Thank you!
showerReviews.author: ayg√ºl zoroƒülu

showerReviews.reviewText: The booking experience online was problematic with Travelodge charging my card but not providing the booking.  Now I have to chase the refund!  Then when I turned up at reception the receptionist could not make a booking so I needed to call the call centre to book the room (which they charged a fee for !!!).  Then once I had a booking for a higher price than I originally booked I ended up with a family room (multiple folding beds with no space between beds) that was very smelly and not cleaned well (pubic hair on the toilet seat and in the bowl and mould on the shower tiles).  Then in the morning in the light of the day I saw the curtains YUK! (see picture).  Overall I will now stick with staying with the Premier Inn which are consistent and clean!!!

locations.title: Walton on Thames Camping and Caravanning Club Site
locations.address: ÓÉàFieldcommon Ln, West Molesey, Molesey, Walton-on-Thames KT12 3QG, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
amazing camping area for visiting london. there are plenty of spots. no toilets or showers, so bring a camper which has those in it. there is fresh water and an area to get rid of waste water, as well as a place to clean your chemical toilet. nice view onto a small river and sometimes cows on the other side of the river. train station is around 15 minutes from the camping.
all in all an amazing camping area, would visit again.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Had a lovely couple of days stay. It was quite and peaceful, but it is still early in the year. There are plenty of pitches and many with EHU. The staff were friendly and helpful.
No showers and toilets are on site so own facilities vital. One chemical waste disposal so would be busy in the height of season.
There is a small play area with a slide and swing.
Just outside of the campsite there is a footpath to Molesley Heath Nature Reserve, a lovely walk.
showerReviews.author: Barbara Wade

showerReviews.reviewText: A little oasis in an unlikely place. Very much a base to visit London if you want to camp or caravan. No toilet blocks or showers so bring your own amenities. Electric and hard standing available but nice grass pitches also available. Quite isolated so ideally you need transportation like bicycles etc. Hersham station about 40 minutes walk which gets you onto London‚Äôs transport network. Perfect as a base for historic Hampton Court, Wimbledon, Walton-on-Thames, Sandown Racecourse and London.
showerReviews.author: David Lee Williams

showerReviews.reviewText:
One of the finest sites in the system.
There are hook-ups, water and waste points but no loo or shower.  Never has been.
Obey arrival time due to long, narrow final approach after Field Common Lane.
The whole site is flat. There are large areas of close cut grass, some pitches overlook the river Mole. Most have hook-ups.
It's my third visit and there used to be a large flock of parrots in residence but they seem to have moved on.
I did see just one off Moseley Lane one morning.
Heathrow is but a few miles away so expect aircraft noise.
Hidden by trees is a storage area.  There are hard standing pitches to the south-west area.
It is necessary to circumscribe this area to leave the site due to the one way system.
Highly recommended. Super staff, as always.
showerReviews.author: Noel Fearnside

locations.title: Steeple Bay Holiday Park
locations.address: ÓÉàCanney Rd, Steeple, Southminster CM0 7RS, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
A memorable holiday at steeple bay holiday park indeed.

It's located close to a backwater lake that feeds from the nearby oceans. The park is pretty big and caravans are newly refurbished, refitted and quite big n wide. They are spread with quite space between so feels spaced. Each caravan has it's own boiler, kitchen with gas hob and all dishes, cutleries etc

When we came in, we found the beds were made which is really good. We were 3 families and caravans were allocated close by, which is very good.

There's an outdoor swimming pool, daily entertainment for adults and children, pub, restaurant, local shop all close by which was great.

On a downside, the food at the restaurant was but pricey (¬£15 for fish and chips), and at the same time not get tasty (mostly cooked from frozen). The half roast chicken was real bland, with a light tasteless sauce. :(
showerReviews.author: Rakesh Chatterjee

showerReviews.reviewText:
Overall fantastic place. Unsure why the previous reviews are so bad.
Our caravan was  tidy a few small issues like a chipped paint on the corner of the wall, ice tray broken, oven knobs quite greasy but did just clean them before use. but overall the place was extremely clean and the beds were excellent.
The bay was absolutely lovely was very funny watching all the people out on the boats and jet skis.
All staff were excellent and friendly.
The food wasn‚Äôt the best and the drinks were slightly expensive from the bar.
The on site small shop is incredibly fairly priced which was a great surprise.
Pool is absolutely lovely Dylan the life guard was absolutely fantastic and a really friendly lad, adult only swimming times are always quiet and highly recommended doing it.
Only real cons for me were the following.
The road to get to the site isn‚Äôt great.
Nearest supermarket is 30 minutes away
A lot of unaccompanied children misbehaving had a few sitting on top of the hockey machine in the arcade instead of paying to use it,
kids on electric scooters not following road layout
Overall very happy with my experience and will hopefully return in the future.
showerReviews.author: P20 JOG

showerReviews.reviewText:
Overall fantastic place. Unsure why the previous reviews are so bad.
Our caravan was  tidy a few small issues like a chipped paint on the corner of the wall, ice tray broken, oven knobs quite greasy but did just clean them before use. but overall the place was extremely clean and the beds were excellent.
The bay was absolutely lovely was very funny watching all the people out on the boats and jet skis.
All staff were excellent and friendly.
The food wasn‚Äôt the best and the drinks were slightly expensive from the bar.
The on site small shop is incredibly fairly priced which was a great surprise.
Pool is absolutely lovely Dylan the life guard was absolutely fantastic and a really friendly lad, adult only swimming times are always quiet and highly recommended doing it.
Only real cons for me were the following.
The road to get to the site isn‚Äôt great.
Nearest supermarket is 30 minutes away
A lot of unaccompanied children misbehaving had a few sitting on top of the hockey machine in the arcade instead of paying to use it,
kids on electric scooters not following road layout
Overall very happy with my experience and will hopefully return in the future.
showerReviews.author: P20 JOG

showerReviews.reviewText: Stayed for a month in one of the lodges & it was so comfortable. We even had a washing machine so we didn't have to use the communal laundry. There is also a heated indoor pool & gym with modern equipment. The area is so quiet & tranquil. Definitely a place to relax. I would recommend anyone to visit. They are also planning to replace the small onside shop with a bigger one & include a restaurant & bar in the near future. I will definitely be back....
showerReviews.author: Cathy Hadden

showerReviews.reviewText: My partner and I with our baby had the privilege of staying here for a month, upon arrival the Lodge was clean "top to bottom" and filled with your basic household equipment. We noticed after unpacking we did not have a microwave in the kitchen ( to use to heat our baby food/milk) and the Internet didn't seem to be working. When I address the issue within minutes a new microwave and they had called the company to come fixed our WiFi. The facilities there are great for families, the swimming pool and sauna was too relaxing!! üòéand every Friday a local fish and chips store comes in a van if you fancy a cheeky fish and chips. All stores can deliver to your Lodge, and the location is perfect makes easy access to local towns around. We can not thank Michael and his team enough they went beyond to make everyone feel welcome and attend the guest needs, further more they made you feel right at home and made our stay warm, relaxed and enjoyable. We will definitely be staying here again without a doubt. Thank you

showerReviews.reviewText: Stayed for a 3days weekend. The park itself was very lovely clean and well maintained. Nice little playground for kids, a decent size swimming pool at a good temperature and a lovely sauna too. There is also a little convenience shop on site I packed everything I needed so didn't go inside but it looked well stocked up. The reason I have given 3 stars is because the cabin we had was very dirty, from dirty towels, floor and carpet full of hair, the sofa was a terrible discolouration from dirt and the shower was gross. When we did complain it took so long for them to come out and sort it by the time they came to clean we just wanted the new towels instead. The video shows the marks in the bathroom can come off that it's not stuck on mould. Overall I would still be willing to visit the park again in the hopes of a better cabin as that was the main thing that let us down
showerReviews.author: Cherry M

showerReviews.reviewText:
Firstly, never having visited the Surrey hills and surrounding areas I need to say how stunning the area the park located is. The bridal walks and drives through the area are beautiful. If you stayed here you would need to be able to drive but that wasn‚Äôt as issue for us as we loved how rural it was.
Now to the caravan park itself. It looks impressive and the facilities of the tennis court and play area are fine. The swimming pool was a great activity to do on days you want to stay around and not venture off site. I will say however, it wasn‚Äôt the cleanest. Other than that it was ‚Äòfine‚Äô
Now onto my main gripe, the property itself. Now, my family and I have stayed in many lodges and this was our second using hoeseasons. The first lodge we stayed at was perfect and we had no complaints, the property really lived up to its value. This one however was a disappointment. When paying for a ‚Äòsuperior‚Äô holiday lodge one can‚Äôt help but have certain expectations. We were left a little deflated when entering the property, and even viewing from the outside we could see it was in need of some TLC. Our decking on the whole road of other lodges was by far the worst and falling apart. The inside of the lodge wasn‚Äôt much better, extremely dated with patches of damp and torn walls. The floor wasn‚Äôt much better with frayed and bunched carpets. A huge ugly stain by the main bed was very unsightly, felt like wax and I dread to think what it actually was. The beds and sofa were also extremely used and in need of replacing. Not overly cleaned well and the walls were stained. Features within the lodge didn‚Äôt work either, the kettle was a hazard and leaked so we didn‚Äôt use it, the extractor fan above the oven didn‚Äôt work, the bath was faulty and the DVD player was only there for show as it didn‚Äôt work. It was mostly the appearance of the property and all these little things not working added up which made me realise it wasn‚Äôt worth the value we paid. Although we made the most of the holiday, we had a lovely time, I wouldn‚Äôt stay again and I certainly expect more from a ‚Äòsuperior‚Äô lodge.
showerReviews.author: Rebecca G

locations.address: ÓÉàWaldegraves Ln, West Mersea, Colchester CO5 8SE, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: We've just spent a week here and it was amazing. Probably the best static caravan we've ever stayed in, even had a dish washer. Facilities on site were great too. Heated out door swimming pool, driving range, mini golf, pitch and put, bike hire, the list goes on. On site fish and chips and restaurant was very good value. Evening entertainment was good and we won on the cash bingo. The only thing that I will say was that our caravan was very near the complex and could be quite loud in the evenings. Not a problem for us but anyone with young kids trying to get them to sleep might struggle with the noise a bit. But a great stay and would recommend to anyone to stay here. Oh and this place is literally on a beach, it was less than a 2 minute walk from our caravan and we were more or less the centre of the campsite
showerReviews.author: Andy_trailruns

showerReviews.reviewText: One of the weirdest experience we had at lakeside caravan park.Firstly a staff car parked in the drive when we arrive on Friday ,had to phone reception and staff moved the car. On Saturday we checked  freezer and the draws were blocked full of  ice and  left a gap in the freezer door so phone reception again to report this and they fixed the problem and Saturday night the oven ignition wouldn't work either I had to phone park warden as the reception closed at 5pm and he said he will report in the morning so I phone the reception in the afternoon after we been out for the day and reception not heard nothing about the problem so I explained what happened they send the maintenance guy fixed it and he did thankfully and top of all of this the extractor fan on top was caked in dust and the shower room along the top there was mold quite a bit of it and the shower was not working properly either and this was Gold plus caravan and getting woken by next door caravan playing loud music in the van what was parked there and slamming doors on Saturday and Sunday morning.The living room window let in lot  of air so we made sure that our 11 month granddaughter was nice and warm as well by doubling the blankets.It seems this caravan has not used been in long time by the experiences we had.
showerReviews.author: Darren Plummer

showerReviews.reviewText:
This is a lovely holiday park. We stayed in a lodge and if you are able to stretch, I would highly recommend. It comes with much more space than a caravan, wrap around decking and our lodge had 3 bathrooms which was great as 6 of us were staying here. The clubhouse is nice with beautiful views of the lakes. My 2 children (1 and 5 Yr) enjoyed watching all the birds. We didn't eat at the clubhouse, go swimming (which did look nice and not overcrowded) or make it to the entertainment as our Lodge was perfect for our needs. WiFi is available to purchase in the lodge and worth noting to check what time the shop opens - we went a few times and it was closed. The only thing I would say is unfortunately there were a few 'big kids' that were being a bit unruly in the play park, wrapping the swings over the bar and trying to break the play equipment, which was a shame. The reception team were really pleasant, all in all a lovely weekend break.

I only gave a 4 star due to the support from Beth at Park Holidays Central team before we arrived. My 1yr old was in hospital (Mon - Wed) and we were due to arrive on the Friday. I emailed the support team to explain the situation and we were still hoping to make our holiday but if my little boy had to go into theatre we wouldn't be able to come. I asked in this circumstance, would it be possible to move the date. (Lodge is pricey and we had treated my parents so it was a special holiday for us) Beth said this couldn't be done and so we would basically have to loose the holiday if we didn't show. Beth's emails were unsympathetic and the holiday unfortunately wasn't a priority at that point due to the hospital situation but it put even more of a dampener on the worries that we were going through. It would of been nice if there was the support there from Park Holidays and opportunity to move the date, if my son had to of gone in for an operation. Thankfully he didn't have to and was feeling much more like himself come the weekend / holiday.
showerReviews.author: Clare Wellfair

showerReviews.reviewText: For a short stay it was absolutely fine, everyone was very friendly and the camping pods are right next to the beach which is lovely. There is a small park and an even smaller pool which got really busy so we didn‚Äôt use it. The arcade was the only other attraction and a few machines were out of order. The toilet/shower block was just okay, it often got a bit grubby and could do with more regular cleans but in saying that the doors are supposed to be kept locked and used only by residents of the park - nobody adhered to this so they were open for all meaning it‚Äôs harder to keep up with cleaning. For the price the camping pod was good value and a lovely base to explore the area.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Extremely Poor Communication and Customer Service at Seaview Caravan Park

I am extremely disappointed with my experience dealing with Park Holidays, specifically management at Seaview Caravan Park.

I have made multiple attempts over several weeks to contact the park via email about an ongoing matter. These messages have been ignored entirely, without even a basic acknowledgement. To make matters worse, a promised phone call from management over a week ago never happened, and no explanation or follow-up was provided.

This level of disregard for customers is unacceptable. Clear, timely communication should be a minimum standard for any business, yet Park Holidays has failed to meet even that. It is frustrating, unprofessional, and has caused unnecessary stress and inconvenience.

Based on our experience, I cannot recommend Park Holidays to anyone who values reliable customer service or accountability from management.

To compound matters, the caravan itself was in an appalling state on arrival. It was filthy, with a strong, unpleasant smell that was immediately noticeable. There were stains that appeared to be from urine and the general condition fell far below any reasonable hygiene or presentation standard for holiday accommodation.

This combination of poor customer service and unacceptable cleanliness is disgraceful. Based on our experience, I cannot recommend Park Holidays to anyone who values reliable communication, professionalism, or basic hygiene.
showerReviews.author: Jason Beirne

locations.title: Parkdean Resorts Highfield Grange Holiday Park, Essex
locations.address: ÓÉàLondon Rd, Clacton-on-Sea CO16 9QY, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
The very few positives of the site all the staff I spoke to were lovely & helpful, however it's  quite obvious that the site is really under staffed.
Our caravan had lots of storage.
The highlight of the week was the Wrestling.
The site is very close to supermarkets & has a bus stop right outsid.
Now the negatives.
Our caravan had the hallway door missing.
Holes in the bedroom wall.
Broken drawers.
The caravan was dirty the carpet was covered in hair, housekeeping came very quickly to try to remedy this but their vaccum cleaner was obviously past it's best & failed to collect any of the hair, also we found previous occupants dirty socks.
There was dog faeces for several days by the entertainment building it eventually got washed away by the rain, also dog faeces was in the car park near the caravans.
When it rained the entertainment complex was difficult to get into as the entrance nearest us was under water.
The club house toilets are filthy & probably a health hazard.
It takes an eternity to get served in the clubhouse & if you order to get table service they will substitute your drinks without asking as they frequently sell out popular drinks, obviously caused by being under staffed.
The tables & floor in the house are never cleaned they were filthy even at opening time.
The swimming pool was not fully open & the water had strange black bits floating around which looked like mould, the changing rooms were filthy most didn't lock & the smell in the pool area was putrid, one visit was one to many.
The air all around the site is thick with the smell of cannabis, security were fully aware but did nothing to stop the culprits.
Building works are taking place & were were not informed of this & found it very odd that someone was it seemed trying to measure the floor area while childrens entertainment was taking place.
We had one meal onsite which was edible but didn't appreciate what seemed to be builders sitting right behind us effing & blinding while we were eating with young children, my Grandchildren learnt a few choice words from them.
This site is the worst site we have ever visited & we will not be returning.
Clacton pier was a fantastic day out & id recommend a visit they did Halloween spectacularly well for all ages
showerReviews.author: Jacqueline Harley

showerReviews.reviewText:
Caravan was very run down. Holes in walls and door missing. Caravan floor was filthy. Cleaner came to hoover the carpet but as she was using a Henry hoover it was mostly flattening the hair and dust on the carpet rather than sucking it up. We found a sock and golf ball that weren't ours so this highlights how thorough the cleaning was done. The plugs were for show only as they didn't fit the plug holes. No net curtains which other caravan parks have so very limited privacy and caravans were closer together compared to other sites we have stayed at. The pool was disgusting, baby pool closed with no reason as to why. This led to the main pool being overcrowded and meant the toddler in our group couldn't really enjoy the pool. There was black mould / dirt at the bottom of the pool and we went there in the morning so wouldn't have been from that day's use. Too few changing areas. We didn't use the pool again which was disappointing as swimming is one of the activities the kids look forward to.

Toilets in the swimming pool were also used by arts and crafts so were covered in paint. We went into these in the morning on 2 occasions and both times they were filthy and had no soap.

The clubhouse was also filthy. We attended a children's activity in the morning and the tables, floor and bar area were sticky and clearly hadn't been cleaned from the night before. Again the toilets in the clubhouse had no soap.

We ordered drinks using the App and waited nearly an hour for these. Clearly there were not enough staff to serve at the bar and also deal with orders online. When our drinks finally arrived they had been substituted without an apology or explanation, we had to enquire why our drinks weren't what we ordered. They were meant to be frozen cocktails but had clearly been sitting around for a while as they had melted.

There was dog poo by the clubhouse for 3 days. It only disappeared once the area flooded due to the rain.

The smell of cannabis was overpowering. Security guards acknowledged it but didn't seem to be doing anything about it.

Security guards on the clubhouse doors let small children run out without an adult.

The crafts activities we participated in weren't very well organised. We were left to work out what to do by ourselves. No instructions and very limited interaction. Other parks have made these experiences more interactive for children.

The fish and chip shop, ice cream place and chicken take away weren't open despite this being a busy time of year due to school hols. The restaurant was very slow and again seemed to be running on skeleton staff. This left us no choice but to eat off site.

Very limited things to do during the day and especially when it is raining. No soft play or free activities to do.

We hired 2 travel cots and a highchair and these were in our caravan upon arrival. However, we couldn't set up the travel cots as we weren't able to move the beds ourselves. No note to explain this or who to contact. We had to report this to reception and it took a long time to resolve this issue.

There were building works taking place and we hadn't been notified of this in advance.

Children enjoyed the playground.

Location is good. Large Tesco within a 10 min walk. Bus stop right outside which we took to Clacton pier. Highly recommend Clacton pier for kids especially during Halloween.
showerReviews.author: Michelle Sullivan

locations.address: ÓÉàHarley Shute Rd, Hastings, Saint Leonards-on-sea TN38 8BZ, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: Our recent experience at Haven was highly satisfactory. The resort offered a comprehensive selection of child-oriented activities, including swimming pools, an arcade, and roller skating, alongside other recreational amenities. The single beds in the caravan were compact, but otherwise, the accommodation was acceptable. Furthermore, the resort featured a restaurant and an entertainment hall, providing relaxation options for adults. The location is strategically advantageous, offering convenient access to the beach, shopping centers, and piers via readily available transportation. Various caravan sizes are available to accommodate diverse family requirements, with pricing dependent on the caravan's grade, ranging from bronze to gold. Given the positive experience, are caravan ownership opportunities under consideration? They are certainly attractive.
showerReviews.author: Dorothea

showerReviews.reviewText: Expensive for what it is. I joined at around ¬£30 pm and now, 6 ish months later, it‚Äôs ¬£43.99! For ¬£43.99 you get an over crowded gym, 3 cable machine to share, no floor space for smaller weights, stinky changing rooms, dirty equipment & training floor with minimal antibacterial spray and tissue paper available to wipe down equipment, horribly loud music and no air conditioning. The swimming pool seems to always be closed and I‚Äôve never seen the cafe open which is annoying when you forget your water bottle and no paper cups are provided for the water fountain. Staff have been friendly however one time my direct debit bounced and they asked me to pay the ¬£30 joining fee again! - i received no emails letting me know prior this was an issue.
