showerReviews.reviewText:
I want to love this place as it has so much potential.  There are many good, even great things about it: the manager obviously means well and is striving to do a good job; post-renovation, there is better use of the available space (even if there is still not enough equipment); cleanliness is always decent; the personal trainers are capable and reliable (and queuing to use the equipment); the reception staff are always efficient (if not exactly smiling); the cafe run by Mustafa and his colleague is fantastic; and last but not least, it remains an affordable local gym.  However, there is also vast room for improvement.  My three main issues are the awful air conditioning, the awful smell in the ladies‚Äô changing rooms, and the fact that this place really needs to prioritize maintaining its character as a community hub.
On days of heatwave, of which we are having many, the main gym area turns into a sauna and it is suffocating.  The leisure centres at Camberwell and Elephant & Castle in the meantime are a cool oasis.  So why is this?  Apparently, at Dulwich the renovation budget was blown by the fact they needed to remove asbestos.  Well, thank you for that, but we also don‚Äôt want to die of a heart attack any more than we want to die of asbestos poisoning. To replace the existing air conditioning system, they need to move it with a crane and therefore need to close the local roads.  Why is this such a big problem?  The road is often blocked because water pipes burst and flood the area, they can‚Äôt close the road for a few hours to finish the job?!
Secondly, the extensive renovation didn‚Äôt cover the changing rooms and the stink in the ladies‚Äô one, especially the first area as you come in, is as powerful as it is permanent.
Finally, I don‚Äôt like the fact that they removed seating to install the mostly useless Library of Things.  I used to love the fact that the more elderly users of the centre would take a seat on the comfortable chairs and sofa and have a chat after their seniors‚Äô classes.  Now the available space is halved and tables really should be used by those who buy a coffee.  Sorry, but you are not doing your job properly here, Southwark Council.  Apart from fitness, a leisure centre is a place to meet other people, a reason to get out of the house, particularly for the elderly.  You can rent a hedge trimmer from your local hardware store, you don‚Äôt need the community leisure centre to fulfill that function.  So, so disappointing that they could not see all that.  So, thank you for your efforts, but please try harder.
showerReviews.author: Psipsina Corelli

showerReviews.reviewText:
This used to an affordable and inclusive feeling gym, needing some better maintenance but not bad. I‚Äôve come back after the refurbishments and it‚Äôs much more expensive, and they made it into the chaotic atmosphere of every other cheap gym with dark walls, neon lights. If they had upgraded the sound system it would have music blaring. It used to have nice tucked away areas that you could work out on your own with small weights and mirrors to check your alignment. That doesn‚Äôt seem to be any small weights anymore, And you just have to find a spot right in the middle With chaos all around you -Not an inclusive environment For people who need to be there for rehabilitation.
They somehow seem to have fitted less cardio machines in.
They open the Upstairs, But have just put a load of TV screens with boxing bags that nobody uses.

Some of the staff seemed uninterested and not very helpful, with body language that came across as unwelcoming. It feels like a bit of customer service training is needed.
Overall, there‚Äôs potential here, but improvements in cleanliness and staff attitude are definitely needed.

The centre needs an unexpected hygiene inspection for the health and safety of customers.
Someone needs to be responsible for all the above.

Yes it‚Äôs a good facility for the community well equipped and all, it‚Äôs just the hygiene is the problem.

locations.title: Canada Water Leisure Centre
locations.address: ÓÉà7 Deal Porters Way, London SE16 2AJ, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
It‚Äôs really sad to see the condition of this place. The Canada Water Leisure Centre is a brand new facility beautifully designed, modern, and full of potential .  but it‚Äôs being completely let down by poor management and terrible cleanliness.

I am a member here and have already spoken to the reception and asked to speak with a manager about the cleaning standards. Unfortunately, nothing seems to improve. The men‚Äôs changing room and bathroom in the gym area are disgusting. The floors are filthy and covered in black marks, the toilets have stains and splashes on the walls, and the sinks are often dirty. There‚Äôs often no soap, no detergent, and sometimes not even toilet paper.

The shower area is just as bad. The floors are not properly washed  they are simply hoovered or mopped over, which is unacceptable in an area where people are barefoot. There‚Äôs no deep cleaning, and it‚Äôs clearly unhygienic. It‚Äôs a shame to see a brand new installation already being left to deteriorate like this.

Another serious issue is the strong smell of drains that hits you as soon as you walk into the reception area. When the gym doors open, you can smell it immediately . it‚Äôs a horrible, toilet-like odour that varies in intensity from day to day. I‚Äôve mentioned this to reception several times, and other members I‚Äôve spoken to have also complained. They say they‚Äôre ‚Äútaking action,‚Äù but the smell keeps coming back, sometimes even stronger.

It‚Äôs such a disappointment because the facility itself is beautiful, but the management clearly doesn‚Äôt care about maintaining it. There are plenty of staff around, yet no one seems to take responsibility or ensure proper cleaning. This centre desperately needs professional supervision and a serious deep-cleaning routine before it becomes completely neglected.
showerReviews.author: Marco wruck

showerReviews.reviewText:
Canada Water Leisure Centre is an outstanding facility.

The place is brand new, very spacious, and extremely well-equipped. The gym itself is huge with a wide range of treadmills, advanced machines, and free weights ‚Äî plenty of space for everyone, so it never feels overcrowded.

The sports facilities are excellent: full-size basketball courts, multiple badminton courts, and a large sports hall that can accommodate many activities. The group classes are also very good, with modern studios, a great atmosphere, and well-organised sessions.

Infrastructure is top-class: clean changing rooms, plenty of lockers, accessible facilities, and even comfortable lounge areas to relax. The reception area is bright and welcoming, and bike parking outside is handy.

Overall, this centre has everything you could want ‚Äî fitness, sports, classes, and community space, all in a modern setting. I would highly recommend it to anyone in the area.
showerReviews.author: Neeraj Saxena

showerReviews.reviewText:
*Important Update* Please be aware that classes need to be cancelled 4 hours in advance. Unaware, I cancelled a class 2 hours before and paid a fine of ¬£4! Wow! I believe that needs to change! So I‚Äôll be downgrading my stars rating Canada Water‚Äôs new super leisure centre is a game changer! (I don‚Äôt get the negative reviews, you guys seriously need to go out more)

I had the chance to tour the brand-new Canada Water Leisure Centre on opening day, and honestly, it exceeded my expectations. The facilities are top-notch: two pools ‚Äî a full 25m eight-lane pool and a teaching pool with a moveable floor. The gym is packed with cutting-edge kit like Speedflex machines, which I can‚Äôt wait to try more.

What really stood out was the multipurpose sports hall ‚Äî you can rent it for badminton, tennis, five-a-side football, and basketball, making it perfect for groups and community activities.

A big thank you to Phillipa for the wonderful tour ‚Äî the staff are genuinely friendly and welcoming. I also joined a meditation class and was impressed to see frequency bowls for sound included. It added something unique, though personally I‚Äôd also love to see a quieter session focused just on breathwork. The meditation space itself is gorgeous, with calming blue lights that create a really peaceful atmosphere.

They also run group cycling classes, though these weren‚Äôt available during my visit because they were filming. I was told you need to book classes through their app, ideally well in advance, since demand is already high.

I noticed the age group skewed a little older (around 40‚Äì50+), which surprised me, but it actually made the vibe even more friendly and community-oriented.

And let‚Äôs not forget: memberships for locals start from just ¬£20 a month ‚Äî insane value for London. Between the swimming, the gym, the classes, and the multipurpose hall, this place really has something for everyone.

Highly recommend checking it out!
showerReviews.author: Aoki Sanchez

showerReviews.reviewText:
The gym offers a wide range of equipment, and the changing rooms and facilities are clean and well maintained. The location is perfect, being just a short walk from Canada Water Underground station.

The team is helpful and knowledgeable, especially Personal Trainer Jacob, who has been excellent in helping me improve my form and offering valuable training tips.

There are a few downsides: you need a padlock or ¬£1 coin for the lockers, which isn‚Äôt terrible, but having PIN-code lockers would be more convenient‚Äîespecially on days when I forget my padlock. The gym also gets extremely busy during peak times, which sometimes means waiting for certain machines. Additionally, the gym is smaller than I initially expected.

Overall, it‚Äôs a solid gym with great staff and facilities, but a few improvements could make the experience even better.

Today I‚Äôve arrived at the gym 9.30am and to my surprise they closed !! Should open at 8 but the staff member is 2 hours late, how is that customers fault ? We pay for a service that is nothing but shambolic.
When will someone higher up either investigate it or do something about it.
You email the manager and he ignores your email.
Few pictures attached taken just after opening ( yes 2 hrs late ) how is things this filthy when you just opened ??
showerReviews.author: Brian Vint

showerReviews.reviewText:
I love this place.  I've been coming here for years, since it first opened.  It's a large gym, with a huge variety of equipment and weights. Maybe nine separate areas depending on what you're wanting to do. Plus a large studio room for classes.

It's a marked constrast from the typical high-end gyms which you pay much more for.  Where you get the whole swimming / sauna experience, fresh towels etc.  But their actual gyms are never nearly as good as this one is.

Over the years they keep making gradual improvements in the types of equipment and layout, until it's now in an optimum state for all tastes.

It's cheap, very large, laid back, friendly.  It's got a lot of choices, accommodating almost any kind of exercise.  Except swimming.

There's no water dispenser, so bring your own.
showerReviews.author: Duncan Cumming

showerReviews.reviewText:
I‚Äôve must‚Äôve visited over 50 gyms, some of them in god forsaken parts of the world - this is one of the worst.

Almost all of the equipment is in dire need of maintenance. Some of it straight up just doesn‚Äôt work. You cant see what height/weight is on the cable machines because of how worn it is, and the height adjustment mechanisms themselves are all half broken.

The showers are cold and automatically turn off after literally 3 seconds‚Ä¶

There is NO water tap.

The only reason it gets 2 stars and not 1 is because it‚Äôs one of the few gyms in the area to have a boxing section, and it doesn‚Äôt seem to get very busy before work.

But seriously, for ¬£35 a month it‚Äôs disgusting how poor this place is. Go to The Gym or Puregym nearby instead. Gutted I wasted my money on this place.

showerReviews.reviewText: Unfortunately I need to give a bad rating for one item that perhaps is not a problem for many. Unfortunately, the showers does not have any temperature control so you need to keep pressing to get steaming hot water on you. For someone looking to shower before work after a workout, this is really not a pleasant experience as you come out sweating even more than when you come in (granted that I shower slightly cold). I brought it up to the staff and while they suggested that the disabled toilet got a temperature control that worked fine, I don't really feel that comfortable taking up their toilet for someone that has disabilities. Other than this issue the gym is decent enough, long open hours and not overly crowded as well as decently priced. I hope they sort out the shower issue and I will join again.

showerReviews.reviewText: Great Gym for day pass. Used the gym for 4 days as a day pass user, as it was best value. Really friendly staff, but Charles & Danny were notable. Gym isn‚Äôt huge, but has good, versatile  equipment, is clean and has a good mix of users, with a good vibe. No standers & talkers. Used the Concept 2 rowers (great condition) and after a comment they got a network cable to allow them to be connected up for racing, so very responsive to feedback. Changing rooms clean. A good find and would recommend. To find it, if the gated alley down the side of Tesco‚Äôs is closed, go round the other side of Tesco‚Äôs , past the entrance to the Premier Inn, turn right and right again. Think the gym website should have decent map/directions as it is tucked away - but worth finding.

locations.title: Gym Nation | London Bridge
locations.address: ÓÉà26 Druid St, London SE1 2EY, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: I was a member of this gym for a couple of years, and was really taken aback by how much the gym is driven by community compared to large chains. There is a dedicated space for multiple disciplines of strength work (callisthenics, powerlifting, free weights, Hyrox) and the staff are stacked with personal trainers who can help you pursue your fitness goals in a way that best suits you. Andy and the team are very friendly and respectful, noticeably more so than your average gym, with it being apparent from your first session how passionate and dedicated they are to building a community of like-minded gym goers. Like most gyms, during peak hours it can be tricky to grab the machines you need, and sometimes the changing rooms can feel packed, but if you work/live around London Bridge, this is an ideal gym, and I would still be here if my office was closer (such that I could dodge peak times) or I lived closer. I was not much of a class-goer but they have lots of different options available for people to take advantage of.
showerReviews.author: Joseph Hills

showerReviews.reviewText:
One of the, if not, THE best gym in London. Regardless of what you're training specifically for (powerlifting, weightlifting, bodybuilding, strongman, CrossFit, hyrox etc.), there is high-spec equipment for every discipline. Every possible type of barbell, rig setup, and squat rack including IPF approved Eleiko combo racks.

The gym itself is huge and spreads through the railway arches underneath London Bridge, which is less than a 5-minute walk away. The lobby has lots of seating and tables to work at, high-speed Wi-Fi and charging plug sockets throughout the gym. There's even a Caf√© with snacks, coffee, protein shakes (and Rice Krispies treats :D).

The amenities are well-maintained and regularly cleaned - the changing rooms have individual showers, toilets and lockers (that can also be permanently hired for a small add-on fee). The women's changing rooms have recently been redone with new showers (and more improvements will be made soon).

The staff are genuinely so nice, make an effort to get to know you, and actually enjoy what they do. There is a huge powerlifting community here, and everyone is so friendly, willing to spot you, give you tips, or just generally up for a chat.

In my opinion, the membership cost is completely justifiable, and is so worth it. Every time I train I have an amazing session, rarely have to wait for the equipment or machines I want to use, and overall just really enjoy the atmosphere and the people too.
showerReviews.author: Rachel Sheppard

locations.title: Third Space Tower Bridge
locations.address: ÓÉà2b More London Pl, London SE1 2AP, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
At the beginning, everything was going fairly well and I tried to remain understanding despite some technical issues (the sauna being out of order for several months, the chairs in the changing rooms disappearing and being swapped around, etc.). I told myself these things happen and let it go, even though I was paying a full monthly membership without access to all the services.

The real problem came when I had an issue with my membership renewal, which was not my fault. I received an email saying I no longer had access, so I did not use the gym. Despite this, they kept pressuring me to pay for a full month‚Äôs membership that I never used. I later realised that some of their emails had gone into my spam folder, so there had clearly been a communication issue. But when I discovered this, I genuinely tried to explain the situation and find a solution. Instead of listening, they stood their ground and refused to understand.

I find this unacceptable for a gym that claims to promote vitality and well-being. When everything is fine, there is no problem. But the moment you need a minimum of humanity and understanding, there is no one there. The customer service is very poorly managed and hides behind automated procedures.

If you are simply looking for a gym that takes your monthly payments without any real care, then you can go there. But if you want a place that is human, attentive and respectful of its members, I strongly advise against it.
showerReviews.author: Candice Desmet

showerReviews.reviewText:
This has become worse than a puregym. They have oversubbed it, without suitably investing into improvement of space. The recent refresh of equipment has done nothing to make the gym a better experience. All spaces are dirty and poorly managed. It is always overcrowded. When something's broken it's never fixed. Showers are never stocked with enough conditioner etc. Saunas are turned off 30-60mins before the gym closes. Toilets are in a horrendous condition.

They also promise you lots of things when you sign up ("we're planning a cold plunge") which never happen.

showerReviews.reviewText:
First, I want to start by saying Gymbox is an AMAZING gym ‚Äî the staff are incredibly friendly, the classes are unique, and the overall environment, including the massage and recovery area, is top-tier. I‚Äôd genuinely rate everything else 11/10.

However, I‚Äôm leaving one star due to an ongoing and uncomfortable issue in the men‚Äôs sauna. To raise awareness and safety for others.

There seems to be a regular group of men using the sauna either completely naked or semi-naked, with only small towels that often don‚Äôt adequately cover their private parts. Some individuals even stand up completely nude, leaving their towel on the bench, which raises both hygiene concerns and discomfort for others. On top of that, there have been provocative conversations and behaviors that don‚Äôt feel appropriate for a fitness environment.

Once, someone appeared to be using their phone in the sauna ‚Äî possibly filming, though I can't be sure. These incidents, combined with the atmosphere created by this group, have made me and others feel uncomfortable and on edge.

To be clear: I fully support an inclusive, welcoming gym environment where everyone ‚Äî regardless of gender, race, or sexuality ‚Äî can work out and relax safely. But the sauna should not feel like a hookup space. As another reviewer rightly said, some of the behavior borders on predatory in the changing rooms.

I strongly urge Gymbox to take clearer action. One simple but effective step could be enforcing a rule that men must wear swimwear or shorts in the sauna ‚Äî just like in a mixed-gender facility. It‚Äôs not just about comfort, but basic hygiene and respect for everyone using the space.

Until something is done, I unfortunately won‚Äôt be using those facilities ‚Äî which is a shame, because this gym has so much potential and otherwise delivers an exceptional experience.
showerReviews.author: James

showerReviews.reviewText:
I've been using Gymbox E&C for about two years now. While the gym should be commended for the upgrades to the equipment and the changes to how the space is used, there has been a definite decline in the time I've been there.

Firstly, it's always busy! At peak times it's nearly impossible to get the equipment you need without having to wait and other gym users seem reluctant to share, too, which doesn't help the situation. There also still seems to be a huge push for new members which I understand from the company's perspective (¬£¬£), but it really doesn't help improve the experience of current members who can't enjoy the gym. There aren't enough benches in the free weights area (they could really do with bolting some down so they can't be moved elsewhere) and there aren't enough dumbbells for how busy it is either.

As further example of how busy it is, they recently ran out of towels for members so I was unable to shower after my session. Furthermore, members are having to wait for lockers to become available before they can start a workout.

Secondly, equipment is left all over the place. There have been several times lately where I've had to walk around the gym looking for the dumbbells/plates I need when they should have been on the rack. It's not a big deal, but it's frustrating in conjunction with my observation above. Putting the right weights back in the right spot is basic gym etiquette.

Thirdly, the changes to lighting in the men's sauna are horrible; it feels like sitting in a doctor's waiting room. Now, I understand why they've done it, but why punish the many for the actions of a few?

Finally, they need to stop allowing wannabe influencers filming themselves in the gym and encouraging this by reposting them on social media. I don't want to be in the background of someone's workout that could then be posted online. Most gyms have a 'no filming' rule and I wish Gymbox would adopt this too!

As much as I like the gym; the vibe; the classes and the variety of equipment, my job is not flexible in terms of going at quieter times, so I'm seriously toying with the idea of finding another gym. I figure I'd be waiting just as long for equipment at a cheaper gym, so why not save myself a hundred quid a month?! Unless they make some big changes, Gymbox E&C is currently not worth the membership fee...
showerReviews.author: Nick Jobbins

showerReviews.reviewText:

locations.title: The Fitting Rooms PT Gym
locations.address: ÓÉàSaxon House, 48 Southwark St, London SE1 1UN, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: Joining The Fitting Rooms (TFR) in July 2024 was one of the best decisions I have ever made for my health, fitness and wellbeing. Having trained at various other gyms but never lasting longer than a few months, I have felt completely at home at TFR. I leave every session feeling motivated for the day ahead having had a brilliant session with the excellent training team. I take part in the shared PT sessions and sometimes it‚Äôs only myself and the PT! It is a great space to meet new people and get to know those who attend regularly. The professionalism and expertise of all the trainers is the best that I have experienced and I am lifting weights that I wouldn‚Äôt have gone anywhere near if I was training alone. I mostly train with Ryan and Lucy and they go above and beyond to make sure that I am doing the exercises correctly and improving my form, they‚Äôre both wonderful company as well. The fantastic facilities are up to date and are always clean. The showers and changing rooms are also great to use before cracking on with the rest of my day. I genuinely look forward to training here and I am pleased TFR is a big part of my life - would highly recommend!
showerReviews.author: Megan Davies

locations.title: Swimming Nature - Southwark
locations.address: ÓÉàDarwin Court, 1 Crail Row, London SE17 1AD, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
I wish I could give 5 stars, but unfortunately, I can only give two. My daughter started at Angela‚Äôs Swimming School when she was 3, and things were great back then, especially under Leo‚Äôs management. However, since he left, the quality has noticeably declined.

They now only offer lessons on Wednesdays, the staff keeps changing, and there‚Äôs very poor communication with parents. Prices have increased significantly, by about 20% since January 2025, and when I emailed to ask why, I received no reply.

Compared to other swim schools, the value just isn‚Äôt there anymore. I know at least two other parents who‚Äôve pulled their kids out due to dissatisfaction with both the teaching and the customer service.

During lessons, the teachers often seem distracted and frequently check the clock. My daughter is at an intermediate/advanced level, but the sessions are poorly structured, they only use half of the pool, and there‚Äôs no proper focus on technique like leg work. It all feels disorganised and unprofessional.

Really disappointed, especially after such a positive start years ago.
showerReviews.author: Filipa Amin

showerReviews.reviewText: Amazing swim school! If you are looking for a swim school that can help to build your little one‚Äôs confidence with a big smile on their face and a thumbs up each week learning to swim unaided with style!!!! Then look no further than Angela‚Äôs Swim School! My Son learnt to swim with Angela‚Äôs Swim School and his style of swimming looks effortless (even had people approach me around the pool on our all inclusive holidays to remark on what a fantastic swimmer your son is for his age - 4years old) The pool at Darwin Court in Southwark is lovely, really clean and warm (great for the winter months!) the changing facilities are fully equipped and also very clean. There is a lovely seating area where you can watch your happy little ones swim each week and a very nice reasonable priced cafe area where you can purchase hot / cold food and drinks before or after your lesson. What can I say about the staff! fantastic, kind and caring swimming instructors that make such an effort with the Children each week (I don‚Äôt think I have ever sat around a pool and seen so many happy Children smiling each week) really lovely to see and to hear poolside I‚Äôm not the only parent buzzing about this swim school, they really do make an effort both with the swimmers and the parents. The swim school have an amazing swim programme (The Swim Stylers) the Children follow through the stages each term and are rewarded their badge and certificate at the end of each term poolside, my Son loved receiving his badges from his teacher. HUGE thank you to all the staff at Angela‚Äôs Swim School üëè

locations.title: Southwark Aquatics Swimming Club
locations.address: ÓÉà7 Deal Porters Way, London SE16 2AJ, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Southwark Aquatics is a friendly local swimming club, based mostly at Seven Islands Leisure Centre. SASC is blessed with excellent and committed coaches and managed by keen parents, and every swimmer at SASC is encouraged in the pursuit of the goal of being the very best they can be, from precocious water junkies to the young later developers.

The notions of swimming as a valuable life-skill and healthy exercise, sound technical development, enjoyment of the sport, teamwork, and a social cohesion are ones espoused by all at the Club.

Since joining SASC from another club, where their development had stalled for the lack of technical guidance, our kids have blossomed. They love the coaching, they improve in every aspect of their swimming every week, they are physically healthy, are in a group of keen swimming friends, and they are proud to represent the Club. Very happy swimmers.
showerReviews.author: Nico Teen

showerReviews.reviewText:
This is by far the best Fitness First in London. I‚Äôve visited several different locations, and London Bridge stands out every single time. I feel confident using the machines here ‚Äî everything is well laid out, there‚Äôs plenty of space for everyone to work out comfortably, and it never feels overcrowded.

The sauna and steam room are always hot and ready, which makes the post-workout experience perfect. The staff are genuinely friendly, welcoming, and always ready to help with anything you need. The whole gym is well maintained, clean, and consistently looked after.

showerReviews.reviewText:
One of the best gyms I have used in England. It has the same setting and standards as most of David Lloyds Club gyms except without a Jacuzzi.

Fitness first has a standard pool, a dry sauna, steam room, very large changing room, lots of showers, a well compartmentalised work out area for cardio, weights etc which most gyms lack.

The reception area is large and cosy like that of a 4 star hotel....staff are on ground to assist when needed. Cleaning is done consistently keeping the gym super neat.

I will highly recommend this gym for a good workout , swim or spa like  relaxation anytime in London.

locations.title: Snap Fitness Elephant & Castle 24 Hour Gym
locations.address: ÓÉà130-138 Newington Butts, Elephant and Castle, London SE11 4QU, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
EDIT: Nothing has been fixed since my original review, in fact, things have gotten worse. Now there are two treadmills not working. Really disappointing to see no progress. (Photo uploaded for reference.)

ORIGINAL: I have been a member here for some time, and while the staff are always friendly and helpful, I do feel the gym is being let down by management and maintenance. For the price we pay, I believe members should at least be able to count on the basics being taken care of.

Several machines are frequently out of order for long periods (such as the adductor, one of the cables, and a treadmill). Instead of being replaced or properly repaired, they tend to go in and out of service. The lockers are also an issue, as many do not work or are left filled with belongings without locks, making it difficult to find space during busy hours. A stronger policy to manage this would be very helpful. In addition, the uneven flooring in the dumbbell weight area highlights the lack of maintenance and raises safety concerns.

I understand this is not a high-end gym, but it would be great to see more consistent attention to these basic issues. There are other gyms nearby with newer equipment and sometimes even lower prices, but this location is convenient. With a bit more care and investment, it could provide a much better experience for everyone.
showerReviews.author: Rafael Cardoso

showerReviews.reviewText:

showerReviews.reviewText:
Edit 08/12: They promised a major refurbishment, but to my surprise the only things that were updated were the flooring and the lights. None of the equipment has been improved, and the treadmills and leg machines have been broken for months. I‚Äôve raised this with management several times and nothing has been done. The only reason I still go is convenience. If I could, I‚Äôd give this gym zero stars. Please don‚Äôt waste your money here.

Edit 26/10: The gym still hasn‚Äôt fixed the hip abduction machine, which has been broken for months. The cable machine was supposedly fixed but still doesn‚Äôt work properly, and now there‚Äôs another treadmill broken‚Äîso that‚Äôs **two out of roughly six** in total that are unusable. On top of that, there are uneven floor elevations near the dumbbell area and lockers that are either broken or permanently occupied without padlocks.

I‚Äôve raised these issues to the staff, and the response was, ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs frustrating.‚Äù Well, it‚Äôs even more frustrating for those of us paying for a membership and getting a facility that‚Äôs constantly out of order. Honestly, I‚Äôm not sure what kind of management this gym has if nothing ever seems to get properly addressed.
____

OK gym overall. The equipment is basic, and  some machines and a treadmill have been out of order for ages with no sign of being repaired. Considering the gym already has limited equipment, leaving things broken for so long really makes the experience frustrating.
showerReviews.author: Jonas Bianchet

showerReviews.reviewText:
Let me begin by saying your staff here are fab! I have no complaints about the team - very friendly and helpful. You have been emailing me to review this place for months and I have avoided it for months to give you the chance to fix things so that I wouldn't have to leave a poor review but enough is enough!

I frequent different branches of Snap Fitness because of my work, therefore this review is based on the conditions of other branches by the same company. I'm not sure what Elephant and Castle has done to deserve such slack servicing! The Hip Adduction machine has been "out of service" for over 3 months. The lockers near the toilets have broken off doors and when one isn't broken it is taken by a customer who doesn't believe in using padlocks, so you end up spending a good 5 mins opening and closing the lockers searching for an empty one. (I have seen the new sign saying "no padlock no locker" however it is not really enforced. Get a bucket and throw people's stuff in there for them to rummage through, seen as they want to behave without decorum.)

Thirdly, the sledge carpet area is dangerous! Near the end of it (closet to the water fountain), there is a section that caves inwards like a ditch. If you are doing walking lunges or using the sledge and you step on it, you can easily twist your ankle. If you are doing walking lunges with an heavy barbell on your shoulders, that injury will cost you as a company! Sort it out.

Fourthly, you are charging the same price as the branch in Raynes Park which now has a sauna! Yet the changing room in this branch smells absolutely rancid, the machines are tired, the plates are crumbling. I go to the Raynes Park branch and it baffles me how these gyms are provided by the same company yet are polar opposite in condition.
Overall, great staff but an absolute poor establishment that needs renovation NOW!
showerReviews.author: Nelly Nelly

locations.title: London Health Hub
locations.address: ÓÉàGround Floor, Upper, 1 Talbot Yard, London SE1 1YP, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
I purchased an introductory deep tissue massage session via Groupon, but unfortunately the experience did not reflect what was advertised. The appointment began with an extensive set of questions about specific injury implying that this is booking for the treatment for a specific area of pain/ injury. All of my medical details were gathered (not many... as I was not injured!!). While some screening is normal, this went far beyond what was necessary and felt disproportionate, especially as I had no injury and only mentioned general shoulder tension. Despite repeatedly clarifying this, the therapist continued to probe for very specific injury-related information that was simply irrelevant.

Although the voucher described a full-body deep tissue massage, the session focused on only one area and felt more like a clinical assessment than an actual massage. The therapist frequently referenced his three years of experience in a way that felt dismissive rather than reassuring.

The environment also fell short of expectations. The London Bridge location appears to be inside a residential building, and the interior felt unwelcoming and hostile. The treatment rooms were extremely small and visibly worn, with marks and damage on walls and ceilings. Noise travelled clearly through the thin walls, making the session feel far from private.

I was unexpectedly asked whether I had brought my own towel‚Äîsomething that was not communicated beforehand and is not standard in wellness or massage settings I had ever experienced (and I regularly attend physio and sports massages at various venues). They also could not offer water after the session, which is very unusual for a place offering physical therapy or massage services.

My appointment started late but ended exactly on time, with no adjustment despite the delay at their end. At the end of the session, I was 'strongly encouraged' to purchase additional treatments at a ‚Äúdiscounted‚Äù price, but only if I committed immediately. The upsell felt pressured, particularly because the recommendations seemed based solely on the something I mentioned in passing. Payment was taken directly by the therapist- he had the card reader literally to hand in no time! There is no reception area, and I received no email confirmation of the payment or any kind of invoice‚Äîonly the card machine receipt‚Äîwhich raises concerns about how transactions are handled and accounted for!

The following day I felt unwell (sick/ nauseous), which made me question whether the technique used was appropriate. I was warn that i might experience pain- but that's not the case- just feeling incredibly nauseous!

Overall, the experience felt uncomfortable, unprofessional, and not aligned with what was promoted on Groupon. I would not return and would advise others to be aware of these points before booking.
showerReviews.author: Joanna Franczak

Really disappointing experience. I had my first session which was good and the guy was professional and gave me a good massage. I purchased two further sessions and on arriving for the second session, I was kept waiting for 15-20 mins when finally I went upstairs and the guy looked dazed and didn‚Äôt even know I had an appointment. He got me to speak to the manager and they said my booking wasn‚Äôt on the systems. Despite me showing emails. He was like let‚Äôs book you in again, I said I travelled 45 mins there and have the same journey back, so want a refund which he did give. However the time I wasted an my travel costs weren‚Äôt covered. I emailed they and they ignored me. I think it‚Äôs not the most organised place, I saw someone else at their Tottenham Court Road branch, she kept me
Waiting for 15 mins as well, didn‚Äôt even apologise, I found her to be quite rude and she didn‚Äôt even bother to wash her hands before the adjustments, they do try and upsell you heavily and they aren‚Äôt cheap for a 30 mins appointment. Be prepared to pay a lot for lateness and disorganisation.

I would definitely recommend Safestay to anyone looking for clean, safe, and affordable accommodation in London. I look forward to staying here again on my next visit!

showerReviews.reviewText:
Perfect location! It feels like wild camping ‚Äì surrounded by nature and far from the city buzz ‚Äì yet it‚Äôs still close enough to get back to civilisation easily. The pitches are spacious, with the grass cut into clear sections so there‚Äôs no confusion about where to set up.
There‚Äôs a lovely walk along the Thames, and the whole place has a real sense of peace and freedom. I really appreciate the rules too ‚Äì they make sure everyone respects each other‚Äôs rest, and it‚Äôs wonderful to enjoy the sounds of birds instead of music when you want to connect with nature.
The composting loos are clean and perfectly fine, and there‚Äôs a washing-up area (looked like cold water only, though I didn‚Äôt use it). There are also two showers, which seemed nice and clean, but again I didn‚Äôt try them myself.
Overall, this is a great green campsite ‚Äì simple, calm, and with everything you need. Tucked away from the city, but close to everything. No wonder I came back, and I‚Äôll definitely be back again.
showerReviews.author: Joanna Blazejewska

showerReviews.reviewText: Booked 3 nights in a bronze caravan with our grandchildren here as a Christmas treat. On arrival we were upgraded to a silver caravan. Thankyou so much for that. The accommodation was great. Loved the Christmas tree, en suite main bedroom & 2 x twin rooms. Caravan was gleaming & well thought out with all the mod cons you expect nowadays. We had a minor issue with the TV which was resolved immediately. Great customer service. Park is in a lovely location overlooking the Thames estuary with Southend as a backdrop. It had loads to do which the kids loved. They did the bungee trampoline, swimming, the jump, aerial adventure & the climbing walls. Word of warning though. The pool is very very loud, busy & not one for doing lengths. It's a fun pool for families & children at the end of the day. Building work going on outside to modernise the outdoor pool apparently. We loved the park. It was relaxing & quiet where we stayed. I would highly recommend this park. We will come back again next year. Note: We did leave early Sunday lunchtime as we had booked ice skating in Gillingham & had work/school Monday morning. Local access roads to the site are not for the feint hearted but don't let that put you off.
showerReviews.author: Brian Curtin

showerReviews.reviewText: Booked 3 nights in a bronze caravan with our grandchildren here as a Christmas treat. On arrival we were upgraded to a silver caravan. Thankyou so much for that. The accommodation was great. Loved the Christmas tree, en suite main bedroom & 2 x twin rooms. Caravan was gleaming & well thought out with all the mod cons you expect nowadays. We had a minor issue with the TV which was resolved immediately. Great customer service. Park is in a lovely location overlooking the Thames estuary with Southend as a backdrop. It had loads to do which the kids loved. They did the bungee trampoline, swimming, the jump, aerial adventure & the climbing walls. Word of warning though. The pool is very very loud, busy & not one for doing lengths. It's a fun pool for families & children at the end of the day. Building work going on outside to modernise the outdoor pool apparently. We loved the park. It was relaxing & quiet where we stayed. I would highly recommend this park. We will come back again next year. Note: We did leave early Sunday lunchtime as we had booked ice skating in Gillingham & had work/school Monday morning. Local access roads to the site are not for the feint hearted but don't let that put you off.
showerReviews.author: Brian Curtin

showerReviews.reviewText: Treated ourselves to a 4 night stay in a signature diamond 3 bed lodge and spent a fortune for it, we are staying here now and very underwhelmed. Everything in the glorified caravan is standard, not impressed attall. We only had 1 towel each provided, and only 1 single bed in each room was made up, so my children couldn't choose which one to sleep in, and I usually sleep with my youngest on the first night or 2 until she's settled so I had no sheet or pillow case or duvet cover. Welcome staff on gate were friendly but that's about it. Lifeguards all look fed up. Wetherspoons was lovely food and friendly staff. You pay a fortune for a "lodge" but in all honesty it's just a wider silver caravan. Same kettle, toaster,fridge,narrow beds etc. We have stayed in gold caravans with better specifications. Also you pay all that money and still end up with noisy old men as neighbours smoking in their caravan with the door open. Really not impressed. I think we are done with Haven. We had a 3 bed cottage in Cornwall for a week with a pool that was cheaper. What a waste of our money,  soo disappointing.
showerReviews.author: Emma

locations.address: ÓÉà103-109 Southwark St, London SE1 0JQ, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
This hotel was not somewhere I had high hopes for but boy was I wrong.  From the beautifully decorated entrance to the exceptionally warm and welcoming staff was great.  Immediately put me at my ease so if there were issues I would propbably overlook them.  I asked for a fan in our bedroom it was there in minutes, followed by the maintenance man who wondered if there was an issue with the AC (there wasn't, it is just me).  Beautifully clean room with a newly fitted shower which I could have stood in for hours, the pressure was so good.
The free breakfast was great, along with, again, excellence service.  I wanted to take the pancake maker home, it was fabulous.
Small bar with reasonably priced drinks.
I would definitely stay here again.  The Team at this Holiday Inn Express, should be incredibly proud of themselves.

locations.title: The Greenwich Centre
locations.address: ÓÉà12 Lambarde Square, London SE10 9GB, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Feedback on Swimming Pool Management

The swimming pool is being run with little structure or accountability. Staff appear to make decisions as they please rather than following any clear policy. They justify this by calling it a ‚Äúcommunity pool,‚Äù as if that gives them the right to ignore discipline and basic standards.

There is no proper lane management. Swim coaches act as if they own the entire pool. It is common to see 7‚Äì8 adults crammed into one lane while lanes reserved for teaching have only two people casually chatting with a coach. This is unfair and poor utilisation of space.

When I approached the manager to share this feedback, instead of listening, he became defensive right from the start. His first response was, ‚ÄúWe‚Äôve run this pool this way for 10 years. It‚Äôs a community pool. If you don‚Äôt like it, go elsewhere.‚Äù That attitude is unacceptable for someone in a customer-facing role. A colleague of his, clearly junior, was more professional and respectful. The manager, however, was dismissive and arrogant, behaving as if any criticism is a personal insult rather than an opportunity to improve.

His final remark, ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt come if you don‚Äôt like it,‚Äù says everything about his approach to customer service. If I had not already paid in advance, I would have left immediately.

This is not about one incident, but about a culture of poor management and lack of accountability. The pool desperately needs proper policies for lane discipline, fair allocation of space, and above all staff who listen and respect members rather than treat them with contempt
showerReviews.author: Ishtiaq M Ahmed

showerReviews.reviewText:
Staff at the poolside  are just playing by the rules. They are not friendly. They don't have any sense of public service, being flexible or family orientated. No kind, no understanding.
The changing facilities are disgusting and the smell of dirty toilets at all times.
The people in reception are rude and, again,  not flexible, kind, or understanding.
They don't listen to your needs, I. Particular to people with medical conditions that can not follow their instructions and rules.
They charge for the use of hairdryers, which doesn't happen in other Better centres.
The sitting for the swimming view is tiny for the number of swimmers and lessons.
Greenwich, everybody, deserves to be treated better.
Avoid

showerReviews.reviewText:
A few days ago I had a very unpleasant episode in this place‚Ä¶
I was in the changing room preparing my daughters' clothes who were showering after their class, and I went out to see if they had finished. When I was asking my daughter, I turned around, and saw  a man wanted to enter the changing room even though it was occupied by my things. I went to the changing room and told him I was there with my daughters. The man started pushing the other door changing room to see if they were empty, and when he saw that everything was occupied he ask me to help him. I told him to look for another one, since there were more changing room in other corridors and the man told me he wanted a changing room in this corridor and he asked me again to help him. I told him again that I couldn't help him because I was alone with my daughters. The man approached me and said that he thought I was going to help him, and I started to get nervous because I was feeling attacked and my daughters were going to get out of the shower and the man kept insisting that I had to help him!  He asked me many times to help him. I got so nervous that I said bad words and a man who passed by also started attacking me because I was saying bad words to the man and I got even worse and started arguing with that man and meanwhile the other man went into the changing room. The man kept saying things to me when he didn't know what was happening he just started attacking me because I was saying bad words. A young man from the staff appeared and was very helpful to me and I was able to calm down since those two men were attacking me and one of them didn't know what had happened before. The manager came and spoke to the man at the changing room, basically he told me that there wasn't much that could be done because he hadn't seen anything and he made me understand that since I had said bad words and that wasn't the way. So I had to cancel my daughters' classes (who were very happy with their teacher) because I don't want to see that man there and have another problem. Since that day I haven't felt well and it seems very unfair that a man who did that is still there and my daughters can't continue going.
showerReviews.author: Carmen Perez

showerReviews.reviewText:
A mixed bag!

Positives:
- Some staff members are friendly, professional and resourceful, problem-solving around issues. The swim instructor is great!

- Free swimming is a wonderful resource

Negatives:
- Disappointing to pay to swim and find half the pool closed off for a lesson, leaving the lane swimmers to squish together. If I had known there was a swimming class on, I would have not booked to swim during that slot

- Pool hygiene. Sometimes it is ok but sometimes it is GRIM. Warm, cloudy water with multiple clumps of hair and dirt. When it's bad you can see big flecks of stuff floating about as you swim.

- Some staff members are not proactive with communication. Due to a prior issue around information online vs what is available in real life, I would turn up to time slots expecting to swim, then the pool would close after 10 mins. Not sure why the staff member who checked me in did not say anything

How to improve?
- Provide customers with a visual timetable where they can see what else is happening at the pool amongst the differing time slots.

- Stricter rules around pool hygiene. Visitors to rinse before entering the pool, mandatory swim caps. Or more frequent cleaning - a robotic pool vacuum cleaner to use between slots?

- Proactive engagement with visitors.

Tiller already has some great workers there and has so much potential. With a more considered management of information and operations it could be even better!
showerReviews.author: Allissa Tai

showerReviews.reviewText: This centre would be such an asset to Eltham however, the swimming pool is absolutely filthy, there's dirt inside and outside the pool. People are allowed to walk around with shoes on, and to swim without swimming hats. Also, there isn't a shower policy, aka, showering before getting inside the pool, before swimming or after sauna or steam. The changing rooms and toilets are disgusting, hair, dirts and baby napkins left on shelves. Some of the showers do not have doors or shower heads, part of the ceiling is falling a part and the water is either frozen or boiling hot. I don't think this is acceptable and don't think I would visit again, shame cause the spa is great and so would be the pool if it was looked after. The whole swimming area definitely needs refurbishment and updating and a much more severe hygiene policy.
showerReviews.author: Laura

showerReviews.reviewText:
This is a review directed towards the MayWhit  cafe. The Better Health gym is excellent. Usually, our experience is 5 stars, but todays its three

Me and my partner (who have invisible disabilities) arrived a little too early to go swimming, so my partner went to go sit in the cafe while i went to the loo. We often sit in the cafe and wait to go in, and we haven't experienced this before.

While i was in the loo, my partner was targeted by the dark haired lady (after the blonde lady was whispering to to her while looking at my partner), demanding him to order something, while holding a card machine. He explained he was waiting for me to come back and to go into the pool, but she asked him to leave if he wasnt ordering anything! There were multiple people (mostly women, and children, i may add) who were waiting like he was and they were not made to order anything. There was even people eating lunch they had brought with them.

When my partner told me what happened, i decided to go back into the cafe by myself and sit quietly - like my partner. Yhe blonde haired lady even came over to clean the table mext to me, so my presence was known. I was not demanded to order anything, nor leave. This proved that - for whatever reason - they did not want a lone, male patron in their cafe. Even if that was not what they intended, its definitely how it came across to us.

I saw another review similar to this one, and its shocking that this isn't the first time this has happened.
showerReviews.author: Anushka Camm

showerReviews.reviewText: The worst possible place/ club. I subscribed to their swimming lessons for my 7 year old, been using it for few months and there is absolutely no progress, I can teach my daughter better in a bath tub. Coaches have no idea what they are teaching, they dont pay attention to kids, they teach the same thing again. My friends kid, also in the same class, refused to come and now left. Even my kid feels totally demotivated to come and attend classes. I raised with their staff, they couldn't answer, they couldn't explain how they are teaching, how do the work kids strengths and weaknesses. I ended up cancelling the sessions. The staff ia super rude and ignorant.

I don't recommend this swimming pool and the staff definitely need some education.

showerReviews.reviewText:
It could potentially be a good place for families and kids, but it isn‚Äôt!!

The management is really bad.
I got a boy of 7 and a daughter of 4 going to the swimming lessons.

In less than a year I already lost 7 lessons or more, to be honest I stopped counting out of desperation.

There are one or two kids that constantly vomit into the pool.

Therefore they close the pool.

So all the times I drive there, I park the car, I help my kids to put on the swimming suit only to find out they can‚Äôt.

Now because the issue is recurring I believe the management should ban those kids from attending the pool!

Or it is fair that all the other kids systematically lose their lessons?

Also, if the pool is closed why no one bother calling the families so they can avoid a pointless trip, or at least tell the families at the entrance not to change.

Than they say the lesson would be either refunded or recovered, but no one calls and I have to chase them all the times!!

In essence why the management is so careless and indifferent???
showerReviews.author: Stefano Piazza

locations.title: Woolwich Waves
locations.address: ÓÉà49 Woolwich New Rd, London SE18 6EU, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
My kids had their first swimming lessons at the new centre after switching from Water Front. I‚Äôd like to raise a safeguarding concern regarding children‚Äôs swimming lessons at Woolwich Waves.

The parents‚Äô viewing gallery is situated next to the caf√© and is freely accessible to the general public. As a result, individuals with no connection to the lessons ‚Äî including people waiting for buses ‚Äî were able to sit and observe children swimming. This understandably caused concern among several parents, as unrestricted public access to a children‚Äôs viewing area presents a potential safeguarding risk.

I raised this issue with Brayden (Duty Manager) and Bobby (General Manager) to understand how the area is monitored and what measures are in place to manage access. Unfortunately, the concern was met with defensiveness and was largely dismissed rather than treated as a legitimate safeguarding matter. No clear explanation or preventative solution was provided.

It is important to note that other staff members were helpful, understanding, and acknowledged the validity of parents‚Äô concerns, which was appreciated and reassuring.

Safeguarding should be approached proactively, not reactively. It was disappointing to see a serious issue raised by multiple parents not addressed with the care and attention it warrants. I hope Woolwich Waves reviews its safeguarding arrangements and takes appropriate steps to ensure children‚Äôs privacy and safety during swimming lessons.
showerReviews.author: Mohammed Barreh

locations.address: ÓÉàUnit 2 Creek Rd, Mariners Parade, London SE10 9SW, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
The gym is great for the most part, never too busy at the times I go, and there are plenty of machines. I only wish there was a pendulum squat and an incline bench machine, as those are two important pieces of equipment.

I understand that you are trying to minimize waste by not using paper towels, but it really doesn‚Äôt work. There are many times when people use the machines and leave sweat marks on them, and I don‚Äôt want to use my personal towel to wipe off someone else‚Äôs sweat. I get what you‚Äôre trying to do, but unfortunately, it‚Äôs not very practical, especially when every other gym provides paper towels.

Overall, the gym is pretty good, and if those two things were fixed, it would be a solid five-star review.
showerReviews.author: Angelo

showerReviews.reviewText: "The gym boasts excellent equipment and a great atmosphere, but there's a significant need for improvement in cleanliness. The men's locker room has a persistent foul odor, and the urinals are particularly overwhelming, making it difficult to breathe. Installing a running water system through the urinals could help mitigate this issue. Additionally, the soap dispensers at the sinks are frequently empty, which makes proper handwashing challenging. It's also concerning that there are no products available to clean the equipment after use. The absence of hand sanitizer stations around the gym is another point that needs addressing. Despite these issues, I believe the gym has great potential."
showerReviews.author: Jonatas Coghetto

locations.title: PureGym London Charlton
locations.address: ÓÉà7-11 Gallions Rd, New Charlton, London SE7 7SA, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
This gym did improve after changing their layout and is convenient if you need to pop to the shops, but unfortunately I‚Äôve been to over 20 Puregyms around the country as I travel for work, and this is one of the least enjoyable.

Firstly, the main issue is that there are simply too many members for the size of the gym - at peak times (in the free weights area particularly), it is absolutely crammed and thus nigh-on impossible to get a regular routine of exercises done. There are also large groups of school-kids that work out all together and hog equipment. The refurb plan could have used the large area in the main room near the pull-up bars for more free weights, which would have helped the cramping.

Secondly the hygiene of the changing rooms and showers is consistently an issue, with seemingly permanent mould / bad smells, and showers often being out of order. There was even a whole week where there was a leak and the entire gym was closed, and Puregym gave me no sign of when it would reopen, even though they said they would text. This led to me making a couple of 40 min round trips there for no reason, as I‚Äôd been led to believe it would be open - when I DM‚Äôed one of the trainers to ask whether it was back open, as Puregym were of no help, he put on his insta story ‚Äòdo not message me about this‚Äô, which I found rather unhelpful considering I‚Äôm a paying customer.

Thirdly, there is a culture of domineering, macho behaviour and shouting in the free weights area which some of the staff turn a blind eye to. I‚Äôve had a couple of really unpleasant interactions with people starting aggressive interactions around sharing equipment, which I‚Äôve not had at all at other gyms. One of the staff also has a tendency to shout very loudly at their clients and give unsolicited comments on form to random customers, which I cannot block out even with noise-cancelling headphones, which doesn‚Äôt exactly make for the nicest gym experience.

I appreciate that the staff are probably meaning well and we‚Äôre mostly all doing our best but I would suggest to go to another Puregym if you can, as most others are leagues above this one!
showerReviews.author: Daniel Shao

showerReviews.reviewText:
This gym did improve after changing their layout and is convenient if you need to pop to the shops, but unfortunately I‚Äôve been to over 20 Puregyms around the country as I travel for work, and this is one of the least enjoyable.

Firstly, the main issue is that there are simply too many members for the size of the gym - at peak times (in the free weights area particularly), it is absolutely crammed and thus nigh-on impossible to get a regular routine of exercises done. There are also large groups of school-kids that work out all together and hog equipment. The refurb plan could have used the large area in the main room near the pull-up bars for more free weights, which would have helped the cramping.

Secondly the hygiene of the changing rooms and showers is consistently an issue, with seemingly permanent mould / bad smells, and showers often being out of order. There was even a whole week where there was a leak and the entire gym was closed, and Puregym gave me no sign of when it would reopen, even though they said they would text. This led to me making a couple of 40 min round trips there for no reason, as I‚Äôd been led to believe it would be open - when I DM‚Äôed one of the trainers to ask whether it was back open, as Puregym were of no help, he put on his insta story ‚Äòdo not message me about this‚Äô, which I found rather unhelpful considering I‚Äôm a paying customer.

Thirdly, there is a culture of domineering, macho behaviour and shouting in the free weights area which some of the staff turn a blind eye to. I‚Äôve had a couple of really unpleasant interactions with people starting aggressive interactions around sharing equipment, which I‚Äôve not had at all at other gyms. One of the staff also has a tendency to shout very loudly at their clients and give unsolicited comments on form to random customers, which I cannot block out even with noise-cancelling headphones, which doesn‚Äôt exactly make for the nicest gym experience.

I appreciate that the staff are probably meaning well and we‚Äôre mostly all doing our best but I would suggest to go to another Puregym if you can, as most others are leagues above this one!
showerReviews.author: Daniel Shao

showerReviews.reviewText:
*** Do not go here. Gross. ***

Main gym has ok equipment. Recent upgrades appreciated. However the weight room is always a mess. Weights everywhere and super-cramped (dangerously so?).

*** The men's changing room is horrible. Most of the lockers are broken, it's overrun with mould and mildew, and the toilets stink and often overflow,. I won‚Äôt even touch the showers. They‚Äôre filthy, usually broken, and only spray out boiling hot water. Today there was a literal used bandage stuck to the floor in the middle of the lockers.

General Management and Cleaners are entirely MIA. Never see them - ever. Only PTs.

I've written to the central Customer Care team, who've mostly ignored my emails or told me to take it up with the local gym staff (as if it's my job?). Three stars for the gym, but minus three for the changing rooms. Would give it a zero if I could. Don‚Äôt go here. Gross.

REPLY TO PUREGYM: I did email you. You ignored my email until I chased you. Your response was to take no ownership and tell me sort it myself with the local management.

locations.title: YMCA of Greenwich
locations.address: ÓÉà50 E Putnam Ave, Greenwich, CT 06830, United States

showerReviews.reviewText:
I am a swimmer and can comment only my experience swimming as a guest. I visit Ys all over the country and this was the best pool I've ever been in as well as the first true Olympic sized pool.

The water is impeccably clean and the lanes are wide. In long course format, they have 8 lanes that can be very comfortably split (not all may be open depending on the time). I'm an early morning swimmer and the pool had people in all lanes but room for splits. Nice temperature for active swimmers.

The locker room upstairs was well maintained in general with ample dehumidification. They do supply body wash, shampoo and conditioner in the showers. Steam shower and sauna are available. It's not a huge locker room but it's also not the only one.

There is a historic wood paneled lounge that is really lovely.

Six visits as a guest before you start paying half price. The $10/day (half the normal day rate of $20 for an adult) would be well worth it to jump into such a great pool.
showerReviews.author: Tamiko Toland

There is a good small pool for kids development, as well as an impressive Olympic sized pool.
There is a clean family changing room, just with the one shower room but with three private changing rooms as well. And there are obviously other changing facilities for over 18s.
Definitely a good option for sports, children or adults.

locations.title: Community Sauna Baths - Camberwell
locations.address: ÓÉàRuskin Pk, Denmark Hill, London SE5 8EL, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: First time at Camberwell Community Sauna inside Ruskin Park. It is at the bottom of Denmark Hill close to Kings College hospital and Denmark Hill train station and on the 42/68/468 bus route as well as other buses coming from Camberwell. I agree with other reviewers, very thoughtfully designed  and nice touches such as a big container of herbal tea, water and aromatherapy oils inside the wet sauna. There are metal cage lockers so bring a padlock to store valuables. Bring two small towels, one to sit on (a rule) and one to dry off / put over your shoulders as you walk in the outside spaces. There are three sauna huts, one dry sauna for silence, one dry sauna where you can talk, one of these is hotter than the other and a lower temperature wet sauna. They were all clean. There are a few private charging cubicles, one unisex and one each for male /female. The staff are very friendly and helpful. You don‚Äôt need to bring your phone as they find your name and time on the booking system. I took a piece of paper with receipt number in case. The sessions last one hour 30. Everyone there was relaxed, friendly and it felt like a welcoming space. I went with friend and we tried the wool-felt sauna caps - not seen those before! May get my own as apparently tradition in Scandinavia to keep head cooler, protect hair, reduce overheating and helping body to regulate temperature so less strain on cardiovascular system.Highly recommended giving this community sauna a go. Definitely feels like a community vibes place.
showerReviews.author: H WK

showerReviews.reviewText:
My full original review is below, but I went back yesterday for a second visit, and wanted to update.

In my prior review I mentioned finding the chat in the sauna a bit loud. Perhaps I was unlucky last time, as this time it was jut fine. I guess if there is a larger noisy party in the sauna it can be noisy, but there is a silent sauna on-site, so I think I over-reacted on my first visit.

There was also plenty of space this time ... Again I think I over-reacted last time!

Please do go to this amazing new community space.

--

A fabulous resource in a beautiful spot. Really well designed, with good facilities. 3 saunas, 2 plunge pools, showers, changing areas ... 90 min session is well worth it and left me really revitalized.

Negatives: When sold out it can feel a bit crowded, though I have been to saunas in the past that were much more crowded, where people were pressed up against each other, and it isn't that bad. It is more that everyone is very shy about making any physical contact at all, making the space feel a bit limited.

I think it could be a bit hotter.

And I did experience people talking pretty loudly in the saunas, which does reduce the gentle power of the process. I don't know why, the noise level just rises, even though staff ask people to keep the noise down, it drops for a while when they do this, but then rises again. People don't seem to be capable of talking quietly to each other, but talk as though they were in a pub!
showerReviews.author: Adam Brett

locations.title: Greenwich Park Toilets North
locations.address: ÓÉàLondon SE10 8XJ, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: It was with trepidation that I approached the entrance to the Greenwich Park toilets. I mean, these are the very facilities that men like Christopher Wren, Galileo and Eddie Murphy used while forming the Royal Society! How could a regular pleb like me ever consider making the deep impact those esteemed gentlemen of science did when their diet consisted of turnips, beer and mutton? I made my way inside and was instantly charmed with the decor. A large fresco hung above the inside of the door featuring caricatures of famous men, all in a state of repose on various marble commodes. I paid my 5 pounds and found a stall at the end of the line that was named after Sir Issac Newton. Whether or not the great man had ever actually evacuated here was a moot point. As the string quartet played softly in the corner of my stall, the valet removed my britches and smiled knowingly. I was handed the Sunday Times and left in peace. After flushing (a burst of spring water with a hint of mint), I was directed to the gold plated sink to have my hands washed gently by a buxom maid dressed as Moll Flanders. I left with a spring in my step and feeling light and refreshed continued my tour of famous London toilets. Up next, Waterloo train station mens 3rd stall. Will it compare favourably? Stay tuned to find out.
showerReviews.author: Paul Grimes

locations.title: David Lloyd Kidbrooke Village
locations.address: ÓÉàCorner of, Kidbrooke Park Rd, Weigall Rd, London SE12 8HG, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
A disappointing trial.
Firstly when I started my trial there is clear box stating ‚Äòrequest a call back for induction‚Äô nobody called me back. I called on the day my trial started and nobody picked up. Eventually on the Monday I managed to get booked in for Tuesday and specifically asked if this would be the date my trial started to which I was told this would be honored. Disappointingly my trial ended on day 13 of the initial date, not even day 14 . However the reality is that was day 9 of my trial as nobody booked me in for an initial induction and having spoken to the sales team it was unlikely this would be honoured but no one got back in contact about this.

Realistic observations from a regular gym goer:
There are far better local gyms for a fraction of the price - equipment is stiff and needs oiling.
Spa: heaving on an evening not enough space, towels etc everywhere. Has no sense of quality despite the price point. I have also developed a rash from swimming and passed this on to the operations manager with no reply (I am a regular swimmer and in 30 years never had this and don‚Äôt suffer from sensitive skin) the chemicals in the jacuzzi burn your eyes too, I‚Äôve seen lots of forums about this too!
Classes: can‚Äôt fault an amazing schedule and verity of options, disappointingly my trial allowed me to book classes for this weekend which I was expected to attend but the trial ended Friday morning so I couldn‚Äôt attend?
Club: great food and staff, a great place to co-work but avoid 4-6pm as there are swarms of children.

All in all a pretty disappointing experience given I didn‚Äôt get to complete a 14 day trail, spent a week with a terrible reaction rash and was provided with incorrect information.
showerReviews.author: Hayley Peverley

showerReviews.reviewText:
A disappointing trial.
Firstly when I started my trial there is clear box stating ‚Äòrequest a call back for induction‚Äô nobody called me back. I called on the day my trial started and nobody picked up. Eventually on the Monday I managed to get booked in for Tuesday and specifically asked if this would be the date my trial started to which I was told this would be honored. Disappointingly my trial ended on day 13 of the initial date, not even day 14 . However the reality is that was day 9 of my trial as nobody booked me in for an initial induction and having spoken to the sales team it was unlikely this would be honoured but no one got back in contact about this.

Realistic observations from a regular gym goer:
There are far better local gyms for a fraction of the price - equipment is stiff and needs oiling.
Spa: heaving on an evening not enough space, towels etc everywhere. Has no sense of quality despite the price point. I have also developed a rash from swimming and passed this on to the operations manager with no reply (I am a regular swimmer and in 30 years never had this and don‚Äôt suffer from sensitive skin) the chemicals in the jacuzzi burn your eyes too, I‚Äôve seen lots of forums about this too!
Classes: can‚Äôt fault an amazing schedule and verity of options, disappointingly my trial allowed me to book classes for this weekend which I was expected to attend but the trial ended Friday morning so I couldn‚Äôt attend?
Club: great food and staff, a great place to co-work but avoid 4-6pm as there are swarms of children.

All in all a pretty disappointing experience given I didn‚Äôt get to complete a 14 day trail, spent a week with a terrible reaction rash and was provided with incorrect information.
showerReviews.author: Hayley Peverley

locations.title: JD Gyms Ipswich
locations.address: ÓÉà3, Suffolk Retail Park, London Rd, Ipswich IP1 2EJ, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
I joined when it opened, along with my partner.

The gym itself is crowded with machines, the lighting manages to be both too dim (generally) and too bright (spotlights) simultaneously. The music is almost always too loud, so you have to turn your own music up to dangerous levels in order to hear it. The changing rooms/toilets aren't available 24/7, and finding smaller weights to add on is frequently an issue. The company is also charging me ¬£4 more a month than other members who signed up at the same time.... And refuses to tell me why.

However they have the best yoga instructor once a week.... If they leave, I leave.

Staff on site are generally pretty good.... I did have issues accessing the disabled facilities (you have to ask to be let in every time, because apparently having a disability makes you a naughty child?!), with one staff member looking me up and down and asking why I needed to use the disabled toilet.
showerReviews.author: Jennifer McCarthy

showerReviews.reviewText:
Facilities: 6/10
Staff: 9/10
Customer service: 2/10

JD Gyms are after short term customers and don't expect you to return.

The facilities are alright, considering it is 24 hour, the showers can get a little gross, but with the number of people using them, and the time of day I was using the gym, it doesn't surprise me.

I would notice sometime machines would stay in an unclean state for a few days in a row.

Anytime I interacted with the local staff, they were helpful and friendly. They were also able to bridge with the various gym personalities.

My problem with the company is their customer service. If you have a problem, they don't seem to try and resolve it. They won't treat it case by case.
You are not guided to the customer service, you must search for it, and even then, it is email contact only.

JD Gyms do not seek to retain customers, they just want to get what they can out of you whilst they have you.

Cheap local option, but not a great option.
showerReviews.author: Dommy .L

locations.title: Energie Fitness Eltham
locations.address: ÓÉà99 Well Hall Rd, London SE9 6SU, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: I used to be a member of this gym and I would never go back. I had to cancel my membership last minute and I found out that somewhere in the fine print there is a 30 day cancellation clause which was NOT made clear at the time of signing up. I had to cancel my membership just after my payment went out so I paid for 2 months where I didn't use the gym at all. They are not at all accommodating, it's virtually impossible to get through on the phone to them and they respond to emails at their own leisure (don't be surprised if you wait nearly a month for a response). Don't expect privacy in the showers either, the doors don't lock and and are see through. Essentially their end game is profit, they don't care about their customers. I will personally be going to pure gym, it's cheaper and it's open 24 hours!

showerReviews.reviewText:
This was by far the worst spa experience I‚Äôve ever had. The service was poor, and the room was untidy. I received a body scrub without even being offered a shower to rinse off afterward. The customer service was extremely disappointing. I would not recommend this place to anyone.

I was only five minutes late, and I even called ahead to inform the receptionist. yet the service I received was still disappointing. That level of hygiene is unacceptable. Second, claiming there‚Äôs no shower after a body scrub is one thing‚Äîbut a staff member later said the shower is not working..That‚Äôs just unprofessional. Overall, the service was poor, and I won‚Äôt be returning. Please work on your spa‚Äîthere‚Äôs really nothing worth recommending.

locations.title: St Christopher's Inn Greenwich
locations.address: ÓÉà189 Greenwich High Rd, London SE10 8JQ, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
I stayed here for 1 night back in June of this year.  I chose it because it seemed like a good option for getting to/from to the O2 Arena without having to go too close to the city, and also because it suited my super low budget.

Pros: It's quite literally right beside the train station (but far enough away that noise isn't an issue!).  It's also on a regular bus route that will take you directly to and from the O2 Arena.  The bar below the hostel has lovely food, a pretty decent selection of drinks, good music playing, and very friendly and helpful staff!

Cons: My main complaint is that the shower rooms were very dirty.  When I first checked in on the afternoon that I arrived, I had a look in the shared shower room and they very clearly hadn't been cleaned in a while.  There was litter and left over clothes and towels laying around, and all the floors looked quite dirty.  I showered very early the next morning and it was still just as dirty as the previous afternoon.  Also, not so much a "Con", but just a heads up... the floors and doors in the actual hostel/sleeping areas are quite old and squeaky (much more than the pictures would suggest), so earplugs are most definitely a necessity if you're a light sleeper.  Also, the air conditioning in the room consisted of a single small fan on the wall... which wasn't ideal in a full dorm as this summer was particularly hot all over Europe.

Overall, an OK hostel for the price, and perfectly fine for 1 night on a budget... but dirty/neglected shower rooms are never a good sign.
showerReviews.author: Ryan Friel
