showerReviews.reviewText:
The pub itself is great, the rooms and beds are passable, but the bathrooms were poorly maintained, constantly out of toilet paper, and sometimes out of soap, some toilet seats were broken.
Common area or "chill area" has a non working fridge and non working microwave, only the kettle works, and the sink area look messy every time, the toilet there looked very disgusting. I know part of it is due to some uncivilised guests, but the fact that there's no maintenance and upkeeping makes it bad for everyone else.
Also my experience there was made worse by one of the staff members, this young blonde girl with glasses name Chris, if I'm not mistaken, at least twice.
Very unfriendly and unengaging attitude, like she couldn't be bothered and didn't want to be there.  When I made my booking, I booked two days in one bed, and then the rest of the days in a different bed, but in the same room, and I was still told that I couldn't leave my stuff in there, even though I was only changing beds,  and that I could pay to use their lockers, if I wanted somewhere to leave my stuff, so I had to wait until check-in time to put my stuff back in the room. When I checked back in, even the different staff member that checked me in was surprised that I had to get a new card to get back in the same room where I was already. Completely useless and impractical, and it seem that she wanted to make it as inconvenient as possible.
When I checked out, I've noticed that I had forgotten my towel inside the room, next to my bed, so i went back to the hostel, and she was there. I've asked if it was possible for her to come with me and let me quickly check if it was still there, something that would take only a minute, and she said I wasn't allowed to go back, and that she would contact housekeeping, and had to wait for their reply, but already dismissing me saying that house keeping probably threw it away already.  I've waited roughly 10 minutes, asked her if she gotten any reply, and she just said that they found nothing, and to me it just seem that she only said that just so I would finally go away. Because I had a train to catch, I left it there. I know it was just a towell, and was a minor inconvenience, but the lack of will to be helpful, and to do  the bare minimum was astonishing. I'm surprised that if someone forgets something in the room, the procedure is to immediately throw it away, rather than keep it in a lost and found. Unless of course, they dont really do that, and they have a lost and found, and she was simply just lying, because she couldn't be bothered. And it wasn't even busy, this was before check in time, so she had plenty of free time, specially because she was just chatting with her colleagues on the bar.

To be fair, the little interaction I've had with other staff, was more positive, and they at least seem more helpful and friendly. But the negative experience with this staff member plus the poor conditions I've already mentioned, made this much of a negative experience to recommend it or to book again. There are better options out there.
showerReviews.author: Onurb Senutna

showerReviews.reviewText:
I usually stay in YHA hostels, but due to a lack of availability when I visited London in June 2025, I had to find an alternative place to stay. After some research, I found  St Christopher's Inn Greenwich due to its extremely low cost. As this was the first time I'd use this place, I was a little bit skeptical at first.

However, when I arrived, I was highly impressed with everything from start to finish. As the weather was extremely warm when I visited, they put the effort into putting fans into the room I was in, which although was loud, was understandable given the conditions. Despite this, I still had a great night's sleep. I also found the price to be extremely good value for the room and free drink that I got, given the location of the hostel.

However, the one thing I was a little unsure of were the rooms. I was given a bottom bunk, so I was essentially on the floor when I was sleeping, which I was a bit unsure about. Another thing were the lockers for each of the bed, which although is a good idea given the layout of the room, I was a little bit paranoid about due to the security of it.

Overall, I was very pleased with the experience that I had here. I'd certainly stay here again as well as recommend it to other people.
showerReviews.author: mjvdz98

showerReviews.reviewText:
The location is great. It is close to the train station, bus stops, the University of Greenwich and not too far from the O2 Arena. The staff are friendly and helpful, and the overall value for money is good.

Unfortunately, cleanliness was an issue during my stay. The room was quite dusty, and I found myself sneezing a lot. I also noticed bed bugs, which was disappointing. The shared toilets were frequently clogged, especially in the mornings and evenings.

It has potential given the convenient location and kind staff, but maintenance and hygiene standards need significant improvement.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Where to begin, where to begin...

My first 2 days, I had an unwashed blanket and no pillow (was told they were out of pillows at the moment and I would get one when they got more in).
The third day, I talked to (who I assume is) the hostel manager, who seemed surprised that I didn't get a pillow when I first checked in (he went into one of the storerooms and got me a pillow no problem).
I ended up with two pillows that night (found a mostly-flat one on my bed once I got back). However, the next morning- and I promise you I'm not making this up- one of the housekeeping people walked into the room, literally took the pillow out from under my head as I slept, then walked out. I know because I woke up long enough to feel the pillow get pulled, then rolled over and went back to sleep.
Other than that:
The showers cut off after about 15-20 seconds, as do the lights for the toilets (becomes incredibly annoying very fast).
The rooms (those with 9 bunks) are extremely cramped, and I heard the 6- bunk rooms aren't much better.
I also got sick during my stay (easy to do when 9 people share a room meant for 3 (at the most).
The best day was the day I left, would most definitely NOT recommend, nor return for ANY amount of time. Only giving it a 1-star because I can't give it any lower.
showerReviews.author: Chris Cross

showerReviews.reviewText: The accommodation is really poor. The rooms are tiny. It"s not convenient, no place to put your things: not a single chair or a table. The showers are made so that all the water is on the floor, you can't even turn in the bathroom. The hostel is a labyrinth.  In case you have a heavy bag be ready to move it upstairs, then downstairs and then again. Breakfasts are non eatable. Nobody cares that there should be enough food for everybody. Here they serve: bread, butter, jam, ham ,cheese. Sometimes, if you are lucky, they will bring you milk and there would be instant coffee in the machine. Although it is located within the east reach of the greenwich centre. And that is a big bonus

showerReviews.reviewText:
Alright for a couple of nights but wouldn't recommend it for a longer period. The building is an old large manor house, however if you enter a shower room, the shower cabins a very tiny. I've stayed 3 nights but not one day had a normal shower. It was either too hot or too cold and each shower cabin has a button that needs to be pressed for the water to start again.
I was in a 6 bed room and to my surprise, there ware no hangers there so everybody just dumped their stuff all over the floor, no lockers either.
Beds were wobbly and my top bunk was shaking a lot and wasn't easy to climb into. Beds themselves, I mean the buil was poor, matresses were OK.
What's more, the hostel had a power outage that resulted in no wireless for the night and no light and electricity in the cafe area. Reception staff wasn't exactly sure when the power issue was to be fixed. In terms of location itself, it feels very residential, rather quieter that some hostels. Also,  in terms of getting to the city, you need to either get a bus or walk one mile to the station, so cummuting wise it takes an hour to get to the city and as there's no tube nearby, you need to waste a bus fare just to catch a train.
showerReviews.author: Thomas Deep

locations.title: NX London Hostel
locations.address: ÓÉà323A New Cross Rd, London SE14 6AS, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: BED BUGS!!! The management of this hostel is awful, I feel sorry for the staff which was always friendly and helpful, but they had limitations. The place is very dirty, I saw mice twice and I suspect the bedding isn‚Äôt properly washed or even changed from guest to guest. I booked a 4-bed room, thinking it would be better since there‚Äôs less people, but it was completely the opposite. There were bedbugs from eggs to mature ones all over the room, only myself and another guest were staying in there, so the receptionist was very nice to put us in a private room. The problem is that when we woke up the next day, the night receptionist mixed up our clothes in black bags, some stuff was missing and some other was in the hallway outside the laundry room, where anyone could access it. We doubted that he had washed everything at 60oC (which is the protocol to kill bedbugs), so we asked to wash our clothes again, but one more time the person in charge didn‚Äôt wash at the proper temperature and their tumble dryer wasn‚Äôt working, they were using a wash & dry machine, so our clothes were damp. We sent an email to the management asking if we could proper wash & dry our clothes in an external laundry service and if they could cover the costs, and they responded very defensive saying we were lying about the hostel having bedbugs, said that anyway bedbugs weren‚Äôt considered as a health issue since they don‚Äôt spread diseases and threaten to charge us a fine if we took pictures of the place and made public ‚Äúfalse‚Äù complaints, they have a strange non-refund policy regardless the reason of request and also about taking photos/videos of the hostel. In resume, they know the problem they are facing, but instead of dealing with that professionally, they simply ignore it and are rude to people that express their dissatisfaction. It‚Äôs a shame because the hostel is well located, the staff is nice and the breakfast is great for the price, there would be a lot of potential if the management cared about their guests and business.
showerReviews.author: Juliana Santos

showerReviews.reviewText:
I have been here twice, once 2-3 years ago for 3 months, and I'm here now and have been for 2 months. And will come again in the new year, and in future years.

The place has improved a lot in those years I was gone, and I'm sure will continue to.

The people who work at NX are extremely nice, and have a positive culture, and always helpful. The 2 cleaners are amazing at their job, and believe me that is needed sometimes, some people are so careless leaving disgusting messes for everyone (in kitchen, and bathroom), but it goes away the next day.

The hostel is comprised of long terms stayees, medium terms (like me), and short terms. the place is quirky, it has breakfast, the price reflects the fact that the place is still being developed, and I see the vision, I look forward to coming back in future years to see what more changes.

I've not broken any rules so I've never been in those experiences that a lot of negative reviewers experience. But if the simple rules are followed, like not being drunk, or unruly, or eating food in the rooms etc.. then expect a positive experience, I really do not have anything negative to say.

NX has seasonal discounts, and goldsmiths student discounts (10%), I am a student of goldsmiths.

By the way the place is kinda perfect for goldsmith students, I've stayed in 2 different Goldsmith dorms, Loring, and Surrey House, NX is right across the street to the Library, much easier for me personally.

I think NX should brand more for Goldsmiths students slowly over time, as a long term project, maybe developing some student rooms slowly, and perhaps in time a student culture can develop which may attract new business opportunities that students bring to the table. And when NX is in final stage of completion, it could also bring proposal to Goldsmith, who have an issue with housing students, and only guarantee first year student housing, and also money issues (the uni that is), , I'm sure they will consider it on condition that NX is on par with regulatory standards, which are not strict (believe me).
Due to my circumstance, I'm guaranteed housing with Goldsmith throughout my whole education, I still see NX as good as any student dorm I've been too, except of course it's a hostel and not a private room, and the lack of students, being the only relevant differences.

anyway
It is what it is, and it's a nice place.

edit: cos i read some other reviews: and there was a bed bug experience 2-3 years ago, I personally didn't get any, but the room was cleared for room de-bugging, and that was that, if I had bed bugs, I'd be grossed out too, but the sheets are cleaned, you can see them being cleaned after changing cos the room where they are cleaned is usually open when the cleaning ladies clean them. You can request new sheets, as I have, but not for bed bugs, just cos I've had them for a month and they needed changing.

And the music is loud at night on most days, but that's cos it's next to a small concert venue, there's a warning on the website about it.

the staff is not rude, and if they were I suspect they were very busy, and you took it as rude, or/and you were just being rude yourself.

there's 2 to 3 bathrooms on each floor, so when someone says there's not enough bathrooms, it's not like a room will suddenly appear magically , and a new bathroom comes into existence, yes sometimes it's annoying, but if you check each floor there's usually a bathroom free, in fact always in my experience, there's literally like 8 or 10 bathrooms across the whole building. And the bathrooms can end up gross cos there's gross people amongst all people, it is gone the next day, the cleaning ladies do their job well. and I like the bathrooms, they feel like a bathroom in a home, and not a urinal at a bar. I've been to other hostels years back, many, in London, and the bathrooms in NX are actually better, there's more space, there's a toilet, and a shower in the majority, it's homely, and I genuinely appreciate that about the place.
showerReviews.author: Sebastian Nielsen

First lets talk about the hotel location, hotel are further down if you by foot from Barking Station. Walking distance 15-20mins, if you with big luggage I will say please avoid this hotel. And Barking is not the "London", some gangster will spitting infront of you,

2nd, the hotel are next to the Ibis Barking, don't go to the wrong hotel. Your hotel is really budget, room without the hair dryer, small bed, but cozy, no soundproof, if you stay at the 1st floor near the main road, I will say you couldn't sleep all day long.

3rd, the breakfast just simple, if you met a group of tour, you should imagine the noisy.

Hotel not provide drinking water, only pipe water for drink. Even the hit water also from the coffee machine.

Overall I not recommend this hotel. In this price range, the real budget hotel arr worthy than this Budger Ibis.

locations.title: InterContinental London - the O2 by IHG
locations.address: ÓÉà1 Waterview Dr, London SE10 0TW, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
We booked a spontaneous 3D2N stay at the InterContinental in London for my birthday weekend ‚Äî a little ‚Äúwhy not?‚Äù moment to celebrate. The views and location were lovely, but a few things made the stay feel less special than we hoped.

We were initially told that breakfast would be ¬£25 per person for the whole stay, but we were later charged ¬£80, which felt disappointing and misleading.

Some of the room essentials were missing too. After a small mishap with my dress, I couldn‚Äôt find a garment or sewing kit, and even basics like toothbrushes and toothpaste weren't provided ‚Äî something I usually expect at a hotel of this level.

At both breakfast and the Skybar, we were given the bill before we‚Äôd even finished ordering or eating. It left us feeling rushed and slightly uncomfortable, especially during what was supposed to be a relaxed birthday weekend.

The shower leaked quite a bit, and we had to use multiple towels just to prevent the floor from becoming slippery.

We were also surprised to find that parking was ¬£52 per night, seemingly regardless of how long the car is actually parked ‚Äî something to be aware of if you‚Äôre driving.

Overall, it felt like we mainly paid for the view and the location rather than the full 5-star experience. I truly hope these details improve, because the hotel has so much potential to offer a genuinely memorable stay.

Oh, forgot to mention the lovely housekeeper or room attendant who greeted us in the morning Nov 30 floor 14.
showerReviews.author: YourFoodTaster

We booked a spontaneous 3D2N stay at the InterContinental in London for my birthday weekend ‚Äî a little ‚Äúwhy not?‚Äù moment to celebrate. The views and location were lovely, but a few things made the stay feel less special than we hoped.

We were initially told that breakfast would be ¬£25 per person for the whole stay, but we were later charged ¬£80, which felt disappointing and misleading.

Some of the room essentials were missing too. After a small mishap with my dress, I couldn‚Äôt find a garment or sewing kit, and even basics like toothbrushes and toothpaste weren't provided ‚Äî something I usually expect at a hotel of this level.

At both breakfast and the Skybar, we were given the bill before we‚Äôd even finished ordering or eating. It left us feeling rushed and slightly uncomfortable, especially during what was supposed to be a relaxed birthday weekend.

The shower leaked quite a bit, and we had to use multiple towels just to prevent the floor from becoming slippery.

We were also surprised to find that parking was ¬£52 per night, seemingly regardless of how long the car is actually parked ‚Äî something to be aware of if you‚Äôre driving.

Overall, it felt like we mainly paid for the view and the location rather than the full 5-star experience. I truly hope these details improve, because the hotel has so much potential to offer a genuinely memorable stay.

Oh, forgot to mention the lovely housekeeper or room attendant who greeted us in the morning Nov 30 floor 14.
showerReviews.author: YourFoodTaster

showerReviews.reviewText:
Fantastic hotel set in possibly the best location in London, the direct access to the o2 made shopping easy and convenient. Parking was reasonable and right at the entrance.
Our room was amazing with a view from directly above the o2, triple aspect windows so views all around the area.
The room was a good size and very comfortable, comfy bed and very clean. Bathroom had both a twin shower and a separate bath.
Breakfast choices were excellent with a wonderful open view of the river and finance district.
Staff were very friendly and immediately courteous, desk service was swift.
Location was great to travel into the city. Overall excellent experience and we will return.
showerReviews.author: Lee Bayliffe

locations.title: Aloft London Excel
locations.address: ÓÉàOne Eastern Gateway, Royal Victoria Dock, London E16 1FR, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Stayed here a few nights with husband and 2 small kids aged 3 and 6. Our room had 2 double beds and a shower room with shower gel and shampoo. Black out blinds and little fridge and kettle . The bed was clean and very cozy.

We had booked last minute and was greeted by Harry on front desk. Who was very welcoming and smiling. It was the start of a wonderful first stay.

The suna and steam room are great size and lovely . And the swimming pool was great and good temperature for the kids.

Good transport links to the greenwhich o2. Our stay came with breakfast. Great options and fresh food. Lovely service especially form a young slim black boy with short hair, Indian lady and a girl from Hong Kong named Anisha.

Was all lovely ‚Ä¶ no complaints. Chinese restaurant round the corner as we didn‚Äôt stay for dinner only had booked breakfast. Would return. Thank you!
showerReviews.author: AJ Anderson

showerReviews.author: AJ Anderson

showerReviews.reviewText:
Stayed here for an event that was taking place for the whole weekend. It‚Äôs a nice hotel and very convenient location for DLR + Excel Centre.

There was a few things though that made the rating lower.
First night we stayed we went to the restaurant to eat. Whilst the service + food was good, we didn‚Äôt really expect staff to essentially push us to verbally give a positive review, along with asking to do the same online.
Then around 9pm, we had someone knock the door and after answering it tell one of our group that ‚ÄúI know you are all excited for comic con, but can you please keep the noise down‚Äù
We believe this was maybe the hotel manager, but we were all just chatting at a reasonable indoor voice volume and it was only our friend that was preparing hot drinks near the door, that seemed to have warranted this ‚Äòcomplaint‚Äô as the talking would have been louder if you was right by the door.
To note - throughout our stay we heard doors slamming, people running up and down the hallways and on the Saturday those that were staying next to us were having a full on karaoke session and banging against the wall.
We were there for the event but not for the same reasons as potentially other guests so assumptions were definitely made about us.

After returning to our room each evening after a long day working the event, we would find that not enough towels were provided, being given chamomile tea when we had used the breakfast tea supply only, and finding what looked like a purple juice stain on some of the bed sheets.
The light where the coffee/tea was stored kept turning on and off throughout the night which felt like someone else was in the room.
Also the WiFi + tv was rubbish- not really great if you wanted to connect any devices.

Would we stay again? Maybe, but we have stayed in other hotels around the area that whilst are not as close as this one to the Excel, we had better experiences.
showerReviews.author: MidnightPicasso

showerReviews.reviewText:
Deceptive pricing on website, advertised ¬£120 but came up to around ¬£175 all in for one night plus ¬£25 refundable deposit (double room).

Room was clean, but several essentials were either broken or inadequate:

‚Ä¢ One of the blackout blinds was improperly fitted, letting light into the room and disrupting our sleep.
‚Ä¢ The room was unseasonably hot for late October even with the thermostat on the lowest possible setting.
‚Ä¢ Flusher on the toilet was flimsy and got stuck when pressed.
‚Ä¢ Sink plug had to be removed by hand due to faulty mechanism.
‚Ä¢ Mattress kept sliding exposing hard corners of the bed frame, which bruised my shin.
‚Ä¢ Body wash in the shower was empty, not enough to use as it was not refilled before our stay.
‚Ä¢ Provided only a single 330ml can of water for a two person booking.

Finally, breakfast was okay but no vegetarian protein option except for eggs. Overheard another guest getting a refund at the restaurant whilst eating dinner. However, we found the food to be acceptable.
showerReviews.author: Dan Mitchell
